title: sen_no_rikyu_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]] who was introduced in the [[GUDAGUDA Shin Yamatai-koku]] event. Sen no Rikyu is known as a progenitor of [i]chanoyu[/i], or "The Way of Tea", in particular of [i]wabi-cha[/i] which emphasizes simplicity. For some reason, Rikyu appears as a petite female even though [[Oda Nobunaga (fate)|]] has always known him as a towering old man. Her third ascension is locked until players complete a Saint Graph unlock quest.

[spoilers]In actuality, she is an amalgamation of the grudge of people killed unfairly by [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi (fate)|]]; which includes Sen no Rikyu himself [i]and[/i] a girl named [b][[Komahime (fate)|]][/b], whose collective appearance this Servant is based on.[/spoilers]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Albino (a1b1n0623)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sonozaki Mie]]

title: outie_navel
body:
A belly button ([[navel]]) that outwardly protrudes from the belly of the character/person.

The inverse being an "innie" navel (where it appears to be sunken in a small pit on the belly).

Most often seen on [[pregnant]] women as the growing womb pushes on and out the navel from the inside, especially during middle to late stages of pregnancy. Can also be seen on males and non-pregnant females as well, generally associated with either non-pregnancy related belly expansion/inflation, or just how the belly button had ended up since the belly button (navel) is formed from the child side remains of the umbilical cord after birth and the cutting of said cord.

title: bodyboard
body: A bodyboard or boogie board is a hydrodynamic foam board used for surfing.  They're shorter than [[surfboard|surfboards]] and are most commonly used with the rider on their knees or stomach as opposed to standing on it.

title: hoverboard
body:
A [[skateboard]] or [[surfboard]]-like sci-fi or fantasy device that utilizes some means of levitation to allow it to either fly or hover above the ground.   Hover boards were first described by author M. K. Joseph in a 1967 science fiction novel, and popularized by the [[Back to the Future]] film franchise.

Should not be confused with [[self-balancing scooter]]s, which some companies have taken the term hoverboard to refer to their products.

h4. See also

* [[flyboard]]
* [[snowboard]]

title: oomichi_hiromi
body:
A character from [[Link! Like! Love Live!]] introduced in the 105th year (2025). 

A 2nd-year high school student who does part-time work at [[Omicho Market]]. Despite appearances, she is quite shy and prone to breaking into strange ways of speaking out of nervousness. She is also a big fan of school idols, especially [[Kachimachi Kosuzu]].

title: sumo
body:
A [[Japan]]ese competitive [[wrestling]] sport where a [[wrestler]] attempts to force another wrestler either down to the ground or out of a circular ring. It is considered the national sport of Japan.

Traditional sumo wrestler, or [i]rikishi[/i] (力士), typically features heavy yet [[muscular]] build (that is often mistakenly believed or depicted as being [[fat]] or [[obese]]), and is wearing [[chonmage]] hair and [[mawashi]] during the match.

Tagged also used for

* Describing the action and stance of a character.
* The appearance of a character in Sumo attire. (e.g. [[mawashi]])

h4. See also

* [[gunbai]]  - used by scoring referees in sumo wrestling matches
* [[E. Honda]]

title: gateball
body:
"Gateball is a mallet team sport similar to croquet. It is a fast-paced, non-contact, highly-strategic team game, which can be played by anyone regardless of age or gender. 

"Gateball is played on a rectangular court 20–25 metres long and 15–20 metres wide. Each court has three gates and a goal pole. The game is played by two teams (red and white) of up to five players. Each player has a numbered ball corresponding to their playing order. The odd-numbered balls are red and the even-numbered balls are white. Teams score one point for each ball hit through a gate and two points for hitting the goal pole, in accordance with the rules. A game of gateball lasts for thirty minutes and the winner is the team with the most points at the end of the game." [1] 

h4. See also 

* [1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gateball

title: souvenir_doll_(blue_archive)
body:
A temporary in-game item of the game [[Blue Archive]] that was added during the "Moonlight Dream" event.

It's a spherical [[character_doll|doll]] resembling the character [[Kisaki_(blue_archive)|]], hence the unofficial name "Kisaki Ball".

On December 22, 2024 Special Stream, its popularity enabled the object to officially become a merch for the upcoming Blue Archive Fes 2024, making the souvenir doll ready to be purchased.

h4. Screenshot
* !asset #22910888

h4. External Links
* "BlueArchive.jp: 【イベント】「月華夢騒」紹介":[https://bluearchive.jp/news/newsJump/480]

title: bunching_hair
body:
When a character holds part of their hair (or someone else's hair) up with their hands to give the appearance that they have a certain hairstyle, usually [[twintails]].

This tag should not be used when a character is putting their hair up in a ponytail, [[tying hair|tying their hair]], or simply [[holding own hair|holding their hair]].

Single buns should additionally be tagged with [[single side bun]], and twin ones with [[double bun]].

title: double_bun
body:
A hairstyle in which the hair is wrapped into two round [[hair bun]]s.

The Japanese nickname for the hairstyle is "odango", literally meaning "dumpling". Classic example is [[Tsukino Usagi]] of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]].

* [[bun cover]]
* [[donut hair bun]]

title: donut_hair_bun
body:
A type of [[hair bun]] where the hair is rolled using a hairdressing item called a hair donut, rather than coiling hair around repeatedly as seen in the traditional odango-styled hair bun. The resulting hair bun indeed resembles a circular [[donut]].

Not to be confused with [[hair rings]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8191455

h4. Notable characters

* [[bremerton (azur lane)|Bremerton]]'s [[bremerton (kung fu cruiser) (azur lane)|Kung Fu Cruiser]] design ([[Azur Lane]])

* [[fujisawa yayoi (uchuu no stellvia)|Fujisawa Yayoi]] ([[Uchuu no Stellvia]])

* [[rosa (pokemon)|Rosa]] ([[Pokemon BW2]])

title: cone_hair_bun
body:
Cone-shaped [[hair bun]]s. This includes both [[double bun]]s and [[single hair bun]]s.

Be careful not to confuse with [[hair horns]], [[hairpods]] (cone-shaped [[bun cover]]s), [[animal ears]], or the [[beehive hairdo]]. If a character's hair is tied so tightly that they resemble sharp horns ([[Mioda Ibuki]]), or their hair sticks up to form natural spikes ([[Marnie (pokemon)|]]), use [[hair horns]].

h4. Examples

* !post #4206891: [[Double bun]]s
* !post #5981869: [[Single hair bun]]

h4. See also

title: bangs
body: Hair that drapes forward to hang in front of the forehead. Known in British English as a [b]fringe[/b]. As it would apply to almost every post on the site, the base [code]bangs[/code] tag is no longer used. h4. Types of bangs * !post #4382765: [[arched bangs]] - For bangs curving upward * !post #4575471: [[asymmetrical bangs]] - For bangs worn half combed back, half loose * !post #7663078: [[bangs pinned back]] - For bangs that are kept in place by a [[hairclip]], a [[hairband]] or manually * !post #6500971: [[blunt bangs]] - For straight-cut unparted bangs * !post #7461000: [[braided bangs]] - For bangs that have been braided (see also [[braid]]) * !post #7997644: [[center-flap bangs]] - A combination of [[blunt bangs]] and [[double-parted bangs]] that results in a distinctive flap of hair * !post #154015: [[choppy bangs]] - For bangs with large gaps of air between them * !post #7934105: [[colored bangs]] - For bangs that are colored differently from the rest of the hair * !post #7381089: [[crossed bangs]] - For bangs that criss-cross each other on the forehead * !post #7640262: [[curtained hair]] - For bangs that briefly arches upward then hangs back down while the [[parted bangs|bangs part to the side]] * !post #3043948: [[diagonal bangs]] - For bangs that are cut in an odd diagonal line * !post #7540287: [[double-parted bangs]] - For bangs that are distinctly parted in two different spots * !post #7950336: [[fanged bangs]] - For bangs with thin longer sides * !post #7986694: [[hair between eyes]] - For bangs that are found between eyes (often paired with [[crossed bangs]] or [[double-parted bangs]]) * !post #4193991: [[hair over eyes]] + [[eyes visible through hair]] - For long bangs that cover both eyes partially * !post #4415241: [[hair over eyes]] + [[covered eyes]] - For bangs that cover both eyes completely * !post #8904369: [[hair over one eye]] + [[eyes visible through hair]] - For bangs that cover a single eye partially * !post #7967265: [[hair over one eye]] + [[one eye covered]] - For bangs that cover a single eye completely * !post #7989717: [[long bangs]] - For unusually long bangs that go past the eyes at least * !post #7548225: [[loosely tucked bangs]] - Uncut, very long bangs being tucked away to the side but still hangs loosely over the face * !post #200120: [[parted bangs]] - For distinctly parted bangs * !post #7661261: [[short bangs]] - For bangs short enough to present the forehead and at least fully show the eyebrows * !post #8632542: [[swept bangs]] - For bangs loosely combed to one side * !post #3374800: [[v-bangs]] - A variant of blunt bangs that are longer in the middle than the sides and come to a distinct point in the center, forming a "V" shape on the forehead * !post #5735551: [[wispy bangs]] - For bangs with thin gaps of air between them

body:
Hair that is curled into conical, drill-shaped ringlets. If the hair is curled but not conical and pointy, it should be tagged [[ringlets]] instead. 

Can be combined with [[twintails]] to get the [[twin drills]] style. The Japanese term for this type of hair style is 縦ロール (tate roll).

title: crown_braid
body:
A form of [[braid]] which wraps around the head in the way a [[hairband]] or a [[crown]] would, as the name suggests. 

h4. Examples

title: rope_braid
body:
A distinctive style of [[braid]] that twists the hair when braiding, resembling a rope.

"Rope braid" usually refers to a two strand twist, where two strands of hair are twisted together, as it is the most iconic. However, variants using other numbers of strands also exist. For example, a three strand twist is a braid where three strands of hair are twisted together. Occasionally a single strand of twisted hair can also result in a similar look. These are not always distinguishable by eye. Most examples of rope braid in art will be two strand twists.

h4. Examples

* !post #7542352: two strand twist
* !post #7832866: single strand twist

title: curly_hair
body:
Hair that is coiled to create a curly effect.

People can be born with naturally curly hair, or can perm it to create artificial curls. This tag is for the more natural effect of curly hair. For the more extreme [[ringlets]], see [[drill hair]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6966672
* !post #6820401

h4. See also

* [[drill hair]]
* [[fluffy hair]]
* [[straight hair]]
* [[wavy hair]]

title: one_side_up
body:
A hair style in which a portion of the hair is tied up on one side, while the rest hangs normally. The amount of hair tied up doesn't matter, only that the untied hair falls down loosely.

The key difference between [[one side up]] and [[side ponytail]] is that in a [[one side up]], most of the hair hangs loosely, while in a [[side ponytail]], most of the hair is tied up and no hair (except for [[sidelocks]]) is left hanging loose.

If the hair is not tied up but just sticking out on its own, tag as [[side ahoge]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6511326: Long side up
* !post #6431000: Short side up

h4. Not [[one side up]]

* !post #7237036: [[side ponytail]]
* !post #7612721: [[low side ponytail]]

h4. See also

* [[two side up]]

body: The act of arranging hair into a [[braid]], whether the character is braiding their own hair or someone else's.

title: braided_tail
body: A [[tail]] that has been [[braid|braided]].

title: single_braid
body: When only one braid of hair is present. Usually worn in place of a [[braided ponytail|ponytail]].

title: side_braids
body:
Braids hanging on the side of the face, anywhere other than in front of the ears.

If the braids are in front of the ears, it's [[braided sidelocks]] instead.

If only side of the face has a braid, use [[side braid]] instead.

h4. Examples

h5. Side braids
* !post #6007029: behind ears
* !post #7464162: ears hidden, behind visible sidelocks


h5. Braided sidelocks

* !post #8030236: in front of ears

title: side_braid
body:
A single [[braid]] hanging on the side of the face, anywhere other than in front of the ears.

If the braid is in front of the ear, it's [[braided sidelock]] instead.

Side braids should not be tagged [[braided ponytail]], which starts from the back of the head.

For braids on both sides, use [[side braids]] instead.

h4. Examples

h5. Side braid

title: french_braided_twintails
body:
A style of [[braid]] that begins above the neck on the scalp, ending in two tails.

Do not use this for braids that start below or at the bottom of the head/scalp.

h5. Correct:

h5. Incorrect:

title: braided_ponytail
body:
[[braid|Braided]] hair that hangs from a point on the back of one's head, much like a ponytail. If this is the only braid in one's hair, tag [[single braid]] as well.

Do not use this tag along with [[ponytail]] or [[ponytail with braided base]]. [[Ponytail]] is for loose, unbraided hair.

If the braid is worn to the side of the head, use [[side braid]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #7767285
* !post #3544238
* !post #7031146

Do not use this for braids that start below or at the bottom of the head/scalp.

h4. Examples

body: Hair that is done into a [[braid]], then additionally folded upon itself, or simultaneously done up in at least one hair ring.

title: braided_sidelocks
body:
Both [[sidelocks]] are [[braid]]ed, that is, a pair of braids that are clearly in front of the ears.

Not to be confused with [[side braids]], which is anywhere in the hair other than in front of the ears.

If only one of the sidelocks is braided, use [[braided sidelock]] instead.

title: braided_sidelock
body:
A single [[sidelocks|sidelock]] on either side of the head that is [[braid|braided]], that is, a braid that is clearly in front of the ear.

Not to be confused with [[side braid]], which is anywhere in the hair other than in front of the ear.

If both sidelocks are braided, use [[braided sidelocks]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #7404018
* !post #7483137
* !post #8730528
* !post #5835863

h4. See also
* [[side braid]]
* [[side braids]]

title: braided_hair_rings
body:
[[Hair rings]] that are [[braid]]ed.

Also known as [[Pon de ring]] hair (ポンデリングヘア).

title: low_twin_braids
body:
[[Twin braids]] where the braids are tied low, below ear-level, instead of near the head. Usually this means the back part of the hair is in braids, rather than the [[sidelocks]].

[[Inugami Korone]]'s signature hairstyle.

h4. Examples

* post #3466244 (low twin braids)
* post #743124 ([b]not[/b] low twin braids; the braids begin above the ears)

h4. See also

* [[twin braids]]
* [[low twintails]]
* [[low-tied long hair]]

title: twin_braids
body:
A hairstyle that consists of two [[braid]]ed lengths of hair.

This can be the hair in front of the ears, like [[sidelocks]], or the hair behind the ears, like [[twintails]].

If the [[braid]]s are tied low, below ear-level, they're [[low twin braids]]. If the back of the hair is tied into two full-length braids, then they're also [[twintails]]. 

h4. Examples

* !post #743124: twin braids that are twintails
* !post #1892901: twin braids that aren't twintails
* !post #1548416: low twin braids on bottom, short twintails on top

h4. Related tags

* [[braiding hair]]
* [[braided ponytail]]
* [[low twin braids]]
* [[side braids]]

* [[multiple braids]]
** [[tri braids]]
** [[quad braids]]

* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: multiple_braids
body:

* [[tri braids]]
* [[quad braids]]

title: quad_braids

body:

If only a portion of the hair is tied then it should be tagged as [[two side up]] instead.

title: quin_tails
body: A hairstyle in which the hair is divided into five sections, typically five [[ponytail]]s.

title: quad_tails
body:
A hairstyle in which the hair is divided into four sections, typically four pigtails.

[[koiwai_yotsuba|Koiwai Yotsuba]] from [[yotsubato!|Yotsubato!]] and [[temari (naruto)|Temari]] from [[naruto (classic)|Naruto]] in particular are known for this hairstyle.

See [[quin tails]] for hair divided into five sections, and [[tri tails]] for three.

h4. See Also
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: tri_tails
body:
A hairstyle in which the hair is divided into three sections, such as a [[two side up]] with an additional [[ponytail]].

h4. Noteable characters
* [[ayumi (x-blades)|Ayumi]] ([[X-Blades]])
* [[Cure March]] ([[Smile Precure!]])
* [[i-19 (kancolle)|I-19]] ([[Kantai Collection]])
* [[Illustrious (Azur Lane)|]] ([[Azur Lane]])

h4. See also
* [[Tri hair rings]]
* [[Triple bun]]

title: folded_twintails
body: A hairstyle that involves looping a pair of [[twintails]] on the top of a character's head until they resemble very loose [[hair rings]].

title: uneven_twintails
body:
A pair of twintails that shows asymmetry with one tail being longer than the other.

h4. See also

* [[Twintails]]
** [[Short Twintails]]
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: low_twintails
body:
[[Twintails]] where the tails are tied down low, at or below the ears, instead of near the head.

h4. Examples

* !post #7663560

h4. See also

* [[low twin braids]]
* [[low-tied long hair]]
* [[short twintails]]
* [[twintails]]
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: two_side_up
body:
A hairstyle in which two locks of hair are tied up on both sides of the head while the back of the hair hangs normally. The amount of hair tied up doesn't matter, only that the back of the hair falls down loosely.

Not to be confused with [[twintails]], where [b]all[/b] of the hair is tied up into two ponytails and nothing is left to fall freely.

Examples include [[Tohsaka Rin]], [[Ultimate Madoka]], [[Onozuka Komachi]], most depictions of [[Kawashiro Nitori]], [[Nena Trinity]], and [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8285463
* !post #7633494
* !post #4658498: with [[double bun]]
* !post #8753074: with [[hair rings]]

h4. Incorrect examples

These posts are [[twintails]], not two side up. The back of the hair does not hang freely outside of the twintails.

* !post #8362388
* !post #8336884
* !post #8326681
* !post #8124927

h4. See also

* [[one side up]]
* [[twintails]]

body:

title: twintails
body:
A hair style where the hair is tied into sections forming two ponytails. The Japanese term for this type of hair style is ツインテール (twin tail).

All of the hair must be tied into two pigtails for this tag to count. If any hair outside of the bangs/[[sidelocks]] falls normally, it is [[two side up]] instead.

Not to be confused with [[multiple tails]] which relates to beings with more than one tail of the animal variety.

h4. Notable twintail characters

* [[Hatsune Miku]] (of [[VOCALOID]])
* [[Black Rock Shooter (character)|The eponymous character]] of [[Black Rock Shooter]]
* [[Fate Testarossa]] (of [[Lyrical Nanoha]], only when transformed)
* [[Nakano Azusa]] (of [[K-ON!]])
* [[Quess Paraya]] ([[Char's Counterattack]])

title: side_ponytail
body:
A [[ponytail]] that is tied at the side of the head rather than the back. [[Akita Neru]], [[Flandre Scarlet]] and [[Kaga (kancolle)|]] are noted wearers of this style.

Side ponytails should not be tagged [[ponytail]]. [[Ponytail]] specifically refers to a ponytail at the back of the head.

Not to be confused with [[one side up]], where a small portion of one's hair is pulled up but the rest is left to fall loosely.

h4. Examples

* !post #7410043
* !post #6566860

h4. See also

* [[high side ponytail]]
* [[low side ponytail]]
* [[one side up]]
* [[short sidetail]]
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: high_ponytail
body:
A [[ponytail]] that is tied high up at the back of the head.  Contrast with [[low ponytail]].

For [[side ponytail]]s, use [[high side ponytail]] instead.

h4. Examples

title: ponytail
body:
A hairstyle in which the hair is tied at the back of the head with a [[hair tie]], [[scrunchie]], or similar device, and allowed to hang freely from that point.

This tag is for plain ponytails at the back of the head. Do not use this tag for [[side ponytail]]s or [[braided ponytail]]s.

h4. Examples

* !post #2603996: [[High ponytail]]
* !post #4457837: [[Low ponytail]]
* !post #3988929: [[Short ponytail]]
* !post #6079572: [[Split ponytail]]
* !post #6689390: [[Wide ponytail]]
* !post #7669708: [[Ponytail with braided base]] 

h4. Other hairstyles

These hairstyles should not be tagged ponytail because they don't involve the hair being tied at the back of the head in a single unstyled lock of hair.

* [[drill ponytail]]

title: bald
body:
Having no hair on the head.

See [[balding]] when a character has no hair at the top of their head, but has hair on the sides of it.

h4. Hair lengths

* [[bald]] / [[bald female]]
* [[very short hair]]
* [[short hair]] (shorter than shoulder length)
* [[medium hair]] (shoulder length)
* [[long hair]] (longer than shoulder length, up to waist length)
* [[very long hair]] (longer than waist length, up to floor length)
* [[absurdly long hair]] (beyond floor length)

h4. See also

* [[bald female]]
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: absurdly_long_hair
body:
Hair longer than the character's height. Rule of thumb is a character is able to stand on their own hair.

See [[very long hair]] for hair that is less than body-length.

h4. Examples

* !post #9658670

h4. Hair lengths

* [[bald]] / [[bald female]]
* [[very short hair]]
* [[short hair]] (shorter than shoulder length)
* [[medium hair]] (shoulder length)
* [[long hair]] (longer than shoulder length, up to waist length)
* [[very long hair]] (longer than waist length, up to floor length)
* [[absurdly long hair]] (beyond floor length)

h4. See also 

* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: very_long_hair
body:
Hair longer than the waist, ranging to as far down as the feet.

Hair less than waist-length is [[long hair]]. Hair longer than the body is [[absurdly long hair]].

h4. Examples

* !post #2336560
* !post #4955425

h4. Hair lengths

* [[bald]] / [[bald female]]
* [[very short hair]]
* [[short hair]] (shorter than shoulder length)

body:

h4. Examples

!post #7352787: [[short hair|"Default" (short)]], [[short hair|short]], [[medium hair|medium]], [[long hair]].

h4. Hair lengths

* [[bald]] / [[bald female]]

* [[short hair]] (shorter than shoulder length)
* [[medium hair]] (shoulder length)

title: short_hair
body:
Hair reaching the neck, but not reaching the shoulders.

Short hairstyles include the [[bob cut]], the [[bowl cut]], the [[flattop]], and the [[undercut]].

If the hair is ear length or shorter, use [[very short hair]].

h4. Examples

!post #7352787: [[short hair|"Default" (short)]], [[short hair|short]], [[medium hair|medium]], [[long hair]].

h4. Hair lengths

* [[bald]] / [[bald female]] (no hair whatsoever)
* [[very short hair]] (shorter than jaw/chin length)
* [[short hair]] (shorter than shoulder length)
* [[medium hair]] (shoulder length)
* [[long hair]] (longer than shoulder length, up to waist length)
* [[very long hair]] (longer than waist length, up to floor length)
* [[absurdly long hair]] (beyond floor length)

h4. See also 

* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: very_short_hair
body:
Hair that is ear or jaw length, or even shorter. Very short hairstyles include the [[buzz cut]], [[crew cut]], and [[pixie cut]].

h4. Hair lengths

* [[bald]] / [[bald female]]
* [b]very short hair[/b] (shorter than jaw/chin length)
* [[short hair]] (shorter than shoulder length)
* [[medium hair]] (shoulder length)
* [[long hair]] (longer than shoulder length, up to waist length)
* [[very long hair]] (longer than waist length, up to floor length)
* [[absurdly long hair]] (beyond floor length)

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: patterned_hair
body:
Hair with a pattern that would be impossible to replicate on real hair. Usually [[multicolored hair]].

Think of, for example, painting some stars on your hair. Whenever it moves, the star would break up into smaller hair strands.
As such, gradient hair and streaked hair can be replicated, but print hair cannot.

h4. See Also
* [[Unmoving pattern]]

title: spotted_hair
body:
A character whose hair has various different coloured sections, in a spotted pattern of circles or other shapes. Often used for animal characters with natural patterns in their fur.

h4. See also

* [[tag group:hair color]]

title: two-tone_hair
body:
[[Multicolored hair]] that consists of two distinct colors.

The division between the two colors may be an immediate change from one to the other or it may be done in a gradient, in which case the [[gradient hair]] tag would also apply.

If a character has two hair colors that are split vertically at the top of the head, then fall such that the color hair colors form two distinct sections, then the [[split-color hair]] tag would also apply.

h4. See also

* [[Colored inner hair]]
* [[Colored tips]]
* [[Multicolored hair]]
* [[Split-color hair]]
* [[Streaked hair]]
* [[Tag group:Hair color]]

title: raccoon_tails_(hairstyle)
body:
A hairstyle associated with [[scene fashion]] where small sections of hair are dyed with horizontal stripes of a different color in a repeating pattern, usually black. 

These are commonly but not always a form of [[sidelocks]].

h4. See also

* [[striped hair]]
* [[tag group:hair color]]

title: streaked_hair
body:
[[Multicolored hair]] or [[two-tone hair]] where the majority of the hair is one color, while only one or multiple small streaks possess a different color or colors.

The specific standard hair color(s) in the streaks can also be tagged (similar to the" [i]color[/i]_trim":[/wiki_pages?commit=Search&search%5Btitle_normalize%5D=%2A_trim] tags):
* [[red streaks|red]], [[orange streaks|orange]], [[blonde streaks|blonde]], [[green streaks|green]], [[aqua streaks|aqua]], [[blue streaks|blue]], [[black streaks|black]], [[grey streaks|red]], [[grey streaks|grey]], [[white streaks|white]], [[brown streaks|brown]]

h4. See Also
* [[colored tips]]
* [[tag group:hair color]]

title: rainbow_hair
body: Hair colored to resemble the [[rainbow]] spectrum, often as a [[gradient_hair|gradient]].

title: gradient_hair
body:
[[Multicolored hair]] that blends and gradually changes from one color to another. 

All hair colors in the gradient should be tagged, if possible. Use [[colored tips]] instead of this tag, if the hair changes colour abruptly at the ends.

h4. Examples
* !post #5633475
* !post #3734039

h4. See also
* [[Gradient]]
* [[Streaked hair]]
* [[Two-tone hair]]
* [[Tag group:hair color]]

title: roots_(hair)
body:
A type of [[multicolored hair]] where the hair at the top of the head (the [i]roots[/i]) is a different color from the rest. This is typically visible where the hair parts on the head.

This is traditionally a result of neglecting one's dyed hair, letting the natural hair color grow back in. Nowadays it may also be an intentional hairstyle, with people deliberately dying their hair this way. Most often, roots are seen with [[blonde hair]] and appear as dark, natural colors like [[brown hair|brown]] or [[black hair|black]].

Notable characters with this style of hair include [[Miyamori Aoi]], [[Memcho]], [[Sawatari Akane (chainsaw man)|]], and [[Kozume Kenma]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6295587
* !post #6318424
* !post #6274156

h4. See also

* [[colored tips]]
* [[Tag group:Hair color]]

title: colored_tips
body:
A type of [[multicolored hair]] where the hair is abruptly colored differently at the very ends. The style is known as [i]dip dye[/i] or [i]tip dyeing[/i].

Not to be confused with [[gradient hair]], where the color change is gradual rather than sudden.
If only the top of the character's head has a different color, please tag it as [[roots_(hair)]].

h4. Examples

* !post #2933549
* !post #4038809
* !post #3201543

h4. See also

* [[roots_(hair)|]]
* [[streaked hair]]
* [[colored bangs]]
* [[Tag group:Hair color]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dip Dye":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dip_dye]

title: multicolored_hair
body:
Hair that has more than one color. All hair colors present should be tagged, if possible.

h4. Types

title: colored_inner_hair
body:

title: aqua_hair
body:
Hair that is colored blue-green. "Aqua" also covers teal and turquoise.

Due to the subjective nature of color judgment and other factors (such as the lighting on the characters) there is an overlap between this tag and the [[blue hair]] and [[green hair]] tags.

h4. Examples

title: white_hair
body:
Hair that is colored white.

Due to the subjective nature of color judgment, lighting, and color grading, there can be confusion between white hair and other hair colors in the very light color range. This especially true in regards to [[blue hair]], [[purple hair]], and [[grey hair]]. A good idea is to compare the hair color to any other white objects in the picture. If the hair is the same color, it should be tagged [[white hair]]. If it is darker or differently-colored, use the appropriate non-white tag.

h4. Examples

* !post #7338612

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Hair color]]

title: red_hair
body:
Hair that is colored red.

Not to be confused with what is known as "red hair":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_hair in real life.

Due to the subjective nature of color judgment and other factors (such as the lighting on the characters) there is an overlap between this tag, the [[orange hair]], and the [[brown hair]] tags.

h4. Examples

title: grey_hair
body:
Hair that is colored grey.

Due to the subjective nature of color judgment and other factors (such as differences in color displayed on monitors) there is potential overlap between this tag and the [[blue hair]], [[aqua hair]], and [[purple hair]] tags, generally in the lighter shades of those colors. Grey is also often used to shade [[white hair]]. It is a good idea to compare the hair in question to how other white things, namely white clothes, are shaded. If the shading on the hair resembles how white clothing is shaded, it is likely white, and not grey.

h4. Examples

* !post #2356390
* !post #8266685: Dark grey
* !post #7460307: Light grey

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Hair color]]

title: pocket
body:
A small bag or pouch sewn into a piece of clothing, meant to hold small items.

[[Pants]], [[shorts]], [[jacket]]s, [[coat]]s, and button-down [[shirt]]s are a few common types of clothing that usually contain pockets. Pockets are more common in men's fashion than in women's.

title: good_omens
body:
Good Omens is a 2019 fantasy tv series based on the 1990 book of the same name written by [[Neil Gaiman]] and Terry Pratchett. Developed by Amazon MGM Studios and BBC Studios, the series follows two unlikely friends, [[Crowley (good omens)|]] the demon (played by [[David Tennant]]) and [[Aziraphale (good omens)|]] the angel (played by Michael Sheen), who must join forces to prevent Heaven and Hell from starting the Apocalypse.

The series was well received which led to a second season in 2023 based on an unwritten sequel that Gaiman and Pratchett were planning before the latter's death in 2015. A third season was originally in the works for 2025, but due to recent controversy with Gaiman after allegations of sexual assault with fans in the past, the third season was turned into a 90 minute episode and will now serve as the final episode but has yet to be aired.

title: kawasaki_(company)
body:
A Japanese company specializing in heavy machinery and [[motorcycle]]s.

Its origin can be traced back to the early 20th century, when the company was one of the major [i]zaibatsu[/i] in Japan. Along with its rival [[Mitsubishi]], Kawasaki produced a wide variety of civilian and [[military]] products.

Its name comes from the surname of the founder. For a city with the same name, see [[Kawasaki (Kanagawa)]].

title: senichi_(everyday_host)
body:
An [[Everyday Host]] character. Senichi is the No.3 host at Club One. He has a vulgar and aggressive personality and is rude to all of his customers and coworkers. He has no interest in women who aren't 2D and spends most of his money on in-app purchases in smartphone games.

h4.Appearance
* !asset #32528712

title: ryouichi_(everyday_host)
body:
An [[Everyday Host]] character. Ryouichi is the No.2 host at Club One. He has a friendly personality and plays the role of an "Erotic Love" type host, kissing his customers often and offering pillow service (sex with regular customers) more frequently than his peers. He is secretly heavily tattooed.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #32527396

title: hajime_(everyday_host)
body:
The protagonist of [[Everyday Host]]. Having gotten sick of his job as a former salesman at a life insurance company, he decided to quit and take a stab at being a host at Club One. He is patient and agreeable which often leads to others making him do things for them. He's referred to as the NT type host, N for "naruhodo (なるほど)"/"I see" and T for "tashikani (たしかに)"/"Certainly", as those are typically the only things that he says to his customers. His real name is Sekiguchi.

h4.Appearance
* !asset #32526594

title: kouichi_(everyday_host)
body:
An [[Everyday Host]] character. Kouichi is the No.1 host and owner of Club One. He's lively and plays the role of a "Younger Brother" type host, being able to make most anyone feel calm and comfortable around him. Despite his young appearance, he has over 20 years of experience in the host club industry.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #32525626

title: christianity
body:
An Abrahamic religion that is centered on the teachings of [[Jesus|Jesus Christ]], the worship of Jesus and [[Yahweh|God]], and the veneration of numerous saints. It is split into three branches: Catholicism, Orthodoxy, and Protestantism (may include [[Mormonism]]).

Use this tag for posts depicting clear-cut, significant reference to Christianity.

h4. Related tags

h6. Actions

* [[baptism]]
* [[eucharist]]
* [[exorcism]]

h6. Symbolism

* [[Chi Rho]] / ☧
* [[cross]] / ✝
* [[ichthys symbol|ichthys]] 
* IX monogram (resembling the [[asterisk (symbol)|]]) / ᚼ

h6. Objects

title: killing_of_iryna_zarutska
body:
On August 22, 2025, Iryna Zarutska, a Ukrainian refugee who had fled her country because of the [[Russo-Ukrainian War]], was fatally stabbed at the East/West Boulevard station on the Lynx Blue Line, in Charlotte, North Carolina, United States. The footage of the killing sparked outrage on social media, leading to policy discussions about transit security, fare enforcement, and gaps in the criminal justice and mental health systems.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Killing of Iryna Zarutska":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_of_Iryna_Zarutska]

title: grave_(nikke)
body:
A playable character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]

A mysterious Nikke who wanders the surface with a huge coffin on her back.

In pursuit of her hidden objectives, her stealth and evasion skills are unmatched by ordinary individuals.  

[spoiler]It was revealed that she is [[Abe (nikke)|]], a mass-produced [[Product 23 (nikke)|Product 23]] who was the Chief researcher and the creator of the [[Old Tales (nikke)|]] squad, the second-generation grimms models.[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24525877: Default
* !asset #25638772: [[grave_(beautiful_you)_(nikke)|Beautiful You]]

title: list_of_goddess_of_victory:_nikke_characters
body:
List of characters from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

h4. Playable characters

Playable characters are divided into one of 5 categories: three for Ark Nikkes (based on which of the Big Three Ark corporations manufactured them), one for surface Nikkes, and one for crossover characters.

h5. Elysion

Upholding the belief in Nikkes serving as first-rate soldiers, Elysion effectively serves as a private military corporation. Its CEO is [[Ingrid (nikke)|]].

h5. Pilgrim

h5. Abnormal

A company that manages the existence of Nikke-like individuals. Characters from collaboration events fall into this category.

[/expand]

h4. Squads

Nikke are grouped into named squads of 1-4 members. Usually squads have a particular role or specialization, which often is reflected in the squad name or in the names of individual members. Rarely a Nikke may leave one squad to join another, either temporarily or permanently, and under extraordinary circumstances a squad may be dissolved. [b]Only use these tags for posts that feature all permanent members of a squad.[/b]

title: nah_i'd_win_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from a panel of [[Jujutsu Kaisen]] Chapter 221.

The panel features [[Gojou Satoru]] saying the phrase "Nah, I'd win." as a callback to his response when [[Itadori Yuuji]] asked him if he would lose against [[Ryoumen Sukuna (Jujutsu Kaisen)|]] in Chapter 3. The panel exploded in popularity in late 2023 after Chapter 236 released because [spoiler]he would, in fact, not win.[/spoiler]

h4. Examples

* !asset #22846092: Original
* !post #6951546
* !post #7422459

title: facing_away
body:
An image where the subject is facing away from the viewer such that only the back of their head is seen. Usually, but not always [[from behind]].

This does not include when a character is [[looking to the side]], or when a character who is not the main subject is facing away from the camera.

If the character's body is facing away from the viewer but you can still clearly see their face, use [[from behind]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #2908324
* !post #7473317

h4. See also

* [[back]]
* [[from behind]]
* [[facing viewer]]
* [[facing to the side]]

title: arcee_(prime)
body:
Version of [[Arcee]] that appears in [[Transformers Prime|Transformers: Prime]]. Transforms into a motorcycle; her main human ally [[Jackson Darby]] typically acts as a rider.

Unlike past incarnations of the character, this version has a blue color scheme instead of pink.

title: sari_sumdac
body:
Human protagonist and ally of the Autobots in [[Transformers Animated]].

[spoiler]Revealed in the third season to actually be a robot herself, the result of a protoform body from Cybertron that scanned human DNA.[/spoiler]

title: jetfire
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Jetfire[/b] is a heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a red and white combat [[spacecraft]].

In [[Japan]] and in the first TV series his name was changed to [b]Skyfire[/b] (スカイファイアー). He used to be [[Starscream]]'s best friend in the past.

Jetfire's first American toy was a conversion of the original [[VF-1 Super]] Valkyrie [[mecha]] from [[MACROSS]] (created by [[Kawamori Shouji]] in the early 80s).

In the live action films he is an old robot warrior that transforms into an [[sr-71_blackbird|SR-71]] [[jet]]. In the movies he used to be a [[Decepticon]], but eventually got tired of being one and decided to side with the Autobots.

Jetfire is also the name of a separate unique character in [[Transformers Animated]], where he appears as a futuristic orange jet plane. He is twins with his brother [[Jetstorm]], and the two are capable of combining together.

Motto: [i]"Among mysteries of science lies the key to victory...".[/i]
other_names: ドレッドロック(ギャラクシーフォース)

title: rumble_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Rumble[/b] is an evil [[Decepticon]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a [[cassette tape]].

[quote]Motto: [i]"First we crack the shell, then we crack the nuts inside...!!!".[/i][/quote]

Due to errors during the original cartoon's production, there is inconsistency between various media between whether Rumble is depicted as red or blue. The Japanese dub of the cartoon, and thus most Pixiv fanart, depicts Rumble as red.

* [[Soundblaster]]

title: tail
body:
A long appendage protruding from the lower back. Often covered in fur or scales. A common feature of animal girls.

In general, don't tag this on an [[animal]] unless there's something special or noteworthy about the tail, such as one of the many tags below that implicate this tag like [[heart tail]] or [[holding with tail]], or if the image is focused on the tail. Definitely don't tag an animal with a tail of its own type, like tagging [[cat tail]] on a [[cat]]. (Do tag weird combos like a [[rabbit tail]] on a [[cat]], though.)

h4. Examples

* !post #8400521

h4. See also

* [[kemonomimi mode]]
* [[tail through clothes]]
* [[Tag group:Tail]]
other_names: スカートの中から尻尾

title: visor_cap
body:
A type of crownless "hat", consisting of an eyeshade and something to fasten it to the head, such as a rim or an elastic strap.

Not to be confused with [[peaked cap]], which is associated with a [[police uniform|police]] or [[military uniform|military]] uniform.

Note that visor caps should not be tagged as [[hat]]s, because they are not closed at the top end.

title: godzilla
body:
The titular [[kaiju|kaiju]] from [[godzilla (series)|Godzilla]] series. Characterized as a giant, black theropod-like creature with spine scales and long tails.

Its origin and characteristic vary in each films and media it appeared. For example, the one who appears in the original 1950 series was born as a result of the Atomic bombing on [[Hiroshima]], while the one who appears in the [i][[MonsterVerse]][/i] series was said to be an ancient creature.

h4. Variants

title: godzilla_galaxy_odyssey
body: Godzilla Galaxy Odyssey (ゴジラ ギャラクシーオデッセイ Gojira Gyarakushī Odessei), abbreviated Godzilla GO, is a manga series written and illustrated by Ju Ishiguchi. It has been serialized by Akita Publishing in Young Champion magazine and on the Young Champion Web website since May 27, 2025 (JST). It features the brand-new alien monster Volga, designed by Hiroshi Maruyama of Ultra Series fame

title: king_bob-omb
body:
[b]King Bob-omb[/b] (formerly known as the [b]Big Bob-omb[/b]) is a character introduced in [[Super Mario 64]]. As his name suggests, he is the King of the [[Bob-omb]]s, and a reoccurring boss character often closely allied with [[Bowser]].

He has a white [[mustache]] and wears a gold [[crown]], [[white gloves]] and [[pointy shoes|pointy]] [[yellow shoes]]. Despite himself being a [[bomb]], he lacks the [[winding key]] and [[fuse]] of his underlings.

Her hair in this costume can either be worn in [[Oozora Subaru (1St Costume)|her default hairstyle]] [[official alternate hairstyle|or]] wear it [[long hair|longer]] with [[two side up|two sides up]].

title: bitchsuit
body:
Restraints worn around the arms and legs to force a person into a [[human dog]] position. Usually made from [[leather]] or [[latex]], they can feature padding on the [[elbow pads|elbows]] and [[knee pads|knees]] for comfort.

Often coupled with [[bondage mittens]] to further restrict the subject.

Do not use this tag if the person is in a human dog position due to other restraints, such as [[rope]] or [[cuffs]].

title: pauline_(mario)
body:
Character from the [i][[Donkey Kong (series)|]][/i] and [i][[Mario (series)|]][/i] franchises.

Originally called The Lady, she is the damsel in distress from [[Nintendo]]'s [i][[Donkey Kong (1981 Game)|Donkey Kong]][/i] and its various remakes. Made infrequent appearances, particularly in the [i][[Mario Vs. Donkey Kong]][/i] series, as (again) the damsel in distress, until she appeared in [i][[Super Mario Odyssey]][/i] as the mayor of New Donk City. Since then, she has made more appearances, sometimes in promotional art with the other girls of the [i]Mario[/i] series, officially known as the "Nintendo Starlets".

Her official appearance is [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[brown hair|brown]] [[curtained hair]] with pink [[eyeshadow]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[taut dress|tight]] [[red dress|red]] [[halter dress]] Her [i]Odyssey[/i] appearance gives her an alternate outfit, changing the dress to a [[red suit]] with a [[fedora]].

h4. Official Art

* !asset #24215799: Default
* !post #2854605: Dress + Red Fedora ([[Super Mario Odyssey]])
* !asset #24216034: Suit + Blue Fedora ([[Super Mario Odyssey]])

h4. Related Tags

* [[Biker Pauline]]
* [[Golf Pauline]]
* [[Striker Pauline]]
* [[Tennis Pauline]]

title: frottage
body:
[b]Frottage[/b] (or "dry humping") is a [[tag group:sex acts|sex act]] without [[sex|penetration]] that can include any form of sexual rubbing, whether naked or clothed, for arousal or orgasm.

For tagging purposes, use this tag when one person's crotch is rubbing against another person's body, [i]except[/i] for genital-on-genital contact (use [[grinding]], [[buttjob]], [[tribadism]], [[bulges touching]], or [[penises touching]] for this). 

Use [[dry humping]] when genital-on-genital contact is stopped by clothing.

Use [[crotch rub]] for rubbing against inanimate objects.

h4. Examples

* !post #53588
* !post #439300
* !post #490601

h4. See Also

title: thigh_straddling
body:
A position where one character is [[straddling]] someone else's [[thighs|thigh]]. Often, but not always, a form of [[frottage]].

h4. See Also

* [[frottage]]
* [[thigh sex]]
* [[tag group:posture]]

title: grinding
body:
A [[tag group:sex acts|sex act]] in which a girl grinds her bare or covered [[pussy]] against her partner's [[penis]] without being [[sex|penetrated]].

This is different from [[imminent vaginal]]. In [[imminent vaginal]], the penis is angled to penetrate, while in grinding, the pussy is simply rubbed against the penis with no apparent intention to penetrate.

For [[ass]]-to-[[penis]] rubbing, use [[buttjob]] instead.
For [[pussy]]-to-object rubbing, use [[crotch rub]] instead.
For [[pussy]]-on-thigh rubbing, use [[thigh straddling]] instead.
For [[pussy]]-to-[[pussy]] rubbing, use [[tribadism]] instead.
For [[penis]]-between-thigh rubbing, use [[thigh sex]] instead.
For clothed [[pussy]]-to-[[penis]] rubbing, use [[dry humping]] instead.
For rubbing against anything else, use [[frottage]].
For the [[skateboard]]ing move of grinding on rails, use [[sliding]] instead. 

h4. Examples

* post #412135
* post #569228
* post #919101

h4. See also

* [[cooperative grinding]]
* [[imminent vaginal]]
* [[Tag Group:Sex Acts]]
* [[sliding]], for the [[skates|skating move]]

title: xiao_weiying
body:
[b]Vein[/b], full name [b]Xiao Weiying[/b] is the main antagonist of the Bridon Arc of the [[shiguang dailiren|Link Click]] Anime series.

He has long [[red hair]] tied into a [[single braid|single]] [[braided ponytail]], [[red eyes]] and [[red eyeliner]], wears a single [[tassel earrings|tassel earring]] and a [[round eyewear|round]] [[sunglasses]].

He wears a  collared [[white shirt]] with [[chinese knot]]s over a [[turtleneck]] black [[undershirt]], a long [[two-sided coat|two-sided]] [[black coat]] [[coat on shoulders|on shoulders]], and black pants with [[wallet chain]].

title: still_in_love_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character.

She is a [[horse girl]] who, while she appears as a rational, [[sweets]]-loving girl who doesn't stand out, becomes an all-devouring ferocious monster on the racetrack, driven by her instincts. In fact, she can be defined by her struggle to keep her reason and suppress her base instincts. This shows well in the [[Umamusume: Party Dash]] game, where she is the only one that has two different expressions during in game. 

Due to the unusual posture and a red-colored fingernail in her ring finger (seen in her 3D model), as well as how unhinged she sounds like in a sample voiceline for her character bio, she is depicted in fanart as a [[yandere]] (which is admittedly not too far from the truth).

She is notable for technically being the first North Hills horse to be unveiled (in a group of three being unveiled simultaneously), being originally teased as the logo character of [[Umamusume: Party Dash|Party Dash]]. In real life, she is also Japan's second Triple Tiara and thus the third to be unveiled in [i]Umamusume[/i].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7248949: [[Tracen School Uniform]]
* !post #7913690: [[Still In Love (Scarlet Vow Raiment) (Umamusume)|Scarlet Vow Raiment]]

* !post #7256226: [[Starting Future (Umamusume)|Starting Future]]

title: kimetsu_no_yaiba
body:
A shonen manga by [[Gotouge Koyoharu]] published in [[shounen jump|Weekly Shonen Jump]] from 2016 to 2020.

Received an anime adaptation that ran from April 6th to September 28th, 2019, produced by [[ufotable]], under the name of [i]Blade of Demon Destruction[/i] or [i]Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba[/i], as well as a sequel movie [i]Mugen Train[/i].

Initially received lukewarm reception during its release, it has become one of the best-selling manga of all time after anime adaptation in 2019.

title: load_bearing_equipment
body:
A type of gear that is worn around the combatant's waist and utilizes suspenders to help balance the load. It has [[pouch]]es that contain items important for combat such as [[ammunition]], [[canteen]], [[combat knife]], [[entrenching tool]], [[grenade]], [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]], [[handgun|sidearm]], and more. Also known as combat harness.

The Russian [[military]] [[SMERSH]] is a prominent example.

title: chest_rig
body:
A [b]chest rig[/b] is a piece of tactical gear consisting of multiple pouches that is worn on the [[upper body]] to hold various items, such as [[magazine (weapon)|magazines]], [[walkie-talkie]], [[combat knife]], and other useful tools. Typically strapped on using a harness system. It is separate from any clothing article. Intially designed for [[military]] and [[police]] during combat, chest rig has been adopted for civilian use - especially ones designed with a single [[pouch]].

h4. Examples

* !post #5400538: [b]Chest rig[/b]. Pouches are separate from clothing article, situated on the torso/chest.
* !post #7001003:  [[Load bearing vest]]. Pouches are integrated with the tactical vest.
* !post #5944716: [[Load bearing equipment]]. Situated around the waist, the gear may consist more than just [[ammunition pouch]]es.

h4. See also

* [[holster]]
* [[military uniform]]
* [[bulletproof vest]]
* [[scabbard]]
* [[sheath]]
* [[tactical clothes]]

title: load_bearing_vest
body:
A type of [[vest]] worn by [[military]] [[soldier]]s, [[police]] officers and [[military operator|special forces]] in combat. It contains integrated [[ammunition pouch]]es, slots for grenades or other equipment, and sometimes a built-in [[holster]].

May overlap with [[bulletproof vest]] due to some vests that enables the insertion of [[body armor]] plates. Especially if the front side look flat and stiff.

h4. Examples

* !post #7001003: [b]Load bearing vest[/b]. Pouches are integrated with the vest.
* !post #5400538: [[Chest rig]]. Pouches are separate from clothing article, situated on the torso/chest.
* !post #5944716: [[Load bearing equipment]]. Worn around the waist, the gear may consist more than just ammunition pouches.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]
* [[tactical clothes]]

title: tube_top
body:
A form-fitting [[strapless]] top consisting of a continuous band of fabric wrapping around the torso, with the neckline stopping just above the [[breasts]].

The length can range from covering the entire torso to covering just the breasts. If the [[midriff]] is exposed it may also be a [[crop top]], while if only the breasts are covered it may be a [[bandeau]]. A tube top made of [[bandages]] is a [[sarashi]].

Traditionally, the only support they provided was due to the stretchiness of the fabric. Tube tops do not have any attached sleeves, meaning that they leave the shoulders/arms and upper chest area bare. 

Tube tops are innately strapless, thus they should not be tagged [[sleeveless]], and they should not be used for any clothing with straps, shoulders, or sleeves.

h4. Examples

* !post #5386478
* !post #6240270: Exposed [[midriff]] makes it also a [[crop top]]
* !post #7291818: Narrow length additionally makes it a [[bandeau]]
* !post #3622090: A [[bikini under clothes|bikini worn underneath]] a tube top
* !post #7491543: A tube top worn underneath [[suspenders]]

h4. Incorrect examples

* !post #6610868: "Off-shoulder clothes" such as [[off-shoulder shirt]]

title: vaulting_horse
body:
A vaulting horse (tobikako), is a common piece of equipment in Japanese gyms, often used to establish that the scene is in a [[gym storeroom]]. Frequently seen in Japanese media in a stacked form (where the number closest to the floor indicates the height) as compared to Western vaulting horses which are typically a padded bar raised on two metal bars and adjusted for height with screws.

h4. Examples

* !post #7605895
* !asset #31818809

title: flick
body:
To strike with a light, quick, snapping stroke of the finger.  May be used to cause light pain as a punishment, such as with a [[forehead flick]]; to propel objects, such as a [[paper football]]; or to perform other various actions, such as removing a lid, lighting a match, etc.

If referring to the slang term, "flicking the bean", specifically referring to clitoral stimulation, please see [[female masturbation]] and [[clitoral stimulation]].

h4. See also

* [[Forehead flick]] 
* [[Incoming forehead flick]] 
* [[Nipple flick]]
* [[Flicking penis]]
* [[Flicking testicles]]

title: torifune_(touhou)
body:
A Japanese [[space station]] in the Outside World that made its appearance in [[Trojan Green Asteroid]] and serves as its setting. The station was designed as a self-contained ecosystem to gather data for terraforming parts of Earth. Control of the station was lost a few years before the events of TGA, and contact with the station has not been made with since then. A knowledge lost to all but [[Usami Renko]] and [[Maribel Hearn]], the station's interior has become an overgrown jungle, while some of its animal species have mutated into chimerae.

The station was named after Ame-no-Torifune, resembling Noah's Ark.

h4. Examples

* !post #1610294

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: TORIFINE":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/TORIFUNE

title: suspension_railway
body:
A railway on which the cars run suspended on the underside of the [[railroad tracks|tracks]]. This differs from a [[cable car]] in that the stock runs on a fixed track instead of a flexible cable or rope.

h4. Examples

* !asset #31043915: Shonan Monorail Suspension Railway

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Suspension railway":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suspension_railway

title: ahoge
body:
Literally "stupid hair", an ahoge is a single long lock of hair that sticks out of a character's head. 

Use [[cowlick]] instead if it's short or thick tuft of hair rather than a long strand. Use [[antenna hair]] instead if there's two or more thin locks of hair instead of only one.

If the ahoge reflects the character's emotions, it may also be [[expressive hair]].

Not to be confused with [[ahegao]], which is a facial expression.

h4. Examples

title: cowlick
body:
An unruly tuft of hair that sticks out from the head or that lies at odds with the rest of an individual's hair.

Note to be confused with [[ahoge]]. Compared to an [[ahoge]], a cowlick is usually a shorter or thicker tuft of hair rather than a single long lock or strand, and is usually located nearer the back or side of the head than the forehead or crown.

h4. See also

* [[antenna hair]]
* [[lone nape hair]]

title: chernobyl
body:
An abandoned city in [[Ukraine]] infamous for a severe nuclear accident from the [[chernobyl npp|nearby power plant]] in 1986 that forced the area surrounding it to be abandoned.

This tag can also be applied when the town near Chernobyl, [[Pripyat]], is in the image.

body: Pripyat is an infamous [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] ghost town located in the [[Chernobyl]] exclusion zone.

The second color has to dominate the majority of the ahoge, rather than just the tip. If that happens, use [[colored tips]] instead. If the ahoge's color is also present in the rest of the hair, just use [[two-tone hair]] and/or [[multicolored hair]].

title: elden_ring
body:
Elden Ring is a 2022 action role-playing game developed by [[fromsoftware|FromSoftware]] and published by [[bandai namco|Bandai Namco Entertainment]]. Directed by [[Miyazaki Hidetaka]] with worldbuilding provided by fantasy writer [[George R.R. Martin]].

In the game, players control a customizable player character on a journey to repair the titular [[Elden Ring (object)|]] and become the new Elden Lord.

title: ahegao
body:
Ahegao (アヘ顔, lit. "ahe face", where "ahe" is a sound effect for wild moaning) is an orgasmic facial expression where the [[rolling eyes|eyes are rolled up]], the [[open mouth|mouth is open]], and the [[tongue out|tongue is sticking out]]. Frequently accompanied by [[blush|blushing]], [[drooling]], [[sweat|sweating]], raising the eyebrows, or a [[double V]] gesture.

This expression usually (but not always) indicates a state of exaggerated sexual pleasure. It can also indicate [[crazy|craziness]], [[drugged|drug influence]], or [[asphyxiation]].

Not to be confused with [[torogao]], which is an expression that usually indicates a state of trance-like pleasure. Ahegao is a more wild expression.

h4. Examples

* !post #4241364
* !post #892003

h4. Variants

* [[ahegaokin]]
* [[super masara ahegao]]
* [[bohegao]]
* [[ohhoai]]

h4. See also

* [[fucked silly]]
* [[torogao]]
* [[Tag Group:Face Tags]]

title: expressive_hair
body:
Hair that expresses a character's emotions, such as [[excited|excitement]] or [[depressed|depression]]. Signified by flapping, lowering, or (in the case of an [[ahoge]]) wilting, standing up, or forming shapes such as a heart or question mark.

Not to be confused with [[prehensile hair]], when hair is being actively used as an appendage, tool or weapon.

h4. See also

* [[heart-shaped hair]]
* [[symbol-shaped hair]]
* [[ahoge wag]]

* [[wilted ahoge]]

* "TVTropes: Expressive Hair":https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExpressiveHair

body: Wakame (ワカメ), Undaria pinnatifida, is a sea vegetable, or edible [[seaweed]]. It has a subtly sweet flavor and is most often served in [[soup]] and [[salad]].

title: mesugaki
body:
Literally, "bitch brat". A young girl who acts sassy and provocative towards adults in a sexually charged manner. Often qualifies for [[loli]]. The masculine equivalent is called "[[osugaki]]".

Typical attributes include [[smug]] or [[naughty_face|naughty]] expressions, a mocking [[laughing|laugh]], a single [[fang]] / [[skin fang]], [[twintails]], [[short shorts]], [[miniskirt]]s/[[microskirt]]s, exposed [[midriff]], calling people "[[zako (phrase)|]]", etc. May be an [[oppai loli]].

Not to be confused with erogaki ("erotic brat") who is sexually forward or seductive without being sassy, or kusogaki ("shitty brat") who is sassy without a sexual undertone.

The present meaning seems to date back to August 2018, after the announcement of [[Grim Aloe]] being added to [[Bombergirl]]. For more details, see comment #2388484.

h4. See also

* [[mesugaki pose]]
* [[osugaki]]
* [[zako (phrase)|]]

title: zuiyin
body:
In [[Renzha Fanpai Zijiu Xitong]], a [i]zuiyin[/i] is a cursed [[forehead mark]] that indicates that somebody has succumbed to darkening or their so called heart demons (心魔). The term translates to criminal seal or mark of sin. It is often depicted as a [[flame_print|flame-shaped print]] and can change in shape and form depending on the possessor's mental state, sometimes expanding throughout their entire body.

h4. Examples

* !post #6635219

title: urna
body:
A lock of white hair on the [[forehead]] of traditional [[Buddhism|Buddhist]] statues, depicted as a spiral or circular dot. 

Also known as [i]báiháo[/i] in Chinese or [i]byakugou[/i] in Japanese. Note that the term [i]bai hao[/i] is also used for the silver hairs on "white tea":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_tea], which are usually called [i]mouji[/i] [毛茸] in Japanese.

h4. Examples

* !post #1508257

h4. See also

* [[Buddhism]]
* [[statue]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Urna":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urna]

title: huadian
body:
Traditional Chinese makeup, which may be located on the [[forehead mark|forehead]], [[mark_between_eyes|between the eyebrows]], the [[marking on cheek|cheeks]], the temples,  and/or the [[dimple facial mark|dimples]].

Huadian were historically worn by women - however, in fantasy depictions based in China, or with Chinese themes, there are depictions of men with similar  or identical markings. This is used sometimes - though not always - as an indicator of supernatural abilites, deity status, or other non-human traits. This may derive from Buddhist influence, with an example being Nezha (哪吒), a male diety from Chinese and Indian mythology, or Erlang Shen, of whom is sometimes depicted with his third eye as a [[forehead mark]].

Also known as huazi, mianhua, meizi, Shouyang makeup, and plum blossom makeup.

h4. Examples

* !post #2968099

h4. See also

* [[Bindi]] (Hindu forehead mark)

title: fitting_room
body:
A small room in a [[clothes shop]] where shoppers can [[trying on clothes|try on clothes]] in privacy. These rooms usually include [[mirror]]s and a hook where [[clothes hanger]]s may be hung. They may have privacy [[curtains]] in lieu of doors.

h4. Examples

* !post #8137205
* !post #6473771
* !post #9516468

h4. See also

* [[changing room]] - room at hotsprings and bathhouses for undressing before bathing
* [[dressing room]] - room where idols, musicians or actors change their costumes and makeup before and after performances

title: viewer_self-insert
body:
When a character is supposed to serve as a stand in for [i]you[/i], the viewer. Typically [[faceless]] or underdetailed to ease this process.

h4.See also

* [[artist self-insert]]
* [[artist self-reference]]
* [[Tag group:People]]

title: artist_self-insert
body:
When the artist or creator puts themselves in their story, game, movie, etc, whether it be as a depiction of themselves, an [[original]] design representing themselves (including [[virtual youtuber]] avatar), them embodying one of their original characters or a generic [[faceless]] character, or even having an existing character act as their persona.

h4.See also

* [[real life insert]]
* [[viewer self-insert]]
* [[self-portrait]]
* [[artist self-reference]]
* [[Tag group:People]]

title: real_life_insert
body:
When the artist or creator uses persons from [[real life]] like relatives, friends, actors, politicians, etc, whether it be as a depiction of the inserted person, an original design representing them, them embodying one of their original characters, or even having an existing character act as their persona.

h4.See also

* [[artist self-insert]]
* [[viewer self-insert]]
* [[Tag group:People]]

title: setanta's_puppy_(fate)
body:
[quote]This puppy growls at the moonlit night.

A puppy that manifested along with the Heroic Spirit Sétanta. Could it be that the soul of the Hound of Culann he once killed latched on to Sétanta's soul in the Throne and miraculously manifested in miniature form? Or is this the spirit of an offspring of the legendary ferocious hound?

Sétanta himself doesn't really know.

What is clear is that this puppy doesn't actually help Sétanta in battle, nor does it share emotions and sensations like a familiar.

...And that it growls at the moonlit night.[/quote]

An unnamed [[white dog|white]] [[puppy]] seen accompanying [[Setanta (fate)|]] in [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]] and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

h4. Appearance
* !asset #32546822

h4. See also

* [[Freki and Geri (fate)|]]

title: list_of_fate_series_characters
body:
This is a compilation of all tagged characters, weapons, and other miscellaneous terms seen in the [[fate (series)|Fate series]], a mixed-media project developed by Type-Moon. All tags will be listed in the first entry they appear in to avoid redundancy. Servants will also have any related weapons, alternate forms, and/or Noble Phantasms (essentially a powerful attack the Servant can use) listed beneath that Servant's name.

[expand=Table of Contents]
* "Multiple Games":#dtext-multiple
** "Class Cards":#dtext-class-cards
* "Fate/Stay Night":#dtext-fsn (2004)
* "Fate/Hollow Ataraxia":#dtext-fha (2005)
* "Fate/Zero":#dtext-zero (2006)

title: setanta_(fate)
body:
Saber-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]]. He is the boyhood self of [[Cu Chulainn (fate)|]]. In this form, he does not yet possess [[Gae Bolg (fate)|]], as he hasn't finished his training under [[Scathach (fate)|]]. He is always accompanied by a [[Setanta's puppy (fate)|white puppy]].

He was added to [[Fate/Grand Order]] with the release of the [[Lilim Harlot]] event.

title: denpa_onna_to_seishun_otoko
body:
[b]Denpa Onna to Seishun Otoko[/b] (transl. [i]Ground Control to Psychoelectric Girl[/i]) is a 2009-2011 light novel series written by Iruma Hitoma and illustrated by [[Buriki]], with a manga adaptation illustrated by [[Yamane Masato]] and serialized in ASCII Media Works' [i]Dengeki G's Magazine[/i], and 2011 anime adaptation by [[SHAFT (company)|]].

Due to his parents' overseas work, [[Niwa Makoto]] moves to the city to live with his 39-year-old aunt [[Touwa Meme]]. The boy, who expected to live a dream life with a harem, is instead confronted with a hitherto unknown relative: Meme's daughter [[Touwa Erio]], a strange recluse with a fascination for aliens. Makoto has since been trying to help her open up, even as he gets to know more about his cousin.

h4. Characters

* [[Maekawa]]
* [[Mifune Ryuuko]]
* [[Niwa Makoto]]
* [[Touwa Erio]]
* [[Touwa Meme]]

h4. External links

* "Official Site":http://www.starchild.co.jp/special/denpa/
* "Wikipedia: Ground Control to Psychoelectric Girl":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ground_Control_to_Psychoelectric_Girl

title: zygarde
body:
A Dragon/Ground-type Legendary [[Pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]], #0718 in the National Pokédex.

It is comprised of multiple organisms known as [[Zygarde Cell]]s and [[Zygarde Core]]s; its form varies based on how many of its Cells and Cores are gathered.

Each of its three main forms are predominantly black and green with [[hexagon]]al eyes and scales.

title: kaiju
body:
[b]Kaiju[/b] (怪獣) is a Japanese word that means "strange beast," but often translated in English as "monster." Specifically, it is used to refer to a genre of tokusatsu entertainment involving [[giant monster]]s.

Related terms include kaiju eiga (怪獣映画, monster movie), a film featuring kaiju, kaijin (怪人, humanoid monsters) and daikaiju (大怪獣, giant monster), specifically meaning the larger variety of monsters.

The most famous kaiju is [[Godzilla]]. Other well-known kaiju include [[Mothra]], [[Anguirus]], [[Rodan]], [[Gamera]], and [[King Ghidorah]].

h4. Franchises

* [[Gamera (series)|]]
* [[Godzilla (series)|]]
* [[Pacific Rim]]
* [[Ultra Series]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Kaiju":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kaiju]

title: ski_goggles
body:
Protective eyewear used to shield the eyes from cold, wind, snow, debris, etc. while [[skiing]]. For maximum visibility, ski goggles tend to have a single large lens that covers both eyes. They usually have a polarizing filter or are tinted to reduce glare.

title: water_volleyball
body:
A competitive team-based [[water]] sport, usually played in a swimming pool. The game is played similarly to ordinary [[volleyball]].

h4.See also

* [[water polo]]
* [[playing sports]]
* [[Tag Group:Sports]]

title: beach_volleyball
body: A variant of [[volleyball]] played on the [[beach]].

title: volleyball
body:
A team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a [[volleyball net]]. Each team tries to score points by grounding a ball on the other team's court under organized rules. It may be played on grass, sand, snow, or on an indoor court such as in a [[gym]].

[[Beach volleyball]] is a popular variant with two players per team and a slightly different set of rules.

h4.See also

* [[volleyball (object)]]
* [[volleyball net]]
* [[volleyball uniform]]
* [[beach volleyball]]
* [[water volleyball]]
* [[playing sports]]
* [[Tag group:Sports]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Volleyball":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volleyball]

title: boxing
body:
The sport of boxing, in which fighters [[punching|punch]] each other to either achieve a knockout or win by referee decision.

Boxers typically wear [[boxing gloves]] to protect their hands and lessen the impact of their punch towards the opponent.

This tag refers to the international boxing (i.e. western boxing), where [[kicking]] and using other attacks aside from punching is forbidden. If a kick is used by the character, tag [[kickboxing]] instead.
 
h4. See also

* [[boxer]]
* [[boxing gloves]]
* [[boxing ring]]
* [[boxing shorts]]
* [[kickboxing]]

title: slam_dunk_(basketball)
body: In [[basketball]], a dunk is when a player jumps over the [[basketball hoop|hoop]] and slams the ball directly in.

title: basketball_hoop
body: In [[basketball]], the hoop is the object one must throw the [[basketball_(object)|ball]] into in order to score. Typically accompanied by a backboard.

title: basketball
body:
A team sport. The objective is to shoot a [[basketball_(object)|ball]] through a basket horizontally positioned to score points while following a set of rules. Usually, two teams of five players play on a marked rectangular court with a basket at each width end. Basketball is one of the world's most popular and widely viewed sports.

Use this tag when referring to the game as a whole.
Use [[basketball_(object)]] when referring to the ball.

h4. See also
* [[basketball hoop]]
* [[slam dunk (basketball)|]]
* [[National Basketball Association]]
* [[Playing sports]]
* [[Tag Group:Sports]]

title: basketball_(object)
body: The type of [[ball]] used in [[basketball]].

title: hockey_mask
body: A [[mask]] used by [[ice hockey]] [[goalkeeper]]s to protect their face from stray pucks. The original design has fallen out of favor for caged helmets worn nowadays, but it lives on in fiction and artwork, notably as [[Jason Voorhees]]' signature item.

title: face_shield
body:
A protective covering for all or part of the face that is commonly made of clear plastic and is worn especially to prevent injury (as from impact, extreme temperature, or a dangerous substance) or to reduce the spread of transmissible disease. It is commonly used by [[soldier]]s and [[riot police]].

h4. See also
* [[visor (armor)]]

title: dungeon_of_regalias
body:
[i]Dungeon of Regaliasan[/i] is an eroge dungeon RPG developed and published by Astronauts/Sirius with illustrations by [[M&M (Mickey and Mackey)|]]. The game released on March 25, 2016.

Japanese Title: ダンジョン_オブ_レガリアス_~背徳の都イシュガリア~

h4. Plot

The floating city of Windal was full of prosperity due to its advanced magic culture. However, an unexplained massive magic explosion sent the city crashing to the ground, killing almost all of its citizens. Only a huge crater and the ruins of the city underneath it remained.

Nomads built many villages and over time, the area turned into the large metropolis Ishgalia. Reckless adventurers came to the city to challenge the demon-infested labyrinths under the city in the hopes of striking it rich. The battle-seasoned Orias, who has no memories before becoming a mercenary, arrived at Ishgalia in search of his forgotten past. What awaits him in the depths of the labyrinth and the ruins of the floating city?

h4. Characters
* [[Claudia Azure]]

title: golf_club
body: A long wooden or metal stick that has a heavy head on a slender shaft, used to hit the ball in [[golf]].

title: golf
body:
A game played on a large open-air course, in which a small hard [[golf ball|ball]] is struck with a [[golf club|club]] into a series of small holes in the ground, the object being to use the fewest possible strokes to complete the course.

h4. See also

title: umpire
body:
An official who observes a sports game to enforce the rules of the game.

Umpires are used in a variety of games, including [[baseball]] and [[tennis]]. In other sports, the official is called a [[referee]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8324659

h4. See also

* [[referee]]

title: referee
body:
An official who observes a sports game to enforce the rules of the game.

Referees are used in a variety of games, including [[soccer]], [[basketball]], and [[boxing]]. In other sports, the official is called an [[umpire]].

h4. See also

body:
A set of light clothes used for playing [[tennis]]. Men wear a t-shirt and shorts, while women wear a t-shirt and either a [[tennis skirt]] or [[short shorts]]. These allow for fluid and swift movement when trying to catch the [[tennis ball]]. A [[visor cap]] is also a common accessory.

body:

Has the appearance of a young girl with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], a [[flat chest]], a [[broken horn]], and a [[demon tail]] with three spades on the end. title: shamisen
body:
A traditional Japanese three-stringed [[instrument]] usually played with a [[plectrum]] called a [[bachi]]. The occasional association with cats comes from the fact that shamisen skins were traditionally made using dog or cat skin, with cat skin favored for finer instruments.

For the cat from the [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu]] series, see [[Shamisen (Suzumiya Haruhi)]].

For [[Yoshida Yuuko|Shamiko]]'s senior, see [[Lilith (Machikado Mazoku)]].

The shamisen is derived from the Chinese [[sanxian (instrument)|]].

h4. Examples

h4. See also

* [[bachi]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Shamisen":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shamisen

body:
Supporting character in [[Machikado Mazoku]]. She is the demonic ancestor of [[Yoshida Yuuko]], currently physically trapped inside a statue. She appears in her true form in Yuuko's dreams, and was later given a [[minigirl|small]] homunculus body to move autonomously.

title: demon_girl
body:
A female character with a demonic appearance. Typical characteristics include [[fangs]], [[demon horns]], [[glowing eyes]], [[pointy ears]], [[colored skin]], [[colored sclera]], [[claws]], [[hooves]], [[demon wings]] and [[demon tail|long tails]].

Succubi are often, if not nearly always, visually depicted as demon girls.

h4. Notable examples

* [[Albedo (overlord)|]] from [[Overlord (maruyama)|]]
* [[Etna (disgaea)|]] from [[Disgaea]]
* [[Morrigan Aensland]] and [[Lilith (darkstalkers)|]] from [[Darkstalkers]]
* The female cast of [[Helltaker]]
* [[Yoshida Yuuko]] from [[Machikado Mazoku]]

h4. See also

* [[angel]]
* [[angel and devil]]
* [[demon]]
* [[demon boy]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: machikado_mazoku
body:
[b]Machikado Mazoku[/b] (lit. "Street Corner Demon") is a Japanese [[4koma]] manga series drawn by [[Itou Izumo]]. An anime adaptation aired during the summer 2019 season. A second anime season was announced in the October 2020 issue of Houbunsha's Manga Time Kirara Carat magazine.

Localized as [i]The Demon Girl Next Door[/i].

h4. Characters

title: yoshida_yuuko
body:
Titular character of the anime/manga series [[Machikado Mazoku]]. She is a newly awakened [[demon girl]] with [[brown eyes]] and [[brown hair]] (red in the anime) along with [[horns]] and a [[demon tail]].

Her demonic alias is '[b]Shadow Mistress Yuuko[/b]' (シャドウミストレス優子), shortened by others to [b]Shamiko[/b] (シャミ子).  
Similar to magical girls, she can magically transform into a revealing [[Crisis Management Form (machikado Mazoku)|Crisis Management Form]] costume to enhance her abilities.
other_names: 吉田優子/シャミ子/吉田良子

title: iosys
body:
A Sapporo-based musical ensemble doujin group best known for remixes of music from the [[Touhou]] series.

Their song [[Marisa Stole the Precious Thing]] or "Marisa Stole Something Very Important" has, through its popular and memetic promotional video (post #82943), brought Touhou and the [[Alice Margatroid]]/[[Kirisame Marisa]] pairing to the attention of a huge number of people.

h4. Songs

title: alienposting_(meme)
body:
Also known as Zeep Glorp, refers to edited and Photoshopped images of animals and meme characters made to look like green [[alien]]s with antennas who speak an incoherent language.

The trend started in late 2022 when the alien dog Geeble was created, being an edited version of the Handheld Pupper photo. Then, Gnarp Gnarp surfaced: a green alien cat. Many of the green alien animals were paired with captions and text that read like an alien language, including many "eep" and "orp" sounds like "zeep" and "glorp."

h4. Examples

* !asset #23436753: Gnarp Gnarp and Geeble.

h4. See also

* [[Bogos Binted (meme)|]] 

h4. External links

* "KnowYourMeme: Alienposting / Zeep Glorp":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/alienposting-zeep-glorp

title: bulgarian_audio
body: A post with [[audible speech]] in Bulgarian, including lyrics in songs.

title: mixed-language_audio
body:
A post that has [[audible speech]] in more than one language, including lyrics in songs. Tag all of the languages included alongside this tag.

Note that as it's common for Japanese songs to have words borrowed from English or even other languages in their lyrics, a single borrowed word or two shouldn't warrant this tag, nor does it warrant the corresponding language tag, unless the sentence puts intentional focus on the "mixed-language" aspect.

title: katsuragi_ace_(umamusume)
body:
An [[Umamusume]] character, voiced by [[Fujiwara Natsumi]].

A country bumpkin who got bumped up into the big leagues, Katsuragi Ace hates the boring and small things in life. Her biggest dreams is to become the Ace of the world of [[horse girl]]s, crushing races and winning prizes. While she does look up to [[Mr. C.B. (umamusume)|]] a lot, Katsuragi Ace is aware that she is merely a goal to surpass and won't let her rose-colored glasses get in the way of achieving it.
