title: loves_only_you_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]]. Voiced by [[Kubota Miyu|]].

A [[livestream|streamer]] [[horse girl]] with a large fanclub, she runs to bring love to fans around the world while being supported by the same fans with their own love. Indeed, this aspect is integrated to her character with her unique skill and her unique "love" mechanic, which increases in effectiveness with the more fans you obtain in training. Is also a terrible artist.

Her [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[split-color hair]] represents the hood the real horse wore as part of the Yahagi stable.

title: shortstack
body:
Literally "short" + "stacked"; a short woman who has [[large breasts]] and/or [[wide hips]].

Differs from [[oppai loli]] in that the shortstack is clearly a typical adult/adolescent in age despite their short stature, while an oppai loli appears childlike apart from the curves.

Consider using [[pear-shaped figure]] when the hips are wider than the bust, as there is less stacking.

body:
[[Umamusume]] character and resident [[shortstack]] of the series.

[[Horse girl]] with [[brown eyes|brownish]] [[orange eyes|orange]] [[star-shaped pupils|star-shaped]] eyes. Her [[black hair]] is done up in massive [[twintails]] with saddle-looking leather covers on them and slightly [[drill sidelocks|drill-shaped sidelocks]]. She also wears a vaguely flower-shaped cloth [[ear ornament]] on her right ear.

Marvel is easily excitable and regularly peppers her speech with the word "marvelous" as an allusion to her name.

title: advent_deck
body:
Tools from “[[Kamen Rider Ryuki (series)|Kamen Rider Ryuki]]”. They are cases for storing [[Advent Card|Advent Cards]].

By holding it out towards the reflective surface, the transformer is equipped with [[V Buckle]]. Attaching it to V Buckle as it is transforms the transformer into a Kamen Rider.

When the owner enters into a contract with a Mirror Monster, a crest symbolising that Monster appears on this surface.

In “[[Kamen Rider Dragon Knight]]”, it was also used as a substitute for a [[shield]].

title: sarong
body:
A large sheet of fabric worn around the waist as a [[skirt]], usually over a [[bikini]]. It's usually tied into a knot at one side of the hip.

The Japanese word for sarong is パレオ ([i]pareo[/i]). Strictly speaking, a pareo and a sarong are different garments: the former originated in Tahiti, the latter in Malaysia. In their traditional, native forms they might be distinguished. However they are usually equivalent in common usage.

h4. Examples

* !post #8129810
* !post #7825232

h4. See also

* [[swimsuit cover-up]]

title: advent_card
body:
[[card|Cards]] used by the Kamen Riders in “[[kamen_rider_ryuki_(series)|Kamen Rider Ryuki]]”.

Cards pulled from the [[Advent Deck]] are scanned with the Visor to produce the appropriate effect for that Card.
Once a Card has been used, it cannot be reused unless it is once untransformed.

h2. List
* [b]Contract[/b]: The Card for contracting the Mirror Monster.
* [b]Seal[/b]: The card is designed to protect the cardholder from Mirror Monsters. It is not possible to have this and ‘Advent’ at the same time.
* [b]Advent[/b]: Summons the [[Contract Monster]]. This is a variant of ‘Contract’.
** In “[[Kamen Rider Dragon Knight]]”, the name was changed to “[b]Attack Vent[/b]”.
* [b]Final Vent[/b]: Cooperate with Contract Monster to perform special moves.
* [b]Sword Vent[/b]: Summons weapons such as [[sword]], [[lance]], or [[naginata]].
* [b]Strike Vent[/b]: Summon weapons that fit in the hand, such as [[gauntlets|gauntlet]] or [[claw_(weapon)|claws]].
* [b]Guard Vent[/b]: Summon [[shield]] or other protective gear, or have Contract Monster defend against enemy attacks.
* [b]Shoot Vent[/b]: The Card for long-range attacks. Summons the [[cannon]] or activates a special move.
* [b]Swing Vent[/b]: Summon the [[whip]].
* [b]Spin Vent[/b]: Summons the [[drill]] type weapon.
* [b]Hold Vent[/b]: Summons the [[yo-yo]] type weapon.
* [b]Nasty Vent[/b]: Let the Contract Monster interfere with the enemy's actions.
* [b]Trick Vent[/b]: Multiple [[clone|clones]] emerge.
* [b]Copy Vent[/b]: It duplicates weapons and protective gear summoned by another Kamen Rider and makes it its own.
** [[Kamen Rider Verde|Verde]]'s Card mimics it plus the opponent's appearance.
* [b]Confine Vent[/b]: Cancels the effect of an Card used by an enemy Kamen Rider.
* [b]Return Vent[/b]: Allows a Card that has been disabled by a Confine Vent to be used again.
* [b]Steal Vent[/b]: Take away a weapon or protective gear equipped by an enemy Kamen Rider.
* [b]Clear Vent[/b]: Make the Cardholder [[invisible]]. If the owner has been in contact with other Kamen Rider, it applies to that one as well.
* [b]Blust Vent[/b]: The Contract Monster creates a gust of wind. 
** In “[[Kamen Rider Dragon Knight]]”, the name was changed to “[b]Blast Vent[/b]”.
* [b]Strange Vent[/b]: When scanned, it changes into a different kind of Card.
* [b]Unite Vent[/b]: Fuse the Contract Monsters.
* [b]Freeze Vent[/b]: Freezes the enemy, thereby blocking their movement.
* [b]Time Vent[/b]: [[Kamen Rider Odin|Odin]]-specific Card. Turn back time.
* [b]Survive[/b]: Power up to Survive form. There are three cards in existence: “Flame”, “Gale”, and “Infinite”.
* [b]Accele Vent[/b]: Temporarily accelerate the Cardholder.
* [b]Wheel Vent[/b]: Transforms the Contract Monster into motorbike form.
* [b]Link Vent[/b]: Card added in “Kamen Rider Dragon Knight”. Multiple Kamen Riders cooperate to perform special moves.

title: wingslasher
body:
It is the weapon used by [[Kamen Rider Femme]]. She uses the [[Advent Card|Sword Vent]] to use this. 
It has the appearance of a golden [[double-sided polearm|double-sided]] [[glaive (polearm)|]], which at the same time resembles the forward edge of [[Blancwing]]'s wings.

Practically there's no major differences to her current design. The only significant difference is a [[alternate color|different color]] scheme which includes [[yellow eyes]], [[yellow shorts]] and a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]]. This along with the similarities of her [[kagamine len (if)|counterpart]], were intended to have a even stronger [i]mirror image[/i] motif.

A color-corrected version of this same design, with her final [[white bow]] and [[aqua eyes]] but retaining the yellow shorts, was the first character art of Rin revealed to the public in DTM Magazine. Posts that predate the revelation of her final design will commonly reflect these traits.

title: baseball
body:
A bat-and-ball sport played between two teams of nine players. The aim is to score runs by hitting a thrown [[baseball (object)|ball]] with a [[baseball bat|bat]] and touching a series of four [[baseball base|bases]] arranged at the corners of a 90-foot diamond. 

Players on the batting team take turns hitting against the pitcher of the fielding team, which tries to stop them from scoring runs by getting hitters out in any of several ways. A player on the batting team can stop at any of the bases and later advance via a teammate's hit or other means. The teams switch between batting and fielding whenever the fielding team records three outs. One turn at bat for each team constitutes an inning and nine innings make up a professional game. The team with the most runs at the end of the game wins.

This tag is for the sport of baseball. For the ball itself, see [[baseball (object)]].

title: electric_wind_god_fist
body:
Electric Wind God Fist (abbreviated EWGF), is a technique in the [[Tekken]] series used by practitioners of Mishima-style karate. It is a just frame variant of the Wind God Fist where the last input and button press must be performed at the same moment. The resulting move is a Wind God Fist that is faster and safer to use, making it a vital staple of any player using Mishima-style characters.

It is called the Fastest Wind God Fist (最速風神拳, Saisoku Fuujinken), in Japanese.

h4. Examples

* !asset #31181722: Reina using EWGF

h4. See also

* "Tekken Wiki: Electric Wind Gold Fist":[https://tekken.fandom.com/wiki/Electric_Wind_God_Fist]

title: soccer
body:
A team [[playing sports|sport]] played between two teams of eleven players using a [[soccer ball]]. The object of the game is to score by driving the [[ball]] into the opposing goal.

Soccer is formally called "Association football", but is more commonly known as "football" in most countries outside of the United States, Japan, Canada, and Australia.

The term "soccer" is of UK origin, being a shorthand for As[b]soc[/b]iation Football at Oxford University that has now long fallen out of use there.  It is a term in the same vein as "rugger" which refers to [b]Rug[/b]by Football.

title: baseball_base
body: The bases of [[baseball]] are small plates, usually white and made of rubber, placed in a diamond shape around a [[baseball stadium|baseball field]]. There are four: first, second, third, and home base (sometimes called the "home plate"). A runner needs to touch every base from first to home without being tagged or forced out in order to score a home run. While the numerical bases are usually square, the home plate is in the shape of a pentagon.

title: badminton
body:
A racquet sport played by either two opposing players (singles) or two opposing pairs (doubles), who take positions on opposite halves of a rectangular court that is divided by a net. The player scores points by striking a [[shuttlecock]] with his [[badminton racket|racket]] so that it passes over the net and lands in his opponent's half of the court. Each side may only strike the shuttlecock once before it passes over the net. A rally ends once the shuttlecock hits the floor.

Use this tag only when referring to the game.

title: hasshaku-sama
body:
[b]Hasshaku-sama[/b] (八尺様, lit. "Ms. Eight-feet-tall") is the titular monster of a 2008 [[japanese urban legends|fictional ghost story]] that was posted in "Let's gather up seriously, deadly scary stories, shall we? (死ぬ程洒落にならない怖い話を集めてみない?)" thread/topic of [[2channel]]'s Occult Board. This is regarded as  one of the best stories in the thread. 

Essentially a female [[Slender Man]], she stalks and kills (or rapes) her young targets when they're out in the open space after seeing her tall visage. She makes her presence known with her signature laugh "Po, po, po..." with a somewhat masculine voice.

Her usual depiction is a [[tall female|tall woman]] with [[large breasts|large]] to [[huge breasts]] with [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]]. She's usually depicted wearing a [[white dress|white]] [[sundress]] and a [[sun hat]].

h4. See also

* [[Alcina Dimitrescu]]
* [[Kuchisake-onna]]
* [[Mary-san]]
* [[Yamamura Sadako]]

h4. External links

* 2ch datalog: http://syarecowa.moo.jp/196-2/71.html 
* Pixiv tag search for all images related to the thread: "洒落怖":http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?word=%E6%B4%92%E8%90%BD%E6%80%96&s_mode=s_tag_full

title: alcina_dimitrescu
body:
[[Resident Evil Village]] character.

Alcina has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair|black]] [[wavy hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[pale skin]], and [[red lipstick|red lips]]. She has a large, [[black headwear|black]] [[sun hat|wide-brimmed hat]] and multiple [[pearl necklace|pearl necklaces]] around her neck. She wears a [[long dress|long]] [[white dress]] with a [[black flower]] on her left side and a pair of [[black gloves]]. She often carries around a [[cigarette holder]].

Explicitly stated to be [b]290cm (9'6")[/b] [[tall female|tall]] with her hat and heels.

h4. See also

title: ashley_graham
body:
A major character from [[Resident Evil 4]]. Ashley is the US President's daughter, taken captive by Los Illuminados. After a report stating that she was seen in Europe, it becomes [[Leon S. Kennedy|Leon]]'s initial objective in the game to confirm her whereabouts and retrieve her. When Ashley is with Leon, it is the player's duty to protect her. In a short section of the game, the player also assumes control of Ashley.

In the original, she wears her [[blonde hair|blonde]] hair in a [[bob cut]] and her outfit consists of an orange [[sleeveless turtleneck]], a [[green skirt|green]] [[plaid skirt|tartan]] [[miniskirt]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]]. 

In the remake, she has a different [[short hair|short hairstyle]] and her skirt is changed to [[green shorts|green]] [[skort]]-type  [[plaid shorts|plaid]] [[short shorts|shorts]]. She also wears [[brown pantyhose]] [[pantyhose under shorts|under her shorts]]. The turtleneck and boots are the same as in her original outfit, and she additionally often wears an [[orange jacket]].

She is voiced by [[Kitou Akari]] in Japanese and [[Carolyn Lawrence]] (original) and [[Genevieve Buechner]] (remake) in English.
other_names: アシュリー・グラハム

title: ada_wong
body:
Ada Wong is a recurring character appearing in the [[Resident Evil]] video game series. A mysterious American woman of Asian descent, Ada is a cunning and formidable secret agent, typically served as the main anti-hero of the series and an (implied) love interest of [[Leon S. Kennedy]].

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] usually stylized in a [[bob cut]]. She is usually depicted wearing a [[red dress]], [[black choker]], [[black pantyhose]], [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]], [[bracelet]]s, and a [[wristwatch]]. In [[Resident Evil 6]], she wears a [[red jacket]] and [[black pants]]. In [[Resident Evil 4 (remake)]], she wears a [[red sweater|red]] [[turtleneck sweater|turtleneck]] [[sweater dress]].

title: resident_evil_village
body:
The tenth game in the [i][[Resident Evil]][/i] series released in 2021  also informally known as [i]Resident Evil 8[/i].

It follows the story of [[Ethan Winters]] who must search for his kidnapped daughter, [[Rosemary Winters]] in a European village.

title: resident_evil_7:_biohazard
body:
[i][b]Resident Evil 7: Biohazard[/b][/i] is a part of the Resident Evil series was released  in January 2017.

It is the first game in the series to use a first person mode, and supports PlayStation VR, and notable for bringing the franchise back to the survival horror genre.

h4.Story

The story follows Ethan Winters as he searches for his wife Mia, which leads him to a derelict plantation inhabited by the Baker family.

h4. List of Characters

* [[Ethan Winters]]
* [[Mia Winters]]

h6.  Baker's family

* [[Jack Baker]]
* [[Marguerite Baker]]
* [[Lucas Baker]]
* [[Zoe Baker]]

h6. Other Characters

* [[Clancy Javis]]
* [[Eveline]]
* [[Chris Redfield]]

title: resident_evil_6
body:
A 2012 action third-person video game developed by [[Capcom]].

Follows the story of four characters: [[Leon S. Kennedy]], [[Chris Redfield]], [[Ada Wong]], and [[Jake Muller]] all of whom must face a worldwide bioterrorist threat.

The game is notable for its mixed reviews due to abandoning the franchise's horror theme.

title: resident_evil_5
body:
[b][i]Resident Evil 5[/i][/b] is a 2009 third-person shooter developed by [[Capcom]].

The premise of the game follows a bioterrorist threat occuring in the fictional region of Kijuju, from West Africa.

title: resident_evil_4
body:
[b][i]Resident Evil 4[/i][/b] known in Japan as [i]Biohazard 4[/i], is a 2005 third-person shooter survival horror video game developed and published by [[Capcom]].

The story of Resident Evil 4 follows the U.S. government special agent [[leon s. kennedy|Leon S. Kennedy]], who is sent on a mission to rescue [[Ashley Graham]], the U.S. President's daughter whom a sinister cult has kidnapped. Traveling to a rural area of Spain, Leon fights hordes of violent villagers and reunites with the mysterious spy [[Ada Wong]].

The game is notable for redefining the third-person genre with its over-the-shoulder camera.

h4.See Also
* [[Resident Evil 4 (remake)]]
* "Resident Evil Wiki: Resident Evil 4":http://residentevil.wikia.com/wiki/Resident_Evil_4

title: resident_evil_0
body:
[b][i]Resident Evil 0[/i][/b] is a 2002 video game developed by [[Capcom]].

Its story revolves a former CEO of Umbrella Corporation who sought revenge against the organization for betraying him, spreading the T-Virus-infected leeches into their train and research facility.

title: resident_evil_3:_nemesis
body:
[b][i]Resident Evil 3: Nemesis[/i][/b] is a 1999 video game developed by [[Capcom]].

It follows the story of [[Jill Valentine]] who must escape Raccoon City after being pursued by [[Nemesis (Resident Evil)|]].

A remake of the game was released on 2020.

title: resident_evil_2
body:
A horror video game released in 1998 by [[Capcom]] and the sequel to 1996's [i][[Resident Evil 1|Resident Evil]][/i].

It follows the story of [[Leon S. Kennedy]] and [[Claire Redfield]] as they escape Raccoon City infested by the undead.

A remake of the same name was released on 2019.

title: resident_evil_1
body:
A 1996 video game developes by [[Capcom]].

Follows the story of S.T.A.R.S. members [[Jill Valentine]] and [[Chris Redfield]] who must escape a mansion filled with elaborate puzzles and deadly creatures.

Followed by its sequel, [i][[Resident Evil 2]][/i]. A 2002 remake was also released.

title: resident_evil
body:
[b]Resident Evil[/b] (known in Japan as [b]Biohazard[/b] ([b]バイオハザード[/b]) is a media franchise consisting of a survival horror/[[Biopunk]] video games series, comic books, novelizations, six Hollywood motion pictures, and a variety of collectibles, including action figures, strategy guides and publications. Developed by [[Capcom]] and created by Shinji Mikami, the game series has been influenced by George A. Romero's [i]Dead[/i] movies.

title: choukai_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s depiction of last ship of the Sakura Empire Takao-class heavy cruisers, IJN [i]Choukai[/i] (鳥海). Her censored name is "猋"("Describing the scene that a group of dogs are running swiftly").
 
In her base appearance, she has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[swept bangs]], floppy [[dog ears]] similar to Takao, and [[brown eyes]]. She wears a [[double-breasted]] [[military uniform]] similar to Takao and Atago, except with some blue accents, a [[white skirt|white]], [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. Her rigging is composed of 5 twin-[[ship turret|turrets]], 2 quad [[torpedo tubes]], 2 [[smokestack|smokestacks]], and one plate bearing the [[sakura empire (emblem)|sakura empire emblem]].

Her default appearance is strikingly similar to [[Type 95_(girls'_frontline)|]] from [[Girls' Frontline]] (to the point that her introduction line obliquely touches on it). Considering her artist, [[kishiyo]], originally drew both characters, this may not be a coincidence.

Voiced by [[Oohashi Ayaka]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #22570860: Default
* !post #5031944: [[choukai_(tidy_store_tidy_mind)_(azur_lane)|Tidy Store, Tidy Mind]]

title: maya_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s depiction of Sakura Empire Takao-class heavy cruiser, IJN [i]Maya[/i] (摩耶). Her censored name is "犮"("Dog").

Maya is a bit of black sheep in comparison to her sisters. In her base art (see post #2961792), she has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] in comparison to her sisters' long black hair. She has perked up [[dog ears]] like Atago. She wears a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]], [[black serafuku]] instead of the white naval uniform her sisters wear, alongside a [[white scarf]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and black [[loafers]]. Her [[rigging]] is composed of 5 twin-[[ship turret|turrets]], 2 quad [[torpedo tubes]] and 2 [[smokestack|smokestacks]].

Voiced by [[Oonishi Saori]].

title: maya_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Maya[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with a [[x_hair_ornament|x]] [[hairclip]]  and [[headgear|masts on her head]]. As with the rest of the Takao class, she also has [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[serafuku]] consisting of a blue [[sleeveless]] shirt, a white [[pleated skirt]], [[black gloves]] and a belt around her waist.

For her [[Maya Kai Ni (kancolle)|]] form, reflecting her refit as an AA Cruiser, she gains a new [[midriff]] baring uniform and a new rigging. She was given many AA guns and several AA Fire Detectors at various places on her body and rigging. She was also given a tiny [[hat]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hat ribbon]] and her "masts" have been simplified and a Fire Detector have been given to each.

Character design by [[Parsley-F]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

h4. [i]Takao[/i]-class heavy cruisers

* [[Takao (kancolle)|]] - [[Takao (cruiser)|first Takao-class cruiser]]
* [[Atago (kancolle)|]] - [[Atago (cruiser)|second Takao-class cruiser]]
* [b]Maya[/b] - third Takao-class cruiser
* [[Choukai (kancolle)|]] - fourth and final Takao-class cruiser

h4. See also
* [[Maya (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Maya (Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio)]]
* [[Maya (Warship Girls R)]]

title: choukai_(kancolle)
body:
Choukai is the fourth Takao-class heavy cruiser in [[Kantai Collection]].

She has [[red eyes]] and wears [[rimless eyewear|rimless]] [[glasses]], she has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair|dark brown]] or [[black hair]] and [[hair ornament|masts on her head]]. Her attire is very similar to her sister ship [[Maya (kancolle)|Maya]]'s, she wears a sailor dress consisting of a blue sleeveless shirt with an exposed [[midriff]], a white [[pleated skirt]], [[black gloves]] and a loose belt around her waist.

For her [[Choukai Kai Ni (kancolle)|]] form, she gains a new uniform and rigging which is a mirror image of Maya's own (the [[hat]] and rigging are to her right instead of Maya's left). Instead of being optimized for Anti-Air, she is built for night battles with spotlights on her "masts". This remodel is speculative, never having been remodeled historically as she was used extensively during the war, never having the chance to be remodeled. Thus, the remodel needs a blueprint.

Her seiyuu is [[Touyama Nao]].

h4. Takao-class Heavy Cruisers

* [[Takao (kancolle)|]] - [[Takao (cruiser)|first Takao-class cruiser]]
* [[Atago (kancolle)|]] - [[Atago (cruiser)|second Takao-class cruiser]]
* [[Maya (kancolle)|]] - third Takao-class cruiser
* [b]Choukai[/b] - fourth Takao-class cruiser

Her default (and only) outfit, shared with her sister Atago on historical grounds, comprises a [[blue hat|blue]] [[beret]], [[blue shirt|blue]] [[dress shirt]], [[white ascot]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], [[black gloves]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[rudder footwear]].

body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Atago[/i]. Character design by [[Mikoto Akemi]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sister Takao on historical grounds, comprises a [[blue hat|blue]] [[beret]], [[blue shirt|blue]] [[dress shirt]], [[white ascot]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], [[black gloves]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her bridge and funnels wrapped around her waist, and a circular half-rig hull containing three 20.3 cm twin gun mounts.

Her trademark catchphrase is shouting "[[pan-pa-ka-paaan!]]" when changing equipment. She also uses this as her unique greeting in the anime.

h4. Skins

* !post #2443834: Base
* !post #2004469: Swimsuit, [[kantai collection (anime)|anime]]-only

h4. See also

title: long_hair
body:

Some characters may have [[very long hair]], which extends past the waist, or [[absurdly long hair]], which is longer than they are tall.

title: animal_ears
body:
A character with animal ears, real or [[fake animal ears|fake]]. Also known as [i]kemonomimi[/i]. Do not use this tag for pictures of actual [[animal]]s. 

There are two areas where animal ears are usually placed. On top of the head and on the sides of the head (where a human's ears would be). The first type is much easier to [[fake_animal_ears|accessorize]] but anatomically incorrect. The inverse is true for the second type. The first type is most likely to have [[extra_ears|extra human ears]]. For the second type, "extra ears" usually means a redundant accessory.

h4. See also

* [[Ear wiggle]]
* [[Ears down]]
* [[Notched ear]]
* [[Fake animal ears]]
* [[Hair ears]]
* [[Kemonomimi mode]]
* [[Mismatched animal ear colors]]

* [[Tag group:Ears tags]]

title: atago_(azur_lane)
body:
Personification of Takao-class Heavy Cruiser from [[Azur Lane]]. Her censored name is "犬"("Dog").

She has [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]] with a pair of standing [[dog ears]] on top of her head, contrasting her sister [[Takao (azur lane)|]]'s folded down ears, and [[large breasts]]. She wears a white [[military uniform]] with a [[miniskirt]] and [[black thighhighs]].

She has a passionate and caring personality, considering herself to be the "big sister" of the fleet, while expressing affection towards the [[Commander (Azur Lane)|]].

Voiced by Ōki Saeko.

title: clover_(undertale_yellow)
body:
Protagonist and player character of [[Undertale Yellow]], a fan-made [[Undertale]] prequel. The last human to fall into the Underground before [[Frisk (Undertale)]] and is the Yellow SOUL of Undertale within Yellow's canon. Has [[yellow eyes]], [[short hair]] in a brown colour, a [[cowboy hat]] with brim wider than their shoulders, a [[brown shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] beneath a dark [[brown vest]], and dark [[blue pants]]. Wears a [[bandana around neck]]; this is yellow with a [[blue polka dots]] pattern but has also been shown in official art as a blue-yellow [[checkered]] pattern. Often seen with a [[revolver]].

Birthday is on March 17th.

title: hitachi_magic_wand
body:
An electric clitoral [[vibrator]]. It looks like a strange [[microphone]] with a white and/or gray head that vibrates.

The Hitachi Magic Wand was originally released in the 1970s as a therapeutic muscle massager, but was quickly picked up and utilized as a [[sex toy]]. In 2013, Hitachi ceased production of the device over concerns with the Hitachi name being associated with sex toys. However, production was later restarted, with Hitachi dropping its name from the product. The device is now distributed by Vibratex, under the name "Original Magic Wand" or "Magic Wand Original".

Its Pixiv tag is 電マ ([i]den-ma[/i]), an abbreviation for 電動マッサージ機 (electric massager). Not to be confused with [[denki anma]].

h4. See also

* [[vibrator]]
* [[sex toy]]

h4.External links

* "Official product page":http://magicwandoriginal.com/magic-wand-original
* "Wikipedia: Hitachi Magic Wand":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hitachi_Magic_Wand

title: kim_cheol
body:
Kim Cheol is the male protagonist of [i][[After School Lessons for Unripe Apples]][/i]. He is a third year student of Baekje Middle School and former childhood friends with the female lead, [[Hwang Mi-ae]]. Despite having an intimidating appearance, he is shown to be mature, diligent, and reasonable, though he is also easily agitated and does have bouts of childishness and jealousy. He initially had a bad reputation due to him having transferred to Baekje Middle School after getting into a serious fight at his old school, being given the nickname "Lucifer" by many of his peers.

He stands at a tall height, towering over almost all of his peers, especially Mi-ae. He has a [[scar on cheek|scar under his right eye]] and a stern face, often resulting in people assuming that he is angry or upset even when he is not.

title: ninja_gaiden_4
body:
A significant amount of time after the events of Ninja Gaiden 3, as the Dark Dragon was seemingly slain, its remains cause the Rain of Darkrot over Tokyo, indicating the divine dragon still lives. Yakumo, a young ninja from the Raven clan - a rival of the Hayabusa clan - dives into the ruined capital to assassinate the Dark Dragon Priestess Seori in order to fulfill his clan's prophecy. However, not is all as it seems; and in exchange for sparing her life, Seori offers to assist in undoing the seal so that Yakumo may slay the Dark Dragon once and for all.

Standing in Yakumo's path are the Divine Dragon Order, an organization responsible for policing the desolate city. This group guards the Seal of the Dark Dragon, and controls a horde of Fiends lurking through the world.

title: nyubara_reona
body:
The [[keyboard (instrument)|keyboardist]] of [[RAISE A SUILEN]] in [[BanG Dream!]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[twintails]] (either [[blue hair|blue]] and [[pink hair|pink]] or [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair|white]]) and [[red eyes]]. She is a second year middle school student and a big fan of [[Pastel Palettes (bang Dream!)|Pastel*Palettes]]. Her seiyuu is [[Kurachi Reo]].

Tagging note: On Pixiv, the tag パレオ/pareo is ambiguous.  It is Reona's nickname, but it is also a word meaning [[sarong]].

title: iran
body:
A country in Western Asia, officially known as the [b]Islamic Republic of Iran[/b]. Historically referred to as "[[Persia]]", the country is a regional military and cultural center, as well as a hub for Shia [[Islam]]. Their language is [[persian text|Farsi]]. The country was ruled by monarchy (or "shah") for over 2,500 years until it became a pseudo-theocratic republic in 1979 after the Islamic revolution.

Internationally the Iranian leadership and policy are well-known for staunch anti-Western (anti-[[United States|American]] and anti-[[Israel|Zionist]]) stance, as well as its support of armed insurgent groups around the Middle East such as [[hezbollah flag|Hezbollah]], [[Hamas]] and various Shia paramilitaries. 

h4. See also
* [[Islamic Republic of Iran Ground Forces]]
* [[Islamic Republic of Iran Air Forces]]
* [[Iranian flag]]

title: snowgrave_(spell)
body:
A [[cryokinesis]] spell used by [[Noelle Holiday (Dark World)|]] in the [[Weird Route (deltarune)|]] of [[Deltarune]]. The spell causes Noelle to float up into the air with [[blank eyes]] and [[outstretched arms]], and a pillar of [[snowflakes]] encase the target enemy, leaving behind a [[frozen]] body. Often accompanied by a [[dialogue box]] with the [[Soul (Deltarune)|]] selecting 'Proceed', and/or [[Kris (Deltarune)|]] [[pointing]] at the target. Due to the nature of the spell itself, [[snowing]] will also likely be applicable as a tag.

[spoilers]Noelle will almost always have the [[Thorn Ring (Deltarune)]] on her hand at the time, as the ring unlocks the ability for Noelle to use Snowgrave in the first place.[/spoilers]

title: nenju
body:
The Japanese name of [[prayer beads]] used by adherents of Dharmic religions ([[Hinduism]], [[Buddhism]], [[Sikh]]ism and Jainism).

Generally distinguishable by the presence of two [[tassel]]s in most variants, and some are bracelet-sized.

Also known as fózhū (佛珠) in Chinese, and japamala or mala in Sanskrit (माला).

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Japamala":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japamala

title: prayer_beads
body:
Any type of prayer beads used by members of various religions like  [[Christianity]] (Catholicism, Anglicanism), [[Islam]], [[Hinduism]], [[Buddhism]], [[Sikh]]ism, and Bahá'í Faith to count the repetitions of [[praying|prayers]], chants or devotions. They may also be used for meditation, protection from negative energy, or for relaxation.

May also apply to the similar prayer rope used by Orthodox Christians, despite their material is fabric or cord-based.

h4. Examples
* !post #7094736: Catholic/Anglican [[rosary]]
* !post #1060100: Buddhist [[nenju]] (佛珠)
* !post #7743222: [[Islam]]ic misbaha (Arabic: مسبحة)


h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Prayer beads":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prayer_beads
* Wikipedia: "Prayer rope":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prayer_rope

title: holding_prayer_beads
body: [[Holding]] any type of [[prayer beads]]. Can also be used with [[holding_rosary]].

title: stay_gold_(racehorse)
body:
[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Sire:[/td]
[td][[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Grandsire:[/td]
[td][[Halo (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dam:[/td]
[td][[Golden Sash (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[Dictus (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]


Japanese Racehorse. Sired by [[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Golden Sash (racehorse)|]] (herself sired by [[Dictus (racehorse)|]], a very temperamental but successful French racehorse), he was blessed with speed and sheer durability but cursed(?) by the compounded temperament of his parents.

He is best known as the sire of [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]] (A temperamental racehorse who won the 2011 Japanese Triple Crown), [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] (An unpredictable racehorse who was almost as successful as Orfevre), and [[Oju Chosan (racehorse)|]] (an astounding [b]6[/b] time winner of the Nakayama Grand Jump, as well as the 3 time winner of the Nakayama Daishogai).

In spite of the success of his offspring, the two above who ended up as the luminaries of their era, Stay Gold himself only won a single GI race in his 50 race-long career (his final race at the 2001 Hong Kong Vase) and tended to collect second places. To be fair, some of this has to do with the fact that he had to contend with the luminaries of [i]his[/i] era ([[Special Week (racehorse)|]] and [[T.M. Opera O (racehorse)|]] among others).

In the context of [[Umamusume]], aside from [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] being a popular character and [[Orfevre (umamusume)|]] being implemented much later, he is also the real-life sire of [[Nakayama Festa (umamusume)|]], [[Dream Journey (umamusume)|]] and [[Fenomeno (umamusume)|]]. In fact [[Stay Gold (umamusume)|his Umamusume counterpart]] had a mention in Dream Journey's scenario before she was unveiled. Otherwise, a stand-in of him appears in the first season of the anime (see [[Kin'iro Ryotei (umamusume)|]]).

h4. See also

* [[Stay Gold (Umamusume)]] - The official [[Umamusume]] character based on Stay Gold
* [[Kin'iro Ryotei (umamusume)]] - A background character from the [[Umamusume|Umamusume anime]] presumed to be based on Stay Gold

body:

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair|grey]]/[[brown hair|ash brown hair]] and is [[flat chest|flat]]/[[small breasts|small chested]]. Her outfit consists of a [[black_hat|black]] [[witch hat]] with a purple inner brim, black [[detached collar]] with a [[white ascot]], [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[black dress]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[detached sleeves]], [[x hair ornament]]s on her [[sidelocks|locks]], [[grey pantyhose]], and [[purple boots|purple]]-[[black boots|black]] [[gradient boots|gradient]] [[uneven legwear|uneven boots]] ([[ankle boots|ankle-length]] on her left but [[knee boots|knee-length]] on her right).

title: diddy_kong
body:
A Kong introduced in [i][[Donkey Kong Country]][/i], and a frequent participant in [[Mario (series)|Mario]] spinoffs since [i][[Mario Golf: Toadstool Tour]][/i].

Nimble and acrobatic, he is [[Donkey Kong]]'s little buddy and most reliable adventuring friend of the Kong Family. [[Dixie Kong]] is his girlfriend. 

Recognizable by his trademark [[red headwear|red]] [[baseball cap]] that's usually [[print_headwear|printed]] with the [[Nintendo]] logo and his [[red shirt|red]] [[sleeveless shirt]] that has two yellow [[star (symbol)|stars]] [[print shirt|printed]] on them.

Diddy Kong would haphazardly be called Donkey Kong's nephew in early material on occasion, but modern official bios disregard this entirely.

h4. Official Art
* !post #7952730

title: bara
body:
Bara ("Gei komi'":[https://www.fujoshi.info/geikomi] in Japan) is a Japanese genre of manga and art (usually) by and for gay and bisexual men. With heavy focus on the masculine features and appeal of [[mature male|men]]. 

While mostly dependent on an artist's personal tastes, the ‘bara’ archetype features 3 main body types:
* Bear-type bodies, (typically tagged as [[plump]] or [[fat]]), are generally softer and rounder looking, with varying degrees of visible musculature.
- Artists: [[Suv (suv032)|]], [[Kuro nezumi inu]], [[Tevit (tevit15)|]].
* Hunks/Jocks or [[muscular|Muscular-type]] bodies, in contrast to the chiseled [[v-taper | triangular look]] of professional bodybuilders, have defined musculature that is usually more proportional overall, similar to that of athletic "strongman":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strongman], with a [[strongman waist|wider waist]] ("comparison":[https://cdn.donmai.us/original/e8/4f/e84f5efad6fd9ef1ff268d1982a564d6.jpg]), though the more [[shredded muscles|chiseled]] appearance can be a stylistic choice (see [[Nikism]] for reference).
- Artists: [[Tarutoru]], [[Crow (siranui)|]], [[Dopey (dopq)|]].
* Twunk or otter-type bodies, tagged [[toned]], [i]or[/i] [[muscular]] (especially with younger or sometimes older [[mature male]]s). 
- Artists: [[itto_(mentaiko)|Mentaiko]], [[Homri]], [[Torakichi (ebitendon)|]], [[Kuroshinki]]. 

Musculature, when depicted, is typically more exaggerated for emphasis (e.g. [[pectorals|pecs]]) along with the [[bulge]] (implying an exaggerated penis size), and both are usually rather noticeable even when the subject is wearing clothes -  abnormally so. When this exaggeration is paired with the points above, which assert a softer approach when drawing the male form, the 'bara' archetype becomes noticeable.

Common masculine features on subjects include: different degrees of [[facial hair|facial]] and [[body hair]] (especially the [[navel hair|happy trail]] leading to [[male pubic hair|pubic hair]]) - or a complete absence of it in the case of younger characters (depending on the artist's tastes), [[thick eyebrows|thick]], [[eyebrow cut|cut]] or [[forked eyebrows|bushy eyebrows]], [[sideburns]], [[buzz cut]], [[large hands]], [[scar]]s, [[tattoo]]s, [[bandaid]]s, [[bandages]], [[wrinkled skin|wrinkles]] (visible with [[mature male|mature]] and [[old man|old]] men), etc.

All of these characteristics lend the style a degree of flexibility that allows for further stylization as well as broader cultural mixing between communities; for instance, despite bara’s roots in opposition to them, there is substantial cross-over with the larger [[yaoi|Boys' Love]] community - which can be seen in some artists' styles (E.g [[Yotti]], [[Arima (arima_bn)|]]). It can also be applied to non-human and humanoid characters, such as [[furry male]]s  (E.g [[Wafu (youzora_samo18)|]], [[Boogbogex]]).

[expand= History and meaning]
The word "bara" literally means "rose" in Japanese. The term originally comes from the magazine "Barazoku":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barazoku], Japan's first gay men's magazine, with the term traditionally referring to more [[bishounen]]-esque men. As a result, the word "bara" also began being used as a slang term for any male homoerotic works in general (similar to the use of [[yaoi]] in the West).

The word "bara" as used here is primarily Western, stemming more from its application on art more commonly known as "gei komi", "gei manga", or "mens love" in Japan, a practice that began on Japanese imageboards, where they intentionally misappropriated the term, this interpretation later being exported abroad. Whilst some Japanese gei komi creators oppose the usage of "bara" due to its earlier legacy, others have embraced it. Note that, like most Manga Demographics, bara is commonly defined in terms of the target audience, not the authors or the subject matter.

Bara conceptually often contrasts with yaoi, which is gay male media traditionally made by heterosexual women to appeal to other heterosexual women. Whereas bara is gay/bi male media made by gay/bi men for gay/bi men, that generally features romantic and sexual relationships between [[muscular]] [[mature male|mature men]] and realistic(ish) relationships, often including LGBTQ issues, [[yaoi]] generally features androgynous, idealized, effeminate characters and melodramatic plots devoid of LGBTQ issues (like most [[yuri]], for similar root reasons). By its nature, it is also heteronormative, whether by stereotypically depicting overly emotional relationships or using concepts such as "uke" and "seme," and includes themes of homosociality, which contributed more to the clash between fans of the two genres, though nowadays there's a grey area between the two. What they share in common the most though is the fact that non-Japanese audiences have misappropriated them, with yaoi having become a generalized weeb term for anything involving gay men.
[/expand]

h4. See also

* [[muscular male]]
* [[fat man]]
* [[mature male]]
* [[old man]]

* [[manly]] - overly masculine traits that were not neccessarily homoerotic

title: orthodox_cross
body:
A variation of the [[christianity|Christian]] [[cross]] (☦) used by the Eastern/Russian Orthodox Church. 

It has three crossbeams instead of one. The shorter top bar representing the inscription INRI, and the slanted lower one representing the footrest of Christ, giving it 8 distinct points.

h4. See also

* [[Chi Rho]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Russian Orthodox cross":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Orthodox_cross

title: cham_cham
body:
A [[cat girl]] character from the [[Samurai Spirits]] [[video game]] series. She is [[TamTam (Samurai Spirits)|]]'s younger sister and is often with her [[chimpanzee]] pet [[Paku Paku]].

She has [[green hair]] and wears a [[yellow dress|yellow]] [[tiger print]] [[print dress|dress]], [[paw gloves]] and [[paw shoes]]. Her weapon of choice is the [i]Yok Mok Mook[/i], a type of Mayan [[boomerang]].

Her [[player 2]] [[alternate color]] changes her green hair to [[blue hair|blue]] and her clothing to white, a reference to [[Felicia (Darkstalkers)|another cat girl]] from [[Darkstalkers|another fighting game]].

She comes from a [[Maya (culture)|]]n village referred to as "Green Hell".

title: blackletter
body:
Blackletter, also known as Gothic script or Old English, is a form of script developed in [[medieval]] [[Europe]] that remained in use in some countries as late as the early 20th century. Blackletter typefaces are characterized by elaborate serifs and dramatic variations in line width. Well-known families of blackletter typefaces include the ornate Textura and the popular Fraktur.

Blackletter is rarely used in body text today due to its poor readability, but it still lends a dignified appearance to diplomas, certificates, and newspaper mastheads. In recent years it has become associated with [[heavy metal|heavy]]/[[black metal]] band logos, punk or skinhead subculture, gangsta rap, and even beer labels.

h4. Examples 
* !post #9686973
* !post #3520324
* !post #3229314

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Text]]

title: paku_paku
body: [[Cham Cham]]'s pet [[chimpanzee]] and also [[TamTam (Samurai Spirits)|her brother]].

title: tamtam_(samurai_spirits)
body:
A character from the [[Samurai Spirits]] [[video game]] series. He is a renowned [[Maya (culture)|]]n hero from a village referred to as "Green Hell". 

After failing to protect the village's artifact from thieves, he receives divine punishment from the gods and is transformed into a [[chimpanzee]] called [[Paku Paku]].

He is [[Cham Cham]]'s big brother and, unknown to her, the pet monkey she adopts.

His weapon of choice is the [i]Henge Hange Zange[/i], a type of Mayan [[machete]].

title: yahweh
body:
The name of the deity worshipped by Abrahamic religions: [[jewish|Judaism]] (known as יהוה (YHWH)), [[Christianity]],  [[muslim|Islam]] and Druze faith (generally referred under the Arabic name as "Allah"). Commonly depicted as an [[old man]] with a [[white hair|white]] [[beard]] and [[robe]]s, though this is not universal. 

For the enemy in [[Megami Tensei II]] or [[Shin Megami Tensei II]], use the [[YHVH (Megami Tensei)|]] tag.

h4. See also

* [[Christian mythology]]
* [[The Bible]]

title: spawn_(spawn)
body:
The titular character of [[Spawn (comic)|]].

Albert "Al" Francis Simmons was born in Detroit, Michigan as the second of three brothers (Marc, Al and Richard) to Esther and Bernard Simmons. Simmons was a very gifted officer of the United States Marine Corps, where he attained the rank of Lieutenant Colonel. He later joined the United States Secret Service, which led to his transfer to the Central Intelligence Agency. In the CIA, Simmons was recruited by Director [[Jason Wynn]] into a special top-secret covert ops division known as the U.S. Security Group, an elite task force with jurisdiction in all domestic and foreign situations.

Jason Wynn (the director of the CIA) and Simmons began to butt heads more often and Simmons planned to resign.

Simmons was murdered during a mission in [[Botswana]] for the USSG's Operation Knightstrike by fellow mercenary Bruce Stinson (aka Chapel) at the order of Director Wynn. Simmons was sent to [[Hell]] because of his life as an assassin. After arranging a deal with the being known as [[Malebolgia]], Simmons agrees to become a Hellspawn in exchange for being allowed to see his wife Wanda Blake one last time.

Spawn was played by [[Michael Jai White]] in the 1997 live action Spawn movie while in the Spawn HBO animated series, he is voiced by [[Keith David]].

title: toono_hanna
body:
A character from [[Mahou Shoujo No Majo Saiban]].

She has [[green eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] tied into [[twintails]]. Wears a [[green dress|green]] [[lolita fashion|lolita styled dress]].

Sometimes depicted alongside [[Tachibana Sherry]], her companion that she met during her time spent in the prison.

Her magic power is "Floating".

h4. Appearance

title: tachibana_sherry
body:
A character from [[Mahou Shoujo No Majo Saiban]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] [[braided hair rings|braided into hair rings]] and [[orange eyes]]. Wears a [[black capelet]] with a [[blue skirt]] and a [[black hat]] on her head.

She likes being a [[detective]], and is often seen holding a [[magnifying glass]] in her hand.

Sometimes depicted alongside [[Toono Hanna]], her companion that she met during her time spent in the prison.

Her magic power is "Super Strength".


h4. Appearance

* !post #9832110

title: yingxing_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A past form of [[Blade (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] from [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. 

Yingxing and Blade's current form generally look rather similar, down to wearing the same outfit. The most notable differences are:
* Yingxing's hair is [[grey hair|grey]] and [[folded ponytail|folded]] into a [[ponytail]] with a [[hair stick]], while modern-era Blade has [[dark blue hair|dark blue]] loose hair,
* Yingxing generally does not wear any [[bandages]],
* Yingxing's eyes are light blue-ish [[purple eyes|purple]], while Blade's current form's are [[red eyes|red]]-to-[[orange eyes|orange]] instead. However, this detail might end up being skipped, especially in older fanworks, as more accurate references of his eye color were not supplied until later. 

h4. Appearance
* !post #6729655: Rightmost in the group

title: rosemi_lovelock_(demon_delinquent)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Rosemi Lovelock]]. 

Her [[sukeban]] costume is composed of a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]] with a [[purple rose]], thorn [[halo]], optional white [[eyepatch]], purple [[demon wings]], [[black jacket|black]] [[floral print]] [[jacket on shoulders]], black [[crop top]] with a [[pink belt|pink]] [[chest belt]] and an exposed [[navel]], [[torn clothes|torn]] [[black pants]] with [[chain]]s and a [[pink belt]], [[black boots|black]] [[knee boots]] with [[purple bow]]s, [[black gloves]] with arm [[bandages]], pink [[arm belt]]s, and a [[baseball bat]] with thorns. She also gains a single [[fang]]. 

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume she has [[very long hair|very long]] floor-length [[pink hair]] with [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7058475: Profile
other_names: ロゼミ・ラブロック(小悪魔スケバン)

title: nira-chan_(taidada)_(zutomayo)
body: [[Nira-chan]] from [[zutto mayonaka de ii no ni|Zutomayo]]'s [[TAIDADA (zutomayo)|]] music video. Designed by [[gr 7]]. Has [[grey hair|grey]] [[twintails]] and a white [[bandage over one eye|bandage on the left eye]].

title: saiki_gouto
body:
A mysterious character from [[Tsukihime (Remake)]], first appearing in [i]Tsukihime -A piece of blue glass moon-[/i].He's present at the Tohno mansion as a representative of the Tohnos' relatives.

He is a tall man whose face is almost completely covered in black [[bandages]]. What little skin is visible underneath his bandages is very dark, and appears to be covered in [[scar]]s. He wears a purple [[dress shirt]] and pants with a [[black vest]], [[gloves]], and [[dress shoes]]. His [[necktie]] has a chain-link pattern on it.


h4. Appearance

* !asset #31828627


h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Goto Saiki":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Goto_Saiki

title: prism_tower
body:
A [[building]] in the [[pokemon|Pokémon]] series, located in [[Lumiose City]]. It is based on the [[Eiffel Tower]], and contains the Lumiose [[pokemon gym|Gym]], led by [[Clemont (pokemon)|]].

h4. External links
* "Bulbapedia: Lumiose Gym":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Lumiose_Gym

title: pokemon_legends:_z-a
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] game for [[Nintendo Switch]] and [[Nintendo Switch 2]], taking place entirely within [[Lumiose City]] of the Kalos region. It is a sequel to [[Pokemon XY|Pokémon X and Y]], and the second game in the [i]Pokémon Legends[/i] subseries, following [[pokemon legends: arceus|Pokémon Legends: Arceus]].

Scheduled to release on October 16, 2025.

title: virtual_youtuber
body:
A [b]virtual YouTuber[/b], or [b]VTuber[/b], is a content creator or personality who uses a 2D or 3D digital avatar for online videos and/or [[livestream]]ing, often assuming a character as well. Despite the name, VTubers are not limited to the [[YouTube]] platform.

The term was first popularized by [[Kizuna Ai]], who called herself "the world's first virtual YouTuber". Many others followed suit, and the explosion in popularity of the practice lead the term to be used even outside of [[YouTube]], with the Japanese defining VTubers based on the creator declaring themselves as such before considering additional factors.

Many variations on the term "VTuber" exist, including "Virtual Singer" / "VSinger" (for those that exclusively make music, not be confused with [[VSinger (Vocaloid)|Vocaloid China]]), "Virtual Liver" / "VLiver", and "Virtual Streamer" / "VStreamer". In China, the term "Virtual Uploader" / "VUP" is more commonly used alongside "VTuber", after first being coined by [[Xiao Xi]] on [[Bilibili]]. In English, "PNGTuber" and "GIFTuber" are used to refer to VTubers who use those formats, rather than 3D models or [[Live2D]]. In Japan, "VLiver" is also used to refer creators and companies in the 'walled garden app' niche, such as [[IRIAM]] and [[AniLive]], apps which viewers use to watch VTubers who stream exclusively on them.

This tag includes anything directly related to VTubers, including [[parody|parodies]], references, fictional VTubers, [[concept art]] of unreleased VTubers, VTuber mascots, and VTuber agency staff members. This tag does not include family members or friends of VTubers, or things merely associated with VTubers.

h4. Examples

* !post #4509699

h4. See also 

* [[Indie Virtual YouTuber]] (for use with solo indies)
* [[hololive]]
* [[Nijisanji]]
* [[Virtual Youtuber Shiten'nou]]
* [[Utaite]]
* [[Virtual graduation commemoration]]

h4. External links

* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: Virtual YouTuber":https://dic.pixiv.net/a/バーチャルYouTuber
* UserLocal (JP Database): "virtual-youtuber.userlocal.jp":https://virtual-youtuber.userlocal.jp

title: anabel_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Anabel[/b], known as [b]Lila[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon emerald|Emerald]][/i].

This skilled Trainer is full of mysteries due to memory loss. She's on the trail of Ultra Beasts as the head of the UB Task Force, a secret division of the International Police [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon are [[Snorlax]] and [[Xurkitree]].

In her [[pokemon sm|SM]] outfit, she has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]] with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]. She wears a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with a [[black necktie]] under a [[black jacket|black]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] jacket, [[black gloves]], [[black pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: annytf
body:
[[anyuu]]'s [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] avatar. Debuted on [[twitch.tv|Twitch]] February 22, 2021, but has been active on [[Pixiv]] since late 2018.

A [[fox girl]] with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. She has orange [[fox ears]] and [[fox tail]] with white [[animal ear fluff|fluff]], like that of an American red fox.

Her official outfit consists of a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[off shoulder]] [[crop top]] with a [[zipper]] on the front, and a [[striped camisole]] [[undershirt|underneath]], both of which reveal her [[midriff]] and [[cleavage]], as well as [[highleg panties]] under her [[shorts]]. Notably, she features a [[star hair ornament]] and [[choker]].

Gained added notability as she was commissioned by [[vedal987]] to be the artist and designer for [[Neuro-sama]]'s second model. She has subsequently gone and done the design for Neuro's "sister" [[Evil Neuro-sama]].  Since then she has become a regular collaborator in Neuro's streams, where she has embraced being Neuro's "mom", and tones down her ecchiness during such collabs tremendously, to the point where her most often used outfit is a very form-concealing (but still cute) [[hoodie]].

h4. External links

* "YouTube":https://www.youtube.com/@annytf
* "Twitch":https://www.twitch.tv/anny
* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/annytf
* "Pixiv":https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/13232747

title: passenger_(arknights)
body:
[i]Engineering Operator Passenger, thunderous punisher of enemies.[/i]

A playable Caster operator in [i][[Arknights]][/i].

Real name: Elliot Glover

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]September 1st[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Liberi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]187 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]16 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An operator who works at Rhodes Island's Engineering Department, 
Passenger was a research assistant in Originium engineering and a Sargonian black market leader. 
He later meets [[Kal'tsit (Arknights)|Kal'tsit]] who he journeys with across oasis villages until staying with a soothsayer. 
Many years later, Passenger joined Rhodes Island to treat his Oripathy and reunite with Kal'tsit.

Alongside Kal'tsit, he is one of the protagonists in the side story [i]A Walk in The Dust[/i].

His motif is based on Passenger [[pigeon]]s.

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Sakurai Takahiro]] (JP), Zhang Fuzheng (CN), and Yoon Dong-gi (KR).
while his young version in [i]Dream in a Moment[/i] skin are voiced by [[Ise Mariya]] (JP), Chang Rongshan (CN), and Park Ri-na (KR).
His original art designer is [[skade]].


h4. Appearance

body:
[i]Bagpipe, former Victorian soldier, has come in search of the truth.[/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: [spoilers]Fiona Young[/spoilers]

h4. Profile

A seasoned combatant from the 2nd Tempest Platoon of the Victorian Army who joined Rhodes Island upon [[ch'en_(arknights)|Ch'en's]] recommendation. Uses a piledriver spear as her preferred weapon. Well-versed with farming and operating agricultural machinery due to her countryside lifestyle.

Often compared to [[Nakano Nino]] from [[Go-Toubun no Hanayome]] due to her appearance.

One of the main characters of the story [i]Episode 9: Stormwatch[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Toyosaki Aki]] (Japanese), Shen Yue (Chinese), Lauren Conroy (English) and Son Seon-young (Korean). Her art designer is [[U-suke (supertie)|]].

title: help:favorites
body:
You can save individual [[help:posts|posts]] to a personal list of favorites. You need an [[help:users|account]] in order to use this feature, and you must [b]have JavaScript enabled[/b] in your browser.

h4. Adding and removing favorites

To add a post to your favorites, while viewing a post:

* Click the [[heart]] button under the image.
* Press the "f" key.
* Click on the [b]Favorite[/b] link under the [b]Options[/b] heading in the sidebar.

To remove a post from your favorites, while viewing a post:

* Click the [[heart]] button under the image.
* Press the "shift" and "f" keys simultaneously.
* Click on the [b]Unfavorite[/b] link under the [b]Options[/b] heading in the sidebar.

Users at the [[help:users|Gold user level]] or above can make use of the [b]Favorite[/b] and [b]Unfavorite[/b] [[help:posts|Mode menu]] options to quickly manage favorites.

h4. Viewing favorites

You can view your favorites by clicking on [b]Favorites[/b] from the "main listing":/posts, by searching for {{fav:your_user_name}}, or by going to [b]My Account[/b], then [b]Favorites[/b].

There are two different orders in which you can view favorites, each one with a different metatag:

* {{fav:your_user_name}} – find all posts in your favorites list, in the order they were uploaded.

* {{ordfav:your_user_name}} – find all posts in your favorites list, in the order you favorited them.

h4. Maximum numbers of favorites

There is no limit to the number of favorites an account can have. Feel free to favorite images as you like. [[help:favorite groups|Fav groups]], however, are limited to 10 thousand posts per group.

h4. Favorites are not private by default

Your list of favorites is publicly viewable by other users by default. You can change it so only you can see your favorites by enabling privacy mode. See [[help:privacy mode]]

title: marisa_stole_the_precious_thing
body:
A [[Touhou]] fan arrangement and remix song by the doujin music group [[IOSYS]], or the accompanying viral Flash [[music video]].

The song is probably IOSYS's most famous release to date, spawning an official two-volume remix album, alongside countless parodies and references. The song is also a notable example of a [[Kirisame Marisa|Marisa]]-[[Alice Margatroid|Alice]] pairing in [[Touhou]] fanart.

A version of the "song and MV":[/posts/8031682] would be released by [[McDonald's]] in August 2024, stripped of its Touhou imagery, entitled "McDonald's has Created Something Incredible ~No Way They're Putting Three Thick Beef Patties in the Samurai Mac®" (マクドは大変なものを作っていきました ~サムライマック®に肉厚ビーフ3枚も入れるなし〜), advertising the return of the triple patty version of the Samurai Mac.

h4. See also

* [[stole something outrageous]]
* [[Oyome ni Shinasai]]
* [[List of Touhou fanwork tags]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Marisa Stole the Precious Thing Lyrics":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Lyrics:_%E9%AD%94%E7%90%86%E6%B2%99%E3%81%AF%E5%A4%A7%E5%A4%89%E3%81%AA%E3%82%82%E3%81%AE%E3%82%92%E7%9B%97%E3%82%93%E3%81%A7%E3%81%84%E3%81%8D%E3%81%BE%E3%81%97%E3%81%9F

title: scarlet_police
body:
Several [[Touhou]] songs by [[IOSYS]], covering [[Remilia Scarlet]] deciding to act as a police officer in [[Gensokyo]].

[i]Scarlet Police on Ghetto Patrol 24/7[/i] is the first song, and is the most popular. It features Remilia and [[Cirno]] engaged in a rap and dance battle, and is the origin of the Funky meme. 

[i]Electricity has stopped! At Scarlet Call[/i] is the second song, and features the Scarlet Police working an emergency line. 

The Scarlet Police outfits worn by Remilia, Sakuya, and Patchouli have become common themes wherever a police officer is needed. Cirno's first part in Ghetto Patrol has also become a popular [[meme]] for the character.

h4. Examples

* !post #5366740

h4. External links

* "Youtube: Scarlet Police on Ghetto Patrol 24/7":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7h7bnYA1LXE]
* "Youtube: Electricity has stopped! At Scarlet Call":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xcGd_NZaZKw]

title: twitch.tv
body:
An American [[livestream]]ing site, mostly associated with gaming streams. Many [[eSports]] professionals and [[Virtual Youtuber]]s are based on the platform.

Arguably the most well known aspect of the site is it's vast library of chat emotes, many of which have achieved [[meme]] status outside the site.

title: daitaku_helios_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Resident [[gyaru]] character of the series. She is also [[Mejiro Palmer (Umamusume)|]]'s friend.

For a gyaru, she is known for being very friendly and uses the most gyaru-based slangs (depicted as [[zoomer slang]] in the game's English translation) that even her own friends (some of whom are probably gyarus) can't understand; Helios calls her friends and other people she knows with nicknames, especially [[Trainer (Umamusume)|]] who she refers to as "Trai-pi".

title: fusaichi_pandora_(umamusume)
body:
A character from [[Umamusume]]. She first appeared as a fully-voiced teaser character in the game's second Main Story and became the protagonist of Part 3 as a transfer to Team Ascella.

A self-proclaimed genius who despite her actual talents often puts herself into trouble of her own making.

While the real life racehorse is no slouch (she is the winner of the 2006 Queen Elizabeth Cup), she would rather become famous as the mother of [[Almond Eye (racehorse)|]], Japan's most successful racehorse on Turf.

title: enterprise_(soaring_wings_of_freedom)_(azur_lane)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|official costume]] of [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Enterprise (azur lane)|]]. It closely resembles Enterprise's default costume, but her coat is worn over the shoulders, she wears [[white gloves]] and a draped [[grey scarf]], the strap below her breasts is instead a [[black belt]] with [[gold buckle]], while her [[black thighhighs]] are boots with a white cuff and [[gold trim]] (instead of belts), and the feet are different with silver metal over the top and the blades being mostly silver with red trim.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3699065: Profile

title: macross:_do_you_remember_love?
body:
[b]The Super Dimension Fortress Macross: Do You Remember Love?[/b] is an animated movie based around the first [[Macross]] television series that was released in Japanese movie theaters on July 7, 1984. It was produced by [[Big West]] Advertising and [[JVC]].

The movie is a film adaptation of [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]], with new improved animation and designs. The storyline of the movie does not fit directly into the Macross chronology, and was originally an [[alternate universe]] retelling of the story, but was later established as part of the [[Macross]] universe. 

Within the Macross continuity it is also a popular movie (ie. a movie within a television series), a fact shown in [[Macross 7]]. However, other Macross sequels like [[Macross Frontier]] have used visual elements from both the first TV series and this animated film.

In real life the Japanese premiere of the film was a great success. It received a huge marketing campaign that generated very long lines of fans; many of them camped outside cinemas the night prior to the movie's first release (something unheard of at the time for an anime related work). These events were dramatized in the anime comedy [[Otaku no Video]] from 1991.
other_names: 愛・おぼえていますか

title: zentlardy_alphabet
body:
A fictional alien alphabet from the [[MACROSS]] series.

It is the alphabet used by the [[Zentradi]] humanoid aliens.

It was created by Japanese artist (and [[mecha]] designer) [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] of Studio Nue for [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]].

title: gundam_lfrith
body:
A [[mobile suit]] that appears in the [I] PROLOGUE[/I] episode of [[Gundam Suisei no Majo]]. It is piloted by [[Elnora Samaya]], with her daughter, [[Ericht Samaya]], as a passenger. 

Its mechanical designer is [[JNT]], who also designed the [[Gundam Aerial]].

title: monster_destroid
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] series. It first appeared in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV anime series from 1982, but also appears in the [[Macross Zero]] OVA, the [[Macross Plus]] movie, the [[Macross VF-X]] and [[Macross VF-X2]] [[video game]]s as well as the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series.

The [b]Viggers/Centinental HWR-00 Mk II "Monster"[/b], also known as "Destroid Monster" (in the Japanese version) or "Monster Destroid" (in the "Robotech" vesion), [[destroid]] is a main battle robot system (mecha) created by the [[U.N. Spacy]] to fight the [[Zentradi]]. It is a heavy type of mecha designed for anti-capital ship long-range operations.

An immense [[mecha]], the Heavy Weight Robot (HWR) Monster Mk II is a heavily armed "land battleship" or [[landship]] with a name matching the great size of the destroid. 

Is armed with four [[cannon]]s that can fire a variety of munitions, including anti-armor shells, anti-aircraft munitions, howitzers and even "reaction" ([[radiation symbol|nuclear]]) warheads. 

In addition to the main guns, the Mk II features a pair of 3-barreled missile launchers not originally included in the design but incorporated into the two arm units.

Its successor mecha called the [[VB-6 Konig Monster]] appears in later Macross productions.

The original monster was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]]. It was based on the real life [[M50 Ontos]] [[tank]], used by the U.S. Marines in the [[Vietnam War]].
other_names: デストロイド・モンスター
デストロイドモンスター

title: vf-27
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] universe. The [b]VF-27 Lucifer[/b] is an advanced [[variable fighter]] that first appeared in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series.

This [[variable fighter]] is so fast and agile that only [[cyborg]]s can tolerate its maximum speeds.

It is the mecha of choice for [[Brera Sterne]].

It was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]].

h4. See also

* [[Macross Galaxy]]

title: daedalus
body:
A military sea [[ship]] from the [[MACROSS]] series.

The [b]SLV-111 Daedalus Super-Large-Scale Semi-Submersible Assault Landing Vessel[/b] is a type of [[U.N. Spacy]] naval ship built as a semi-submersible assault carrier deployed by the U.N. Forces in the ocean surrounding [[South Ataria]] island. 

The ship's main feature was a collapsible ramp extending from the bow of the ship outward, designed to load the [[Destroid]] series mecha and then promptly sortie Destroids upon arrival at an enemy base. The Daedalus is 0.4 km long. It also serves as the SDF-1's Right Arm.

This ship was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

h4. See also

* [[Daedalus Attack]]
* [[prometheus_(ship)|Prometheus]]
* [[SDF-1]]

title: vf-11
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] universe that appeared in the [[Macross Plus]] OVA, the [[Macross 7]] TV series and the [[Macross VF-X]], [[Macross VF-X2]] and [[Macross M3]] videogames.

The [b]VF-11 Thunderbolt[/b] was the main [[U.N. Spacy]] variable fighter during the events of [i]Macross Plus[/i] and [i]Macross 7[/i]. It is similar to the [[VF-0]] [b]Phoenix[/b] from [[Macross Zero]] and the original [[VF-1]] [b]Valkyrie[/b] from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]], but has a more advanced airframe and [[canards]] for better maneuverability inside an atmosphere. It was succeeded by the [[VF-171]] [i]Nightmare Plus[/i].

The VF-11 was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]].

h4. See also

*  [[VF-11 MAXL]]

title: sv-51
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] universe. 

In the [[Macross Zero]] OVA the [b]Sukhoi/Israel Aircraft Industries/Dornier SV-51[/b] was the only [[variable fighter]] developed by the [[anti-u.n.|Anti-U.N.]] forces. It can transform into [[battroid]] (giant robot), [[GERWALK]] and fighter (jet) modes.

The [b]SV[/b] in its name actually stands for [b]"Sukhoi Variable"[/b] (or [b]"Slayer Valkyrie"[/b] according to some other sources).

Like the [[VF-0]] Phoenix, the SV-51 is an advanced trial production model equipped with conventional engines, a proof-of-concept craft developed and pressed into service before planned variable fighters with thermonuclear turbine engines. It can only fly in an atmosphere and is not a [[space]] travel-capable aerospace fighter like the later [[VF-1]]. A variant called [b]SV-52[/b] with thermonuclear reaction engines was also researched but wasn't mass produced by the Anti-U.N. forces.

The SV-51 armaments included gun pods, missiles, and other ordinance. The mecha was also capable of being launched from underwater. The fighter design was similar to that of the VF-0, but its transformation mechanism was more complicated and took longer to complete. The SV-51 also had [[canards]] and tailplanes. Its wing was narrow and relatively unswept.

Since this [[mecha]] appeared a whole year before the events of [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]], many [i]Macross[/i] fans have speculated that the remaining units were seized by the [[U.N. Spacy]] and used for variable fighter research as well as aerial defense against the [[Zentradi]] during Space War I (like they did with the Anti-U.N. [[Octos]] mecha, according to the [i]Macross Chronicle[/i]). The SV-52 variant with reaction engines was also supposedly produced in limited numbers by the U.N. Spacy after the Anti-U.N. forces were defeated.

The SV-51 was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]].

title: hayase_misa
body:
A female character from [[MACROSS]]. One of the main characters from the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982. She also appears in the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] movie and in archival footage and flashbacks in the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA. 

Misa is a Japanese member of the [[U.N. Spacy]] and the chief tactical officer at the bridge of the [[SDF-1]] MACROSS variable [[spacecraft]]. 

She's a young Asian woman with long [[brown hair]]. Misa is a strong-willed, determined and down-to-earth type of person, completely immersed in doing her [[military]] duty. She created the [[Daedalus Attack]]. Misa is also [[Claudia LaSalle]]'s best friend. 

In the [[Robotech]] western adaptation her name was changed to [b]Lisa Hayes[/b] and her ethnicity to American.

h4. See also

* [[Ichijou Hikaru]]
* [[Lynn Minmay]]

title: mars_people
body:
An [[alien]] enemy in the [[Metal Slug]] series of shooting games.

They came from planet [[Mars (planet)|]].

Their design was inspired by the Martians from [[War of the Worlds]].

title: ranking
body:
A scoring system used in both real life and video games. It can be numeral (#1, #2, #3...) or with letters (S, A, B, C...). The picture must clearly show that the numbers or letters are meant to represent winners and/or losers (not always both) or how good the characters fare in a competition.

Ranking displays the final result after the competition is over, not during.

h4. See also

* [[score]] - For an ongoing display of points during a game or competition, but not the final result.
* [[tier list]]

title: yf-19
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] universe. It first appeared in the [[Macross Plus]] OVA. 

The [b]YF-19 Alpha One[/b] is an advanced prototype of the [[VF-19]] [[variable fighter]]. 

This new mecha was designed by [[scientist]] [[Yang Neumann]]. A test [[pilot]] for this fighter was [[Isamu Dyson]].

Features include extreme high speed and maneuverability inside an atmosphere, [[canards]] and forward sweep wings, as well as a new mini [[pin-point barrier system]] adapted for variable fighter use.

The YF-19 was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]].

title: vf-25
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] universe. 

The [b]VF-25 Messiah[/b] is an advanced [[variable fighter]] aerospace [[mecha]] that first appeared in the [[Macross Frontier]] anime TV series from 2008.

This variable fighter is so fast that it requires its pilot to wear an [[Ex-Gear]] [[power suit]] in order to survive its maximum speeds. The VF-25 can be upgraded with different types of weapon and propulsion packs, including the [[Tornado Pack]].

It was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]].

h4. See also

* [[YF-25]]

title: sdf-1
body:
A massive variable [[spacecraft]] from the [[MACROSS]] series. 

The [b]U.N. Spacy SDF-1 (Super Dimensional Fortress One) "Macross"[/b] is the titular [[space]] fortress (and [[mecha]]) from the anime [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] released in the 80s. 

This massive [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] was originally [spoilers]a [[Supervision Army]] Gun Destroyer that crashlanded in [[South Ataria]] island on Earth in the year 1999 (codenamed [[ASS-1]] or [b]Alien Space Ship One[/b] by U.N. Spacy scientists),[/spoilers] but was later repaired and reconstructed, thus becoming humanity's main defense against the [[Zentradi]].

The SDF-1 is 1.2 km long and can transform from Cruiser into [[Storm Attacker]] mode. It is equipped with a "Fold" drive that enables the ship to travel through [i]Super Dimension[/i] space (or [i]Hyperspace[/i]), thus making it capable of traveling several light years between different star systems in a matter of hours.

The Macross is armed with a very powerful "Super-Dimension" (hyperspace) energy cannon with a beam polarizing converging system, as well as several energy cannons, electro-magnetic rail cannons and anti-ship [[missile]] launchers. 

The ship also has several [[QF-3000E]] [[Ghost drone]] fighters, [[VF-1]] variable fighters and many [[Tomahawk (Destroid)|Tomahawk]], [[Defender (macross)|]], [[Spartan (Destroid)|Spartan]], [[phalanx (Destroid)|Phalanx]] and [[Monster Destroid|Monster]] [[Destroid]] [[mecha]] on its multiple hangar bays.

The SDF-1 was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]]. The design was inspired by the [[yamato_(uchuu_senkan_yamato)|Yamato]] from [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] and the [[White Base]] from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]].

h4. SDF-1 Macross Crew (Gunsight One) 

* [[Bruno J. Global]]
* [[Hayase Misa]]
* [[Claudia Lasalle]]
* [[Vanessa Laird]]
* [[Kim Kamirov]]
* [[Shammy Milliome]]
* [[Panapp]]

h4. See also
