* [[Daedalus Attack]]
* [[Pin-Point Barrier System]]
* [[Supervision Army]]
* [[U.N. Spacy]]
* [[N.U.N.S.]]
* [[ARMD]]
* [[Daedalus]]
* [[Prometheus (ship)|Prometheus]]

title: xi_gundam
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It is the lead Gundam of [[Gundam Hathaway's Flash]].

The [b]RX-105 Xi Gundam[/b] and the [[Penelope (Hathaway's Flash)|RX-104FF Penelope]] were classified as fifth-generation MS and are said to have been developed and constructed by [[Anaheim Electronics]]. It was a unique [[mobile_suit|MS]] with a built-in Minovsky Flight Unit and was equipped with the latest Beam Barrier system. Since the Penelope relied on optional units to obtain similar functions, it can be said that the Xi Gundam was a truly completed fifth-generation MS that could function independently.

Its armaments include a [[beam rifle]], a pair of [[energy sword|beam sabers]] (with a [[double blade]] function similar to the [[Nu Gundam]]'s large beam saber), a [[shield]] with a [[beam cannon]] on its tip, forearm-mounted triple missiles, and its signature [i]Funnel Missiles[/i]. True to its name, these [[funnels (gundam)|]] functions like remote controlled [[missile|missiles]], guided by the pilot's Newtype abilities and exploding upon impact. These weapons are also equipped on the Penelope.

It is piloted by [[Mafti Nabiyu Erin]], a.k.a. [[Hathaway Noa]].

Designed by [[Moriki Yasuhiro]] for the novel; the design was later updated by [[Fujita Kazumi]] for the [[SD Gundam G-Generation]] series; this updated design has been used in most [[video game]]s where the Xi Gundam is featured, such as Gundam Extreme Vs. and Super Robot Wars. [[Katoki Hajime]] also designed it for the FIX Figuration line as well as gave it a minor visual overhaul for the movie, featuring larger hands, a more off-white color scheme and a generally bulkier silhouette.

title: gundam_aerial
body:
The protagonist [[mobile suit]] in [[Gundam Suisei no Majo]]. Piloted by [[Suletta Mercury]]. Upgraded into [[Gundam Aerial Rebuild]].

The Gundam Aerial is the first starting lead Gundam from a [[Gundam]] TV anime that is equipped with [[bit (gundam)|bit]] or [[funnels (gundam)|funnel]] weaponry. Previously, bits or funnels are usually reserved as signature weapons of some mid-season upgrades or final lead Gundams such as [[Nu Gundam]] from [[Char's Counterattack]] (or [[Hi-Nu Gundam]] from [[Char's Counterattack - Beltorchika's Children]]), [[Strike Freedom Gundam]] from [[Gundam SEED Destiny]], 00 Qan[T] and its Full Saber variation from [[Gundam 00 A Wakening of the Trailblazer]], and [[Gundam AGE-FX]] from [[Gundam AGE]]. 

Its mechanical designer is [[JNT]].
other_names: ガンダム・エアリアル

title: amuro_ray
body:
Main protagonist of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] and [[Char's Counterattack]]/[[Char's Counterattack - Beltorchika's Children]], a supporting character in [[zeta gundam|Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam]] and eternal rival of [[Char Aznable]]. 

[b]Amuro Ray[/b], also known as [b]The White Devil[/b] by [[Zeon]] forces, is the young brown-haired pilot of the [[Earth Federation]] [[rx-78-2 gundam|RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]], the [[aeug|Karaba]] [[Dijeh]], [[Zero Shiki (gundam)|]], [[AEUG]] [[Rick Dias]], [[Zeta Gundam 3A Type]], [[Zeta Plus A1 (Amuro Colors)]] and the [[earth federation space forces|Londo Bell]] [[Rick Dijeh Kai]], [[Re-GZ]], [[nu gundam|RX-93 Nu Gundam]]/[[hi-nu gundam|RX-93-ν2 Hi-Nu Gundam]].

Son of [[Tem Ray]] and [[Kamaria Ray]].

He is voiced by [[Furuya Tooru]].

h4. Amuro's Women

* [[Fraw Bow]]
* [[Matilda Ajan]]
* [[Lalah Sune]]
* [[Beltorchika Irma]]
* [[Chan Agi]]

title: gundam_wing
body:
A 1995 [[Gundam]] series that features a group of several young protagonists who operate different types of Gundam [[Mobile Suit]]s.

Popular in the West during the year 2000, where it was broadcast in the [[Toonami]] block of [[Cartoon Network]] and had many action figures released as well in several popular toy stores in the USA, a first for a Gundam show.

h4. See also

* [[Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz]]

title: indie_utaite
body:
A solo [[Utaite]] who generally operates independently, similar to an [[Indie Virtual Youtuber]].

This tag is for Utaites who don't otherwise have a copyright tag. If the Utaite is part of a group, channel, or agency, along with other Utaites, that copyright tag should be used instead. If they're depicted with their [[real life]] self, they should be tagged with [[real life]] instead.

Due to the flexible nature of utaite, being able to be independent or affiliated with agencies/corporate entities at a given moment, this tag can also serve as a "solo utaite" tag, as to not lead to the sudden creation of needless company tags.

title: vf-1
body:
A mecha from the [[MACROSS]] series. 

The [b]VF-1 Valkyrie[/b] is Earth's three-form [[variable fighter|transformable]] aerospace multi-role combat [[mecha]] developed from [[alien]] [i][[Protoculture|Overtechnology]][/i] obtained from the [[SDF-1]] "Macross" [[spacecraft]]. Its armaments include a modular [[gunpod]], [[laser]] cannons and several different types of [[missile]]s. It can be equipped with modular attachments such as [[reactive armor]] and external fuel/thruster packs.

Thanks to its FF-2001 thermonuclear engines it can fly in both an atmosphere and outer [[space]]. The VF-1 [[variable fighter]] can also transform into fighter, [[gerwalk]] and [[battroid]] (giant robot) modes.

There are several different variants of the fighter, called [[VF-1A]], [[VF-1J]], [[VF-1D]], [[VF-1S]], [[VF-1J Armored]], [[SDP-1 Stampede Valkyrie]], [[VE-1]], [[VT-1]], [[VT-1 Super]], [[VF-1 Super]] and [[VF-1 Strike]].

It first appeared in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] (1982) where it was created by the [[U.N. Spacy]] to fight a race of humanoid alien [[giant]]s called [[Zentradi]]. It was eventually succeeded by the far more advanced [[VF-4]] [i]Lighting III[/i].

This mecha was called the [b]VF-1 Veritech[/b] in the [[ROBOTECH]] American adaptation of Macross. In that continuity the mecha was developed from alien [[ZOR|Robotechnology]] and the term VERITECH is an acronym which stands for [b]V[/b]ariable [b]E[/b]ngineering and [b]R[/b]obotics [b]I[/b]ntegration [b]TECH[/b]nology. 

The VF-1 was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]]. The design of the mecha's fighter mode is loosely based on the [[F-14 Tomcat]] [[fighter jet]] and its name is a tribute to the [[XB-70]], Kawamori's favorite aircraft.

h4. See also

* [[VF-0]]
* [[VF-1EX]]

title: legioss
body:
[[Mecha]] featured in the 1980s anime TV show [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]]. 

It is a three-form transformable fighter called the [b]Armo-Fighter AFC-01 Legioss[/b], which is used by the humans to fight the [[Inbit]] [[alien]]s that have invaded Earth. 

It has 3 modes: Armo-Fighter ([[Jet]]/[[Starfighter]]), Armo-Soldier ([[Giant]] [[Robot]]) and Armo-Diver ([[Gerwalk]]). The Legioss can be connected in tandem with the [[Tread]] heavy mecha (which acts as an aerospace booster).

The Legioss is somewhat similar in design to the [[VF-1]] [b]Valkyrie[/b] [[variable fighter]] from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] (1982), which aired a year before [[Mospeada]] (1983).

The Legioss was renamed as the [b]VFA-6 Alpha Veritech[/b] (also known as the [b]Alpha Fighter[/b]) in the third arc of the [[Robotech]] adaptation.

It was designed by [[Aramaki Shinji]].

title: stefania_ferrario
body:
Stefania Ferrario is a [[real life]] Australian Instagram model, notable for her [[curvy]] figure.

h4. External links

* Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/stefania_model/
* Twitter: https://twitter.com/stefania_model

title: lim_feng
body:
[[Real life]] Vietnamese designer, model, and Instagram [[fashion]] influencer. Originally known for street goth and [[techwear]] looks, she's now primarily known for [[cyberpunk]] inspired pieces and photoshoots.

h4. External links

* "Instagram":[https://www.instagram.com/llimpidity_]

title: variable_fighter
body:
A [[fighter jet]] or a [[starfighter]] that can transform into a manned [[mecha]] in the [[MACROSS]] franchise. It was introduced in the first series [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] from 1982.

Most of them have three modes of transformation: [[giant]] [[robot]] ([[battroid]]), [[fighter jet]], and an in-between mode called [[gerwalk]].

Variable fighters were renamed [b]Varitechs[/b] in the [[ROBOTECH]] American adaptation of Macross. 

Most of the variable fighters of the franchise (except those from [[Macross 2]]) were designed by mecha designer and anime creator [[Kawamori Shouji]].

h4. Variable fighters

* [[VF-0]]
* [[SV-51]]
* [[VF-1]]
* [[VT-1]]
* [[VE-1]]
* [[SDP-1 Stampede Valkyrie]]
* [[VF-2SS]] - Designed by [[Oohata Kouichi]]
* [[VF-3000]]
* [[VF-4]]
* [[VF-9]]
* [[VF-11]]
* [[VF-14]]
* [[YF-19]]
* [[VF-19]]
* [[YF-21]]
* [[VF-22]]
* [[VF-25]]
* [[YF-29]]
* [[YF-30]]
* [[VF-31]]

h4. See also

* [[Legioss]]
* [[TASC-01-SCF Logan]]

title: d-1
body:
[b]D-1[/b] or [b]Dragonar-1[/b] is the main protagonist [[mecha]] of the [[Kikou Senki Dragonar]] series from 1987. 

It is piloted by [[Kaine Wakaba]].

It was designed by [[Ookawara Kunio]].

h4. See also

* [[D-2]]
* [[D-3]]

title: vf-2ss
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] series. It first appeared in the [[Macross 2]] OVA from 1992. 

The [b]VF-2SS Valkyrie II[/b] is a heavy armed variable fighter optimized for [[space]] operations. It is equipped with many missiles as well as several projectile and energy weapons.

It was designed by [[Oohata Kouichi]].

title: sugai_naosuke
body:
[[Real life]] Japanese jockey and later racehorse trainer. Most famous for being the trainer of [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] (whose dam incidentally was [[point flag (racehorse)|a horse Sugai rode in his career]]), [[Just A Way (racehorse)|]], and later [[Sodashi (racehorse)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[Imanami Takatoshi]] - Retired groom who worked at the Sugai stable; tended Gold Ship and Sodashi.

title: mlover
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] [[science fiction]] anime series.

The [b]MLover[/b] is an advanced [[Emaan]] [[mecha]] usually used to defend their trading caravans and fleets. 

It is very fast and maneuverable, but also light armored. The MLover posseses two manipulator arms but lacks any legs. It is armed with an energy [[gunpod]], a rotary [[energy gun]] and several [[rocket_launcher|missile launchers]]. Some of its components and its arms were later used during the construction of the [[Orguss (mecha)|]].

It was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

title: orguss_(mecha)
body:
The titular [[mecha]] of [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] TV series.

The [b]Orguss[/b] is an advanced variable mecha that can transform into 4 different modes which are [[starfighter|fighter]], [[gerwalk]], [[tank]] and giant robot mode. It is [[Katsuragi Kei]]'s mecha of choice. The Orguss was developed from the remains of another mecha called the [[AV-11D Bronco II]] after it was damaged beyond repair. It also has the arms and some components of an [[MLover]] [[Emaan]] mecha attached to it.

It was designed by artist [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

h4. See also

* [[Orguss Olson Type]]

title: nambu_type_14
body:
The Nambu [b]Type 14[/b] is the semi-automatic [[pistol]] that was adopted as the standard sidearm for officers of the [[Imperial Japanese Army]] in 1927. It saw service during the [[second Sino-Japanese war]] in the 1930s, and and through to the end of [[World War II]].

It bears superficial resemblance to the German [[Luger p08]], but the designs are not related.

h4. See also

* [[Cosmo Nambu]]
* [[handgun]]
* [[list of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Nambu pistol":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nambu_pistol

title: cosmo_nambu
body:
An [[energy gun]] that appears in the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] series.

It is the official sidearm of the [i]Earth Defense Force[/i].

Its design was inspired by the [[Nambu Type 14]] pistols of [[World War II]].

h4. See also

* [[Cosmo Dragoon]]

title: katsuragi_kei
body:
Main character of the [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] [[mecha]] series.

A womanizer and an intrepid [[mecha]] fighter ace [[pilot]]. His robots of choice are the [[AV-11D Bronco II]] and the [[Orguss (mecha)|]].

He is voiced by [[Hayami Shou]].

title: ishkick
body:
An enemy [[mecha]] from the [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] TV series.

The [b]Ishkick[/b] is a heavily armed combat [[walker (robot)|]] that is the main combat mecha unit of the [[Chiram]] military. 

The Ishkick is a slow but highly maneuverable and well armored mecha. It is armed with several [[rocket launcher]]s, [[energy gun]]s and a powerful beam cannon above its cockpit.

It was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

title: octos
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] franchise.

It first appeared in the [[Macross Zero]] OVA from 2002.

The [b]Octos[/b] is a type of amphibious combat [[walker (robot)|]] mecha developed by the [[Anti-U.N.]] forces. It does possess variable geometry and is armed with ballistic as well as energy weaponry.

It was designed by [[Ishigaki Jun'ya]].

title: garland_(megazone_23)
body:
A transformable red and white [[motorcycle]] from the [[Megazone 23]] anime series.

It was designed by [[Aramaki Shinji]].

title: yf-21
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Macross Plus]] OVA from 1994.

The [b]YF-21 Omega One[/b] is the first prototype of the [[VF-22]] [[variable fighter]]. This experimental advanced mecha was developed by the company [i]General Galaxy[/i] to be used by the [[U.N. Spacy]]. A test pilot for the YF-21 was [[Guld Goa Bowman]].

Fighter mode features include extreme high speed and maneuverability inside an atmosphere as well as a new mini [[pin-point barrier system]] adapted for variable fighter use.

The [[battroid]] mode of this unit strongly resembles the design of the old Quimeliquola [[Queadluun-Rau]] [[Zentradi]] [[power armor]] and also uses that [[alien]] mecha's original inertia vector control system and short range energy [[arm cannon]]s besides the standard [[gunpod]].

It was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] (external fuselage design) and [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] ([[cockpit]] design). The mind control system of the mecha was inspired by the one used in the [[Mig-31 Firefox]] jet from the movie [[Firefox_(movie)|]].

title: mig-31_firefox
body:
An experimental [[Soviet Air Force]] [[fighter jet]] from the movie [[Firefox_(movie)|]].

It has an advanced mind control system to operate the plane and its many weapons. 

It inspired the [[YF-21]] [[variable fighter]] from the anime [[Macross Plus]] years later.

title: picket_patrol_ship
body:
An alien [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] series.

The [b]Picket Patrol Ship[/b] is a 0.5 km long [[Zentradi]] ship used by their fleets for advance reconnaissance. Prior to any main fleet entering a potentially hostile or unexplored area of space, the Picket ships are sent in to scout and report back to the command ship. 

The Picket is armed with several energy cannons and missile launchers for anti-ship and anti-[[mecha]] defense.

It was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

title: hargan
body:
Antagonist transformable [[motorcycle]]s from the [[Megazone 23]] [[cyberpunk]] [[mecha]] anime series from the 80s. They have a white and dark blue color scheme and are usually deployed in large numbers.

They were designed by [[Aramaki Shinji]].

title: vf-4
body:
A [[variable fighter]] mecha from the [[MACROSS]] universe. 

The [b]VF-4 Lightning III[/b] is the succesor to the [[VF-1]] manned transformable aerospace mecha from [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|The Super Dimension Fortress Macross]]. It first appeared in the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA from 1987. Early prototypes had the [[VFX-4]] designation.

The [i]Lightning[/i] is faster, more maneuverable, can generate more thrust than the standard VF-1 [i]Valkyrie[/i], and is armed with internal missile bays and dual beam [[arm cannon]]s in addition to the same traditional GU-11 [[gunpod]] found in the VF-1. 

More advanced variants included improved thermonuclear engines and an additional head-mounted laser cannon for defense. It was eventually succeeded by the [[VF-11]] [i]Thunderbolt[/i] several years later.

The mecha was called the [b]VF-4 Lightning Veritech[/b] in the [[Robotech]] adaptation.

The VF-4 was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]].

title: gnerl
body:
An alien [[starfighter]] from the [[MACROSS]] series. It first appeared in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982.

The [b]Fighter Pod[/b] (空戦ポッド, [i]kuusen pod[/i]) is a [[Zentradi]] one-man tactical aerospace attack [[spacecraft]] designed for outer space and atmospheric operations. It is very fast, highly maneuverable and also armed with a triple-barreled energy cannon on its nose and several internal missile bays. 

In the TV show, its official name is obscure. But judging from some Zentradi operator's quote in [[Vrlitwhai Kridanik]]'s spaceship, it's called [b]Gnerl[/b] (ジナール). In Artdink's [[PlayStation 3]] [[ video game]], "”MACROSS 30: Ginga wo Tsunagu Utagoe”,":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macross_30:_The_Voice_that_Connects_the_Galaxy the starfighter is officially called "Gnerl".

It was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

h4.See also
* "Gnerl Fighter Pod Image":https://macross.fandom.com/wiki/Gnerl?file=Gnerl.gif

title: nousjadeul-ger
body:
An [[alien]] combat mecha from the [[MACROSS]] series. The [[Flemenmik]] [b]Nousjadeul-Ger[/b] is a [[Zentradi]] one-man tactical multi-role aerospace [[power armor]].

Its weapons include a powerful, long-range and shoulder mounted large beam cannon (designed for anti-ship combat), a heavy impact cannon on its torso and handled weaponry (energy guns and/or rifles).

It was originally designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] for the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982. It also appears in the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] anime movie from 1984 in redesigned form. The new design was created by [[Izubuchi Yutaka]]. This redesign also included a [[missile_pod|missile rack]] briefly seen on screen.

title: inbit
body:
The main antagonists in the anime [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]].

The [b]Inbit[/b] are an advanced insectoid biomechanical [[alien]] race that have invaded Earth and made it their new home. While most of them look like giant biomechanical [[crab]]s, some are human sized and others have even acquired a humanoid form to better adapt to Earth's conditions.

They were designed by artist [[Kakinuma Hideki]].

h4. Related characters

* [[Protect Inbit]]
* [[Igaa]]
* [[Sheldo]]
* [[Gurab]]
* [[Garmo]]
* [[Gosu]]
* [[Aisha (Mospeada)]]
* [[Inbit Hive]]
* [[Solzie]]
* [[Refless]]

title: the_winged_dragon_of_ra
body:
A [[duel monster]] from [[yu-gi-oh!|Yu-Gi-Oh]], one of the 3 Egyptian God cards and the "leader" of the group.

Famous for its ridiculous amount of powerful effects it has in the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]] anime, with 22 in total. These include being immune to almost all card effects, its effects being unnegateable, allowing the user to destroy any card on the field by paying Life Points, attacking any monster that is summoned during the opponent's turn, allowing the user to do "point-to-point" transfer by transferring their LP and the card's ATK/DEF back-and-forth as they wish, requiring a specific "summoning chant" to be successfully summoned, and much more.

Due to this, when the real life version of the card was released in 2010, it was heavily downgraded to have a handful amount of effects. After more powerful monsters made their debut and the game's power ceiling has been steadily risen over the year, [[Konami]] later introduced a large number of support cards to emulate Ra's anime effects.

English name: The Winged Dragon of Ra
Japanese name: The Winged Divine Dragon of Ra

h4. Variants
* [[The Winged Dragon of Ra - Immortal Phoenix]]
* [[the winged dragon of ra - sphere mode|The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode]]

h4. See also

* [[Obelisk The Tormentor]]
* [[Osiris The Sky Dragon]]

title: dunbine
body:
The titular [[mecha]] from the [[Seisenshi Dunbine]] series.

t was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

h4. See also

* [[Abigorbine]]

title: queadluun-nona
body:
[[Zentradi]] one-man tactical aerospace alien [[power armor]] that first appeared in the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] [[video game]] for the [[Sega Saturn]] in 1997.

The [b]Queadluun-Nona[/b] is a simplified and cheaper mass-production model of the Queadluun-Rau designed to be usable by any [[maclone]] Zentradi or [[Meltrandi]] soldier. The Nona has inferior performance to the [[Queadluun-Rau]] and possesses fewer [[missile_pod|missile launchers]]. However, the Nona also features an improved dual sensor system that makes this aerospace power armor better suited for a reconnaissance role.

The Queadluun-Nona was designed by artist [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

h4. See also

* [[Queadluun-Rau]]
* [[Queadluun-Rea]]

title: glaug
body:
In the [[Macross]] franchise, a [[Zentradi]] alien one-man command aerospace [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]]. 

The [[Roiquonmi]] [b]Glaug[/b] walker is better armored and has much more powerful weaponry than the [[Esbeliben]] [[Regult]]. It is armed with 2 mid-range energy guns and 2 rapid firing close-range energy guns in its arms, 2 small anti-personnel laser cannons on both sides of its cockpit and one long-range anti-ship heavy plasma cannon at the top.

This mecha can also be equipped with an aerospace booster which greatly increases its speed while traveling through space and enables it to fly in an atmosphere at supersonic speeds. The booster is armed with 6 missile launchers with 2 medium sized missiles each.

Because of its rarity and power, the Glaug is usually assigned to high ranking Zentradi officers and fleet commanders. It is the mecha of choice for [[Quamzin Kravshera]].

It was renamed as the [b]Officer's Battle Pod[/b] in the [[Robotech]] 1985 adaptation.

It was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] for the original [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series.

h4. See also

* [[Variable Glaug]]
* [[draug_(mecha)|Draug]]

title: fire_valkyrie
body:
Custom civilian [[VF-19]] variable fighter that first appeared in the [[Macross 7]] [[mecha]] anime TV series. It is piloted by [[Nekki Basara]]. Is painted red with yellow markings on it.

The [b]Fire Valkyrie[/b] is notable because it is one of the few known variable fighters to have a humanoid face (with eyes, nose and mouth) in [[Battroid]] mode, making it a unique mecha from the [[Macross]] universe. 

It was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]].

title: queadluun-rau
body:
[[Zentradi]] one-man tactical aerospace alien [[power armor]] that first appeared in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] anime TV series.

The [[Quimeliquola]] [b]Queadluun-Rau[/b], also known as the [b]Q-Rau[/b], is one of the most advanced and dangerous Zentradi [[mecha]]. It is very fast, heavy armored and highly maneuverable thanks to its inertia vector control system, several [[vernier thrusters]] and advanced thermonuclear reactor. 

This power armor is armed with two mid-range energy cannons on its torso, two triple-barreled rapid fire energy [[arm cannon]]s on its forearms, two micro-missile launchers on its back and two on its legs with dozens of missiles each. Because of its characteristics and weaponry, this mecha is used mostly in enemy fighter interception and long range aggressive-reconaissance roles, rather than anti-capital ship combat. 

The Q-Rau is the mecha of choice for Zentradi [[starfighter]] aces such as [[Millia Jenius]].

In the original 1982 Macross TV series the mecha was used by the female fleets of the Zentradi armada, while in the 1984 film adaptation of the series, [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] the Q-Rau was used by the [[Meltrandi]] fleet (enemies of the Zentradi fleet) only.   

The Queadluun-Rau was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

h4. See also

* [[Queadluun-Nona]]
* [[Queadluun-Rea]]
* [[YF-21]]

* [[Nousjadeul-Ger]]
* [[Queadluun-Ger]]

title: quiltra-queleual
body:
A massive alien [[spacecraft]] from the [[MACROSS]] series.

The [b]Quiltra-Queleual Class Landing Ship Tank[/b] like nearly all [[Zentradi]] ships of the line, has been in active service for hundreds of millennia. 

Another product of the war machines used during the ancient Schism War of the old [[Protoculture]] Stellar Republic, the Quiltra-Queleual serves the role of a planetary assault ship. More than any of the other Zentradi capital ships, this vessel devotes the vast majority of internal volume to [[mecha]] bays and hangars for [[Regult]] battle pods, [[Gnerl]] fighters and re-entry craft. 

This ship features several launching hatches for efficient deployment including a large re-entry pod [[hatch]] in its bow. While not specifically designed for ship-to-ship combat, the Quiltra-Queleual still features a moderate number of anti-ship and anti-fighter [[energy cannon]]s and [[missile]] weapons for attack and defense. 

It was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

title: armd
body:
A [[spacecraft]] from the [[MACROSS]] series.

The [b]ARMD Class Space Carrier[/b] (ARMD being an acronym for [b]A[/b]rmaments [b]R[/b]igged-up [b]M[/b]oving [b]D[/b]eck) is a human built warship designed as [[space]] carrier for [[variable fighter]]s and other [[U.N. Spacy]] [[mecha]].

Built by OTEC Company, the ARMD carriers featured OverTechnology with gravity control systems, a reaction heat pile system and even a fold drive (though this hyperspace navigation system was never implemented in actual combat). At 0.4 km in length, the ARMD carriers were much smaller than the large [[SDF-1]] "Macross" and both ARMD-01 and ARMD-02 were originally meant to dock with the larger craft when the ship achieved orbit during its maiden voyage.

As a carrier vessel, the ARMDs held numerous ships and mecha. ARMD-01 held 78 SF-A3 Lancer II space fighters and 270 [[QF-3000E]] [[Ghost drone]] fighters (as well as an unknown number of [[VF-1]] variable fighters) just prior to [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross|Space War I]] (the events of [i]Super Dimension Fortress Macross[/i]). 

In addition to several hundred fighters, the ARMD carrier was armed with many weapons including beam cannons, small anti-aircraft cannons and [[missile]] launchers as well as several anti-ship medium sized and large missiles with multiple [[nuclear weapon|reaction warheads]]. 

The ARMD possessed many large [[vernier thrusters]] nozzles positioned all over the craft. These powerful [[thrusters]] granted the ARMD excellent maneuverability in space and also proved very useful for combat engagement and evasion.

The ship was renamed the [b]Armor Class Space Carrier[/b] in the [[Robotech]] adaptation from 1985.

It was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] for the first Macross TV series.

h4. See also

* [[Guantanamo Class Stealth Carrier]]

title: kraken
body:
A mythical sea monster of gargantuan size, often depicted as a giant [[squid]]/[[octopus]] with [[tentacles]], and seen crushing ships sailing on the seas. Originated from the [[Norse mythology]].

h4. See also

* [[giant squid]] - the real life counterpart of the mythological creature
* [[hydra]]
* [[mokele-mbembe]]
* [[monster]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: giant_squid
body:
The [b]giant squid (Architeuthis dux)[/b] is a species of giant, deep-dwelling [[squid]]. It has a length between 10 - 13 meters, which makes it one of the largest living invertebrate.

This tag is for the specific depiction of the real life giant squid. For generic depictions of very large octopi, use [[kraken]] instead.

title: m56_smartgun
body:
A [[machine gun]] from the 1986 [[Aliens (1986)|]] film.

The [b]M56 Smartgun[/b] is a self-targeting heavy [[machine gun]] attached to a harness that is used as a squad support weapon by the [[Colonial Marine]] Corps. An optical sensor in the gun detects moving targets and an alarm informs the operator when a target is acquired. 

It was designed by "Stan Winston":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stan_Winston and [[James Cameron]] using components from a steady cam harness, a WWII era German [[MG42]] [[machine gun]] and several [[motorcycle]] parts.

title: sulaco
body:
A military [[spacecraft]] from the [[Aliens (1986)|]] (1986) film.

The [b]USCMS Sulaco[/b] is a combat starcruiser of the [[Colonial Marine]] Corps.

It was designed by [[Syd Mead]].

title: m41a_pulse_rifle
body:
A [[rifle]] that first appeared in the [[Aliens (1986)|]] (1986) film.

The [b]ARMAT M41A Pulse Rifle[/b] is the standard issue combat rifle of the [[Colonial Marine]] Corps.

It is made of advanced lightweight and highly resistant alloys and is also equipped with a digital ammo counter and a progressive trigger. Given its small size, high rate of fire, accuracy and caliber is used both as an [[assault rifle]] and a [[submachine gun]]. The M41 uses 99 round caseless ammunition magazines and fires a 10 mm armor piercing projectile. 

It also possess an underslung 30 mm integrated grenade launcher with a 4 round capacity. It is able to fire standard explosive, HE and incendiary grenade rounds.

The M41 prop was designed by "Stan Winston":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stan_Winston and [[James Cameron]] using parts from a [[Thompson submachine gun]] and a [[SPAS-12]].

h4. See also

* [[assault rifle]]
* [[grenade launcher]]
* [[Colonial Marine]]

h4. External links

* AVP Wiki: "M41A":[https://www.avpcentral.com/pulse-rifle-variants]

title: jupiter_(horse)
body:
One of the [[horse]]s of [[Nishi Takeichi]], a [[real life]] historical figure who took part in the 1945 Battle of [[Iwo Jima]] during [[World War II]].

It was killed during an early American bomber attack on the island of Iwo Jima days before the invasion of the beaches by the [[United States Marine Corps]].

h4. See also

* [[Letters from Iwo Jima]]
* [[Uranus (horse)]]

title: karmatron
body:
The eponymous [[super robot]] main character of the [[Karmatron y los Transformables]] comic series.

[b]Karmatron[/b] is a 300 feet tall, red, silver and black armoured spiritual warrior and robotic looking [[mecha]] being who protects good and peace in the universe.

Its name comes from the combination of the word [i]Karma[/i], a mystic word, and the cybernetic term [i]Tron[/i].

Besides its enormous size, Karmatron has also many super powers, including telekinesis, clairvoiyance, energy blasts, astral journeys, flight, space travel, a powerful and almost indestructible armor, a power [[katana]], an ice saber, freezing rays, energy [[boomerang]]s, energy [[shuriken]]s and invisibility.

The character was created by [[Oscar Gonzalez Loyo]].

title: sv001_(metal_slug)
body:
The [b]SV-001[/b] ([b]Super Vehicle 001) Metal Slug[/b] is the main protagonist playable [[battle]] [[tank]] of [[SNK]]'s [[Metal Slug]] series, driven by the Regular Army. It is very light, small and fast, has very resistant armor, is able to cross any type of terrain and is armed with a potent short barreled HE and AP [[cannon]] in its [[turret]] as well as dual vulcan [[machine gun]]s with blue tracer bullets in its rear section.
 
Its design was inspired by the [[Bonaparte (tank)|]] [[tank]] from the [[Dominion (manga)|]] manga published a decade before the release of Metal Slug.

h4. See also

* [[Slug Gunner]]

title: love_live!_school_idol_project
body:
The first entry in the [[Love Live!]] franchise, a Japanese multimedia project co-developed by "ASCII Media Works":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ASCII_Media_Works]' "Dengeki G's Magazine":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dengeki_G%27s_Magazine], music label "Lantis":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lantis_%28company%29], and animation studio [[Sunrise (company)|]]. 

The series follows several girls from Otonokizaka High School who get together to form the idol group μ's (pronounced Muse), to attract new students to their school and prevent it from closing.

title: historical_name_connection
body:
A [[cosplay]], [[crossover]], or [[parody]] between two or more characters who are based on the same historical figure, such as being based on the same person, animal, ship, or other famous entity.

This normally doesn't warrant [[trait connection]], as characters with a shared origin are expected to be similar. Only use [[trait connection]] when there are shared traits outside of the shared origin.

For posts referencing specific historical events linking two characters, use [[historical connection]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #3804439: Tashkent from [[Kantai Collection|Kancolle]], [[Azur Lane]], and [[Warship Girls R]]

h4. See also

* [[name connection]]
* [[Tag group:history]]

body: [i][[One Piece]][/i] character. Daughter of [[Kouzuki Oden]] and [[Kouzuki Toki|Toki]], and [[Kouzuki Momonosuke]]'s younger sister. When the castle fell 20 years ago, she escaped from the castle with [[Kawamatsu]] and survived.

title: fusion
body:
The merging of two or more characters/things, resulting in a new creation with a mix of traits from the originals.

If the only mixed traits are their attire, e.g. if it has all the physical traits (hair, eyes, body type, skin tone) of one character and the clothing, accessories or equipment of the other, the [[cosplay]] tag may be more appropriate.

Do not use this tag on official fusions.

h4. See also

* [[multiple fusions]]
* [[chimerism]]
* [[fusion dance]]
* [[if they mated]]
* [[hexafusion]]
* [[gattai]]
* [[Kamui (Tales of Zestiria)]]
* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]
other_names: ポケモンフュージョン

title: historical_connection
body:
A [[cosplay]], [[crossover]], or [[parody]] based on two characters being linked to same historical event.

For posts that directly depict a historical event, see [[historical event]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Historical event]]
* [[Historical name connection]] - posts with two or more characters based on the same historical entity
* [[Tag group:history]]

title: big_barda
body:
[b]Big Barda[/b] (also known as [b]Barda Free[/b]) is a [[DC Comics]] anti-superhero.

She first appeared in Mister Miracle #4 (October 1971), and was created by [[Jack Kirby]]. Barda is very tall and has superhuman strength and endurance. She is usually seen wearing a [[superhero costume]] consisting of a red cape and a blue and golden [[armor]]ed uniform with a similarly colored helmet. Barda is also armed with an energy firing golden mace. 

Her physical appearance is based on actress "Lainie Kazan":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lainie_Kazan], who at the time of the character's creation had recently appeared topless in [[Playboy]].

title: queadluun-rea
body:
[[Zentradi]] one-man tactical aerospace [[power armor]] that first appeared in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series from 2008. 

It is very similar to the [[Queadluun-Rau]] [[power suit]] from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] and [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]]. However, this [[mecha]] is even faster and has a more powerful thermonuclear reactor as well as an additional long-range beam [[cannon]] on its left shoulder (like the [[Nousjadeul-Ger]] [[power armor]]), giving it more anti-capital ship capabilities. 

The Rea was developed by the [[N.U.N.S.]] for the Zentradi ally fleets. The latest type ([i]Rea/56[/i]) is deployed with Zentradi immigration fleets and planetary migration missions.

This is the mecha of choice for [[Klan Klein]] and the [[Meltrandi]] [[S.M.S.]] Pixie Squadron.

The Rea was designed by [[Ishigaki Jun'ya]] based on the original 80s design by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

h4. See also

* [[Queadluun-Nona]]
* [[Queadluun-Rau]]

title: sleggar_law
body:
A character from the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] anime series.

[b]Sleggar Law[/b] is a womanizing and alcoholic veteran [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] [[soldier]] and [[pilot]] who serves as [[teacher|senpai]] to most of the young crew of the [[White Base]]. [spoilers]Sleggar dies in [[battle]] with [[Zeon]] forces when his [[Core Booster]] is crushed by (and crashes at) the [[Big Zam]] during a daring final attack on the gigantic machine.[/spoilers]

He served as inspiration for the character of [[Roy Focker]] from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] (1982).

title: yf-29
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] series.

The [b]YF-29 Durandal[/b] is an advanced prototype of the [[VF-25]] Messiah variable fighter that first appeared in the [[Macross Frontier: Sayonara No Tsubasa]] animated movie from 2011. Its next animated appearance is in the [[Macross Delta: Zettai Live!!!!!!]] animated movie from 2021.

Features include [[canards]] and forward-swept wings with built-in extra boosters. Only one exists and is in use by the [[S.M.S.]] company. It is piloted by [[Saotome Alto]], and its color scheme is red and white.

Several years later, [[Maximilian Jenius]] piloted a YF-29, which is painted in his signature blue and white color scheme. 

In real life it was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]].

title: vf-0
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] universe. 

In the [[macross zero|Macross Zero]] OVA series, the [[U.N. Spacy]] [b]VF-0 Phoenix[/b] [[variable fighter]] was an advanced "atmosphere-only" prototype for the [[vf-1|VF-1]] [b]Valkyrie[/b]. It served as a flight test unit and later (in 2008) as a frontline fighter, before the Valkyrie's initial mass production in November of the same year.

The VF-0 resembled the VF-1, although its legs were longer because the EGF-127 conventional turbofan engines used by the fighter were larger and bulkier than the VF-1's FF-2001 thermonuclear engines.

Weapons included a Gatling-style [[gunpod]], missiles, bombs, and other munitions. Like the later VF-1, the VF-0 could also mount booster packs. Variants include the [[vf-0a|VF-0A]], [[vf-0b|VF-0B]], [[vf-0d|VF-0D]], [[vf-0s|VF-0S]] and [[VF-0S Armored]].

In real life it was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]].

h4. See also

* [[sv-51|SV-51]]

title: oldna_poseidal
body:
The main antagonist from [[Juusenki L-Gaim]].

[b]Oldna Poseidal[/b] is "the legendary immortal emperor from the planet Gastogal" that rules all of the Pentagona star system. Poseidal is easily spotted by his [[androgynous]] looks, white hair and mismatched eyes; one yellow, one blue.

His character design was based on [[David Bowie]].
other_names: オルドナ・ポセイダル

title: drum_magazine
body:
A type of cylindrical-shaped [[weapon]] [[magazine_(weapon)|magazine]] which stores [[ammunition]] in a spiral layout ([[bullet]]s aligned with the barrel), typically resulting in much greater capacity as compared to standard box/stick magazines. Usually associated with automatic [[gun|firearms]] such as the iconic [[Thompson submachine gun]] and [[PPSh-41]].

See also [[dual drum magazine]], a paired variation often associated with the famous [[MG42]] [[machine gun]] and real life Beta C-Mag.

title: uemura_ai
body:
Japanese-American [[real life]] singer. Often goes by the mononym Ai.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ai (singer)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ai_(singer)]

title: daba_myroad
body:
The protagonist of [[Juusenki L-Gaim]]. Daba is a young man who was entrusted by his grandfather with the custom-built Heavy Metal named [[L-Gaim]] [[mecha]], and would later [[pilot]] it as he and his friends are constantly thrown into hairy situations. 

Physically very fit and strong (despite his common man appearance), he is also well trained in combat. Daba is very friendly and somewhat of a womanizer, as he managed to passively bring [[Fanneria Amu]] and [[Gaw Ha Leecee]] to his side without any overt persuasion.

His character design was based on [[Luke Skywalker]] from [[Star Wars]].

title: colosseum
body:
Originally the [b]Flavian Amphitheatre[/b], an elliptical amphitheatre in the centre of the city of [[Rome (city)|]], [[Italy]], the largest ever built in the Roman Empire, built of concrete and stone. It is considered one of the greatest works of Roman architecture and Roman engineering and is also famous as a [[gladiator]]ial arena. The name is derived from the Colossus of Rhodes, a giant statue of Apollo which stood near (but not inside) the Amphitheatre.

Note that this tag is not limited to the real life colosseum, as it also includes fantastical depictions of an [[arena]] inspired after the real life arena.

h4. See also

* [[Arena]]

title: bunny_ayumi
body:
[[Real life]] Twitch streamer and variety model. Formerly associated with [[SwimsuitSuccubus]].

Formerly active as a [[virtual YouTuber]] alongside her real life work, but has since ceased VTuber activities after several controversies.

h4. Appearances

* !asset #21347244: IRL appearance (2024)
* !post #5062432: [[Bunny Ayumi (VTuber)]] - her first VTuber model, based on her real life appearance
* !post #4915254: [[Bonnie (Bunny GIF)]] - her last VTuber model, illustrated by [[BSApricot]]

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:People]]

* "Twitch":https://www.twitch.tv/bunnyayumi
* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/BunnyAyu
* "Patreon":https://www.patreon.com/BunnyAyumi
* "Facebook":https://www.facebook.com/BunnyAyumi

title: death_star
body:
A planet-destroying [[space station]] from the [[Star Wars]] franchise created by the [[Galactic Empire (star wars)|]]. It first appeared in [[Star Wars: A New Hope]].

The [b]Death Star[/b] was the most powerful super weapon in the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]'s arsenal. It was a space station capable of destroying entire planets with a single powerful blast of its massive superlaser.

The Death Star was an Imperial space station shaped like an artificial small moon. It was operated by thousands of Imperial personnel and had a massive complement of Imperial troops, vehicles and [[spacecraft]] on its many docking bays and hangars scattered across its main superstructure. 

Its final design and construction were supervised by Imperial weapons designer, Raith Sienar, from original blueprints captured from Confederacy scientists and weapon designers who crafted them during the Clone Wars.

In real life the Death Star was designed by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie for the first [[Star Wars]] film.

title: t-65_x-wing
body:
A [[spacecraft]] from the [[Star Wars]] franchise used by the [[Rebel Alliance (star wars)|]].

The [b]T-65 X-Wing Starfighter[/b] is a fast and heavy armed and armored [[space]] superiority fighter. It has a characteristic "X"-shape of four wings, known as S-foils, extending out from the fuselage. 

The Incom T-65 X-wing starfighter was the primary all-purpose starfighter of the [[Rebel Alliance (star wars)|]] and its successor governments. Known for its versatility and exceptional combat performance, it was a favorite with Rebel and New Republic pilots. Possessing four laser cannons, deflector shields, a hyperdrive, an R2 astromech for repairs and navigation, and a complement of proton torpedoes, the X-wing allowed the Rebellion to launch raids in Imperial space with improved odds of a successful mission. 

In real life it was designed by "Ralph McQuarrie":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie].

h4. See also

* [[T-70 X-wing]]

title: at-at
body:
A [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]] from the [[Star Wars]] series. It first appeared in [[Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back]].

The [b]All Terrain Armored Transport Walker[/b], also known as the [b]Imperial Walker[/b] or simply as the [b]AT-AT Walker[/b], was a powerful and devastating [[mecha]] of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]'s arsenal. 

Imperial Walkers were designed to break through enemy lines, obliterate hostile bases and as a troop transport (it could carry up to 40 troops depending on its internal configuration). It was one of the biggest, most heavily armored and armed land vehicles in all the Imperial Army, but was also known for its relatively slow speed.

The AT-AT was 20 mts long, 22.5 mts high and traveled at a maximum speed of 60 km/h. It was piloted by two [[AT-AT pilot]]s.

It was designed by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie and "Joe Johnston":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Johnston].

h4. See also

* [[AT-TE Walker]]
* [[AT-ST]]

title: misty_blue_veil_(shining_nikki)
body:
An SSR outfit that could be obtained during the "Game Royale" event of [[Shining Nikki]]. It was designed by [[Zoey (Shining Nikki)|Zoey]].

It can be evolved into [[Misty Blue Veil (shining nikki)|Crimson Night Song]].

title: battroid
body:
[b]BATTROID[/b] (or [b]BATTLE [[ANDROID]] FORM[/b]) is a transformation mode of the [[VF-1]] [[variable fighter]] from [[MACROSS]] (and other related transformable [[variable fighter]] [[mecha]]) where the nose and wings of the fighter [[jet]] are folded and its fuselage and turbines reconfigure to form a giant combat manned [[robot]] that uses the fighter's [[gunpod]] as an [[assault rifle]]. 

According to the Macross continuity this mode was first developed to fight hostile [[giant]] humanoid [[alien]]s called [[Zentradi]] in their own environment, to execute effective hand-to-hand combat against the enemy and to enable the [[U.N. Spacy]] pilots to operate Zentradi mecha, weapons, equipment and installations with ease. 

This mode was renamed the [b]BATTLOID MODE[/b] in [[ROBOTECH]].

It was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]].

h4. Battroids

* [[orguss_(mecha)|Orguss]] ([[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]])
* [[Legioss]] ([[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]])
* [[Spartas]] ([[Choujikuu Kidan Southern Cross]])

h4.See also

* [[GERWALK]]

h4.External links

* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VF-1_Valkyrie#Battroid_mode

title: metal_gear_solid_3:_snake_eater
body:
[b]Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater[/b] is a 2004 stealth action video game directed by [[Kojima Hideo]] and developed by [[Konami]] for the [[PlayStation 2]].

The game, which serves as a prequel to the [[Metal Gear (series)|]] series, was followed by two direct sequels titled [[Metal Gear Solid: Portable Ops]] and [[Metal Gear Solid: Peace Walker]].

Set in 1964, the game follows [[Naked Snake]], who must rescue a Soviet rocket scientist and sabotage the Soviet nuclear superweapon [[Shagohod]], while confronting his former mentor, [[The Boss]], who has defected to the Soviet side. 

A remake titled [i]Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater[/i] was released in 2025.

h4. Characters

* [[Naked Snake]]
* [[The Boss]]
* [[Shagohod]]

title: glowing_crown_(shining_nikki)
body:
An SSR outfit that could be obtained during the "Game Royale" event of [[Shining Nikki]]. It was designed by [[Lilith (Shining Nikki)|Lilith]].

It can be evolved into [[Glowing Crown (shining nikki)|Timeless Ode]].

h4. Appearance

title: metal_gear_solid
body:
[b]Metal Gear Solid[/b] is a 1998 stealth action [[video game]] directed by [[Kojima Hideo]] and developed by [[Konami]] for the [[PlayStation 1]].

Metal Gear Solid follows [[Solid Snake]], a soldier who infiltrates a nuclear weapons facility to neutralize the terrorist threat from FOXHOUND, a renegade special forces unit. Snake must liberate two hostages, the head of DARPA and the president of a major arms manufacturer, confront the terrorists, and stop them from launching a nuclear strike using an advanced combat [[mecha]] known as [[Metal Gear REX]].

It is the sequel to Kojima's early [[MSX]]2 computer games [[Metal Gear 1]] and [[Metal Gear 2]]. The game featured cinematic cutscenes rendered using the in-game engine and graphics, as well as voice acting in numerous codec sequences.

An expanded version titled [i]Metal Gear Solid: Integral[/i] was released for the PlayStation and PC. A remake with enhanced graphics, [i]Metal Gear Solid: The Twin Snakes[/i] was later released for the [[Nintendo]] [[GameCube]].

A direct sequel called [[Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty]] was released in 2001.

h4. Characters

* [[Liquid Snake]]
* [[Revolver Ocelot]]
* [[Sniper Wolf]]
* [[Roy Campbell]]
* [[Meryl Silverburgh]]
* [[Naomi Hunter]]
* [[Mei Ling]]

She is a [[dark-skinned female]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[black hair|black]] and [[purple hair]], [[yellow eyes]] with [[slit pupils]], and [[large breasts]]. For her default costume, she wears a [[maid]] outfit, with a [[black dress|black]] [[short dress|short]] [[pleated dress]], with [[puffy short sleeves]], with a [[white apron|white]] [[frilled apron]] with [[white gloves]], [[white pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[strappy heels]].

Her personal weapon is a [[Boys Anti Tank Rifle]].

title: metal_gear_(series)
body:
A series of stealth action video games created by [[Kojima Hideo]] and developed and published by [[Konami]]. In the series, the player takes control of a Special Forces Operative ([[Solid Snake]] in most games) repeatedly facing off against the latest incarnation of the eponymous superweapon "[[Metal Gear (robot)|]]": a combat [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]] tank with nuclear launching capabilities.

The series is famous for pioneering the stealth game genre, for its lengthy cinematic cut scenes, intricate storylines, [[fourth wall]]-breaking sense of humor, and its exploration of the nature of politics, warfare, and philosophical themes.

title: metal_gear_(robot)
body:
The titular manned [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]] from the [[Metal Gear_(series)|]] series.

[b]METAL GEAR[/b] was the designation given to various models of bipedal [[walker (robot)|]] [[tank]]s. They were behemoth machines capable of decimating lesser machines. Metal Gear had the distinction of being [[nuclear_weapon|nuclear]] capable, firing warheads from their [[railgun]], eliminating the need for a [[missile]], or launchpad allowing them to attack targets from anywhere in the world, on any kind of terrain. This peaked with [[Metal Gear REX]] which was sophisticated enough to launch a nuke and hit a target from anywhere in the world. REX also had the distinction of being completely untraceable.

title: metal_gear_solid_2:_sons_of_liberty
body:
[b]Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty[/b] is a 2001 stealth action [[video game]] directed by [[Hideo Kojima]] and developed by [[Konami]]. Released for the [[PlayStation 2]], it is the seventh overall game in the [[Metal Gear (series)|]] series and a direct sequel to [[Metal Gear Solid]]. It features [[Raiden (Metal Gear)|]] as its protagonist.

The story revolves around the Big Shell, a massive offshore clean-up facility seized by a group of terrorists who call themselves the titular "Sons of Liberty". They demand an enormous ransom in exchange for the life of the President of the United States and threaten to destroy the facility and create a cataclysmic environmental disaster if their demands are not met.

An expanded edition, titled [b]Metal Gear Solid 2: Substance[/b], was released in 2002 for [[Xbox (original)|]] and Microsoft Windows in addition to the PlayStation 2. A remastered version of the game was later included in the Metal Gear Solid HD Collection for the [[PlayStation 3]], [[PlayStation Vita]], and [[Xbox 360]].

A direct sequel called [[Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots]] was released in 2008.

h4. See also

* [[Raiden (Metal Gear)|]]
* [[Metal Gear Ray]]

body:

The [b]ExtraVehicular Activity Pod[/b] (abbreviated [b]EVA Pod[/b]) is a type of one-man small [[space]] vehicle that served as transporter and mobile workshop during extravehicular activities by the [[Discovery One]] crew.

title: ball_(gundam)
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV show from 1979.

The [b]RB-79 Ball[/b] is a simplistic mobile weapon created by the [[Earth Federation]] to support their fledgling [[mobile suit]] [[space]] forces. They are usually deployed in vast numbers and operate only in [[zero gravity]] environments. 

Despite its unassuming looks and less than unique armament, the Ball was somewhat agile and possessed multiple different configurations, which made the pokey machines quite dangerous in the right hands. It is said that a Ball, piloted by [[Shiro Amada]], was even capable of defeating a [[Zaku II]] High Mobility Type in one-on-one combat.

Its design was inspired by the [[EVA pod]]s from [[2001 A Space Odyssey]].

title: penelope_(hathaway's_flash)
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It is an antagonist [[mobile suit]] from [[Gundam Hathaway's Flash]].

The [b]RX-104FF Penelope[/b] is a mode of the RX-104 [[Odysseus Gundam]] (i.e., equipped with the FF [Fixed Flight] Unit). It is classified as a 5th generation MS alongside the [[Xi Gundam|RX-105 Xi Gundam]], which was developed around the same time. It is one of the first mobile suits to be equipped with a miniaturized Minovsky Flight Unit, making it highly capable of sustaining independent atmospheric flight; and was considered to be a MS that would revolutionize the course of MS operations under gravity. While the Xi Gundam had a different structure that integrated all of the functions into a single MS, the Penelope Gundam largely depended on the FF Unit. In addition to the FF unit, it is said that an optional armament known as the Argos Unit was developed, but its details are unknown. It is also said to be equipped with a Psycommu or a Quasi-Psycommu unit. The MS is also capable of supersonic flight by deploying a Beam Barrier in the direction of its movement, but this requires the MS to transform into its Flight Form.

Its armaments consist of a [[beam rifle]], vulcan guns (mounted on the FF Unit's nose), shoulder-mounted Mega Particle [[beam cannon|Cannons]] (which can also be used as handheld [[energy sword|beam sabers]]), forearm-mounted Composite Weapon Units (a unique weapon that houses a Mega Particle Cannon, a Beam Saber, and missiles in a single unit), and its signature [i]Funnel Missiles[/i], which are [[funnels (gundam)|remote-controlled weapons]] guided by the pilot's Newtype abilities and exploding upon impact. These weapons are also equipped on the Xi Gundam.

It is piloted by [[Lane Aim]] of the Circe Special Forces unit.

It was designed in real life by [[Moriki Yasuhiro]] for the novel; the design was later updated by Fujita Kazumi for the SD Gundam G-Generation series; this updated design has been used for both video games and figures, with [[Katoki Hajime]] giving the design another update for the Fix Figuration line (where its parts can be swapped with the Xi Gundam).

title: walkure_(macross_delta)
body:
A five member [[idol]] group from [[Macross Delta]]. Because the group's singing is capable of dampening the effect of the Vár syndrome, they are often deployed to perform at active battle zones. Their logo is a [[silhouette]] of Mikumo with [[butterfly wings]] and [[floating hair]]. They often do hand gestures in a "[[\m/]]" shape.

The name is used to refer to both the in-universe idol group, and the [[real life]] idol group comprised of the characters' [[voice actor]]s.

During the 2019 Macross Crossover Live event, [[Kawamori Shouji]] teased that a sixth member would be added to the group in the second movie based on the series, though it did not end up coming to fruition. Instead, the film debuted [[Yami Q Ray]] as a rival group to Walkure.

body:
An elite [[clone trooper]] unit of the [[Galactic Republic]] in the [[Star Wars]] universe. When Order 66 was initiated and the Galactic Republic fell, the 501st legion remained, joining the [[galactic empire (star wars)|Imperial army]] as a [[stormtrooper]] legion, still under the command of [[Anakin Skywalker]]. The distinguishing color of the 501st legion is blue.

title: tie_advanced_x1
body:
A [[spacecraft]] from the [[Star Wars]] universe.

The [i]Sienar Fleet Systems[/i] [b]TIE Advanced X1[/b] is an advanced experimental [[starfighter]] prototype of the original dual [[energy cannon]] [[TIE Fighter]], now also equipped with [[missile launcher]]s, a fully functional hyperdrive and powerful energy shields. It was designed in-universe by the Empire's weapon designer [[death_star|Raith Sienar]], famous for creating many other Imperial weaponry.

The TIE Advanced is the fighter of choice of [[Darth Vader]], the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]'s top starfighter ace [[pilot]].

In real life it was designed by "Ralph McQuarrie":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie].

h4. See also

* [[TIE Interceptor]]

title: animification
body:
A non-anime character depicted in an anime art style. This can apply to characters from live action television shows/movies, cartoons, western comics, and video games, as well as famous people from [[real life]].

Does not apply to characters from western comics or cartoons that already have anime-like designs (e.g. [[Avatar: The Last Airbender]], [[RWBY]], [[Peni Parker]] from [[Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse]]).

Some sites use the term "animification" to refer to art depicting humans or objects as animals. On Danbooru that concept is tagged as [[animalization]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7316299: [[Spider-man_(series)|]] (western comic) characters in anime style
* !post #6478992: [[Tokusatsu]] characters in anime style
* !post #7326504: [[Ariana Grande]], a [[real life|real person]] in anime style
* !post #7284383: [[apex_legends|Apex Legends]] (western game) character in anime style
* !post #6714227: [[Adventure Time]] (western cartoon) character in anime style

title: ex-gear
body:
A type of personal [[mecha]] armor from the [[Macross]] universe.

This advanced [[power suit]] appeared first in the [[Macross Frontier]] anime.

The [b]EX-Gear[/b] (Extender-Gear EG-01M/MP) is a special suit designed as both a reinforced-[[exoskeleton]] powered suit as well as an ejection seat/emergency unit for new variable fighters. It is even capable of flight on its own, with its miniature hybrid jet/rocket engine and large variable-geometry wings.

The military model (military specification EGP-03/05) is used by the [[VF-25]], [[VF-171]]EX, [[YF-29]], [[YF-30]], [[VF-1EX]] and [[VF-31]] pilots as an armored [[mecha pilot suit|pilot suit]] to tolerate the extremely high speeds and acceleration these new variable fighters can reach. It can be used by a VF pilot to control the fighter remotely.

Due to its high mobility in the ground and its high maneuverability in the air it is also used as a small personal combat [[power armor]] and as a highly versatile mechanized infantry support unit. 

There is also a civilian version (utility-type PS/ML-21) used for flight training and air acrobatics purposes.

It was designed by [[Ishigaki Jun'ya]].

title: roy_focker
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series, the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] movie adaptation, the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA and the [[Macross Zero]] OVA. 

A talented and strong-willed veteran [[mecha]]/fighter ace pilot, he is known for his love of women and alcohol. [b]Roy Focker[/b] is [[Ichijou Hikaru]]'s best friend/sempai and [[Claudia LaSalle]]'s boyfriend. He is also an American. 

His name was spelled [b]Roy Fokker[/b] in [[Robotech]] for two reasons; to correct the reference, and to avoid confusion with a certain word the producers would rather non be said on air.

Roy's mecha of choice are the [[VF-0S]],  the [[VF-1S]] and the [[VF-1 Strike]].

the design of this character was inspired by [[Sleggar Law]] from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] (1979), who had a similar fate.

title: sword_of_exorcism
body:
Magical weapons used to slay mononoke in [[Mononoke]]. Officially translated as "sacred sword." 

To unsheathe a sword of exorcism, a mononoke's Form (形/katachi - name, shape, physical appearance), Truth (真/makoto - state of being) and Regret (理/kotowari - state of mind) must be discovered. When drawn, the blade is revealed to be an [[energy sword]] far longer than its short sheath.

Two of the sixty-four swords of exorcism have been shown:
The one held by the [[Kusuriuri (Mononoke)|]] of [[Mononoke]] and [[Ayakashi: Japanese Classic Horror|Ayakashi]] is red and gold with many round embedded jewels. The pommel is a goblin-like head with facial hair. When drawn it has an orange and purple energy blade. Its name is Ri.
The one held by the [[Kusuriuri (Gekijouban Mononoke)|]] of [[Gekijouban Mononoke]] is yellow with a design of purple scales along the grip. The pommel is a dragon-like head with sharp fangs. When drawn it has a black and yellow energy blade. Its name is Kon.

title: spetsnaz
body:
The [[Soviet]] or [[Russia]]n [[military operator|special forces]]. Historically, the term referred to special operations units under the control of the GRU, the main [[military]] intelligence service. Russian special forces wear different [[beret]]s depending on the branch of the armed forces to which they belong.

Spetsnaz operatives are usually depicted wearing the [[Gorka]] suit or [[military fatigues]] with [[EMR camouflage]], [[balaclava]], [[SMERSH]] [[load bearing equipment]], and sometimes the distinct [[Altyn helmet]].

title: regult
body:
[[Zentradi]] [[alien]] one-man tactical aerospace [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]] that first appeared in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] 1982 anime series.

The [[Esbeliben]] [b]Regult[/b] is a lightly armored combat walker, but compensates this by having its [[maclone]] pilot equipped with a heavy [[armor]]ed [[spacesuit]] and by being armed with several energy cannons and other powerful weaponry. 

The standard version is armed with 2 pivoting forward firing medium-bore electron beam guns, 2 forward and downward firing pivoting small-bore anti-personnel cannons and a self-defense rear aimed upper turret with 2 small-bore anti-aircraft laser guns.

While primarily designed as an all-terrain, ground based, motorized infantry and armored support unit, this mecha also has superior speed and maneuverability in [[space]] thanks to its high number of [[vernier thrusters]]. Very easy to produce, repair, modify and pilot, the Regult is usually deployed in very vast numbers and in massive attack waves to overwhelm, encircle and obliterate the enemy. It is the main attack mecha of all the Zentradi forces and is produced in the trillions in massive automated factories scattered across the [[milky way]] [[galaxy]].

There are specialized variants of the walker, which range from light and heavy [[artillery]] versions armed with [[missile]]s to an unarmed version designed for Reconaissance and Electronic Countermeasure missions.

It was renamed as the [b]Tactical Battle Pod[/b] in the [[Robotech]] adaptation.

It was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] and inspired by the [[T-34]] [[tank]]s of [[World War II]] and the [[AT-ST]] from [[Star Wars]].

h4. See also

* [[Glaug]]

title: gundam_gp-02_physalis
body:
A [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It first appeared in the [[Gundam 0083]] OVA from 1991.

The [b]RX-78GP02A Gundam "Physalis"[/b] is the second [[mobile suit]] unit of the Gundam Development Program carried out by [[Anaheim Electronics]]. 

The heavy assault unit, [b]Physalis[/b], was designed as a beefy, high-powered fortress buster - and for that purpose, it was armed with a mighty bazooka loaded with a forbidden weapon, a [[nuclear_weapon|Mk. 82 nuclear warhead]]. 

The unit was stolen and used by Zeon ace [[Anavel Gato]], who succeeded in firing the nuke at Solomon and display to the world that the Federation would dare violate the Antarctic Treaty.

Designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]], famous for his previous work in [[Macross]].

title: lynn_minmay
body:
A female character from the [[MACROSS]] franchise, originally spelled as Linn Minmei.

She is one of the main characters from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series. She also appears in the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] movie, in archival footage and flashbacks in the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA and in the [[Macross: The First]] [[comic]]. 

She is a sweet, flighty and insecure teenage pop [[idol]] born in Yokohama Chinatown, Japan (though she is of partial Chinese descent).

Voiced by [[Iijima Mari]].

h4. See also

* [[Ichijou Hikaru]]
* [[Hayase Misa]]

title: snake
body:
An elongate legless carnivorous reptile of the suborder Serpentes.

Snakes resembles [[worm]]s to some extent. As a rule of thumb, the head is always discernible in snakes, but it's not always the case in [[worm]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8073498

h4. See also

* [[Constriction]]
* [[Lamia]]
* [[Snake hair]]
* [[Snake tail]]
* [[Stuffed snake]]
* [[Year of the snake]]

title: ouroboros
body:
An ancient Eastern European symbol depicting a [[snake]] or [[dragon]] eating its own tail. What is represents is debated and may vary from artist to artist. Common interpretation are that of eternity, cyclic nature of life and death and self destruction. 

h4. Examples

* !asset #32497699

h4. See also

* [[Anihilate Uroboros]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ouroboros":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ouroboros

title: anihilate_uroboros
body:
A level boss character from the [[Strider (video game)]] arcade machine released by [[Capcom]] in 1989.

[b]Anihilate Uroboros[/b] is a massive [[robot]] monster with an elongated serpent like body and a humanoid upper section, armed with a [[hammer and sickle]] in both hands.

Its name comes from the [[Ouroboros]], an ancient symbol depicting a serpent or dragon eating its own tail.

title: xeku_eins
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the 1987 photo novel [[Gundam Sentinel]].

The [b]RMS-141 Xeku Eins[/b] is a mass-produced general purpose heavily armed and armored [[Mobile Suit]] with a design inspired by [[the_o_(mobile_suit)|The O]], fielded by a rogue group of [[Earth Federation]] officers and former members of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] called The New Desides. The Xeku has 3 configuration types for close, mid and long distance combat.

It was designed by [[Katoki Hajime]].

title: guncannon_mp_type
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

The [b]RX-77D Guncannon Mass Production Type[/b], also known as the [b]Mass Produced Guncannon[/b], it is a subtype of [[Guncannon]] that first appeared in [[Gundam 0080]]. 

It was designed by [[Izubuchi Yutaka]].

title: v-fin
body:
A [b]V[/b] or [b]U[/b]-shaped head attachment commonly found on Gundams and similar [[mobile suit]]s, where they function as potent [[radio antenna]]s or other sensory and detection equipment. They may be a single piece, such as on the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], have protrusions like on the [[Strike Freedom Gundam|Strike Freedom]], be comprised of detached segments like [[Gundam Harute|Harute]]'s v-fin, or be made of energy or flames like on the [[Beginning Gundam]] and [[Phantom Gundam|Phantom]].

Please note that this tag does not necessarily implicate [[Gundam]] or a parody of the franchise, as mecha from other series may have the same design element.  Examples of this include [[Prowl (transformers)|]] and [[Strongarm_(transformers)|]] from [[Transformers]] and the [[Huckebein]] series from [[Super Robot Wars]].

Similarly, not every Gundam features a v-fin, such as the [[Turn A Gundam (mobile suit)|Turn A]], which has a [[mustache]], [[G-Self]], which has [[horns]], and [[Gundam Ez8|Ez-8]], which has an [[radio antenna|antenna]].

In real life the V-fins were inspired by the crests found on ancient [[Japan]]ese [[kabuto (helmet)|]] helmets.

title: westminster_palace
body:
The home of the Parliament of the [[United Kingdom]] on the bank of the Thames in [[London]]. The [[Elizabeth Tower]] with the famous Big Ben bell is located on the north end.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Real world locations]]
other_names: ウェストミンスター宮殿

title: nelson's_column
body:
A monument in [[London]] built in 1840s to commemorate [[Horatio Nelson]].

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Real world locations]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Nelson's Column":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson%27s_Column]

title: tower_bridge_(london)
body:
An iconic Victorian [[gothic_architecture|Gothic]] bridge crossing the River Thames in [[London]], England. It has two tower sections connected by two sets of pedestrian walkways as well as having the "bascule":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bascule_bridge road deck, which can be raised to allow river traffic to pass through. It was named after the nearby [[Tower of London]].

It played an important role in publicizing the [[2012 Summer Olympics]].

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Real world locations]]

h4. External links

* "Tower Bridge Exhibition":http://www.towerbridge.org.uk/TBE/EN/
* "Wikipedia: Tower Bridge":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tower_Bridge

title: shard_(building)
body:
[[Skyscraper]] built between 2009 and 2012, it is the tallest [[building]] of the United Kingdom and an integral part of the [[London]] skyline.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Real world locations]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: The Shard":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Shard]

title: london_eye
body:
A notable landmark of the city of [[London]], the London Eye is a large [[ferris wheel]] built next to the Thames river that serves as a popular attraction.

h4. See also

* [[Tower Bridge (London)]]
* [[Shard (building)]]
* [[Tag group:Real world locations]]

title: london
body:
The capital city of [[England]] and the [[United Kingdom]], situated around the River Thames. Host city of the [[2012 Summer Olympics]].

title: elizabeth_tower
body:
The iconic [[clock tower]] of [[Westminster Palace]] in [[London]], United Kingdom. Simply known as the Westminster Clock Tower before 2012 when it was renamed during the Diamond Jubilee of Queen [[Elizabeth II]]. It houses the world famous bell Big Ben (the name of which is sometimes incorrectly used for the tower).

This tag is for the real life tower itself. For any other clock tower simply resembling the Elizabeth Tower, use [[clock tower]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #3770226

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Real world locations]]

title: pantyhose
body:
A type of hosiery made of a sheer material that covers from the waist to the toes. These are distinct from [[thighhighs]] which only cover the legs, and [[leggings]] which don't cover the feet. [[stirrup legwear|Stirrup]] or other kinds of [[toeless legwear]] that reach the waist do not count as pantyhose either.

For tagging purposes, this tag should be used for most skintight [[tag group:legwear|legwear]] that covers from the waist to the toes, including tights.
