title: eva_08
body:
A [[super robot]] [[mecha]] from [[Rebuild of Evangelion]].

Designed by [[Yamashita Ikuto]].

title: eva_02
body:
A [[Evangelion (mecha)|]], piloted by [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]].

Unit-02 is predominantly red with orange highlights, and possesses [[multiple eyes|four]] small [[green eyes]].

The unit was once piloted by [[Makinami Mari Illustrious]], who displayed the hidden "Beast Mode" that purged cylinders from all over the unit and caused it to open up a gigantic maw.

Designed by [[Yamashita Ikuto]].
other_names: エヴァンゲリオン弐号機
エヴァンゲリオン2号機

title: eva_00
body:
A [[mecha]] in [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], piloted by [[Ayanami Rei]].

[b]Eva-00[/b] was the first operational Evangelion. Being a prototype, it was not originally equipped for combat, but was later upgraded and brought into battle against the [[Angel (Evangelion)|Angels]].

Eva-00 is the most unstable of the Evangelions, going wildly berserk on two occasions: once during its activation experiment with Rei, and again during its interchangeability experiment with [[Ikari Shinji|Shinji]]. Despite these incidents, Rei retains good control over the Eva once it is operational, using it successfully in quite sensitive tasks such as handling the [[Lance of Longinus (Evangelion)|]] on two occasions, and both fetching and firing the SDF's positron cannon.

Designed by [[Yamashita Ikuto]].
other_names: エヴァンゲリオン零号機

title: eva_05
body:
A [[super robot]] [[mecha]] from [[Rebuild of Evangelion]].

Designed in real life by [[Yamashita Ikuto]].
other_names: エヴァンゲリオン仮設5号機

title: rx-78-2_solomon_express_g-2
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It appeared in [[Dengeki Hobby]] Magazine in 1999.

The [b]RX-78-2 "Solomon Express" G-2[/b] is an [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]] heavily modified to carry [[nuclear weapon]]s.

Designed by [[Kobayashi Makoto (illustrator)|]].

title: qubeley
body:
A fictional antagonist [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985 and also appears in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

The [b]AMX-004 Qubeley[/b] is a revolutionary Newtype use [[mobile suit]] produced by [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]]. By miniaturizing the original psycommu system from the [[Elmeth]] and perfecting the [[funnels_(gundam)|"funnel"]] remote weapons, it combines overwhelming firepower and mobility in a normal-sized MS. The formidable Qubeley served as Haman Karn's personal machine in both [[Zeta Gundam|The Gryps Conflict]] and [[Gundam ZZ|The First Neo Zeon War]], and it was regarded as a fearsome, nigh-unstoppable unit even when pitted against the almost impractically powerful [[ZZ Gundam]].

The [[Qubeley Mk II]] is a later variant, piloted by [[Elpeo Puru]] and later [[Puru Two]].

It was designed by [[Nagano Mamoru]].

h4. See also

* [[Qubeley Mass Production Type]]
* [[Demeter (Mobile Suit)]]

title: pkd_blaster
body:
The [b]Phlanger-Katsumata "Doppelgänger" (PKD)[/b] series blaster is a futuristic looking [[handgun]] from the 1982 film [[Blade Runner (series)|]].

Because of its stopping power it is the weapon of choice of most Blade Runners when "retiring" [[Replicant]]s. 

The prop for the film was developed using parts from a [[revolver]] and the firing mechanism of an old Austrian battle [[rifle]]. The name of the weapon comes from the initials of the author [[Philip K. Dick]], who wrote the short story the movie was based on.
other_names: デッカードブラスター

title: syd_mead
body:
An American visual concept artist born in 1933, known for his mechanical designs in films such as [[Blade Runner (1982 movie)|]] (the [[Spinner]]), [[Aliens (1986)|]] (the [[Sulaco]] [[spacecraft]]), [[Tron]] (the lightcycles, digital tanks, solar sailer, and Sark's carrier designs) and [[2010 (book)|]] (the Leonov spaceship). He also worked on the designs for the [[Turn A Gundam]] [[mecha]] series and the aborted [[Yamato2520]] (a sequel to [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]]).

He died on December 30, 2019 at the age of 86.

h4. See also

* [[Syd Mead (designer)]]
* [[Syd Mead (style)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Syd Mead":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syd_Mead]

title: gundam_mk_v
body:
A [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]].

The [b]ORX-013 Gundam Mk-V[/b] [[mobile suit]] was designed by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]]' Augusta Research Lab as a refined version of the [[Psycho Gundam]].

One prototype was stolen by the New Desides, and was later piloted by Brave Cod in battle against the [[Ex-S Gundam]], and defeated by Ryou Roots and his AI co-pilot A.L.I.C.E.

Another Gundam Mk-V unit was given to the AEUG and assigned to [[Amuro Ray]], though there is no depiction of him piloting this mobile suit yet. Another prototype was stolen by the Axis [[Zeon]] and used as the base for the [[Doven Wolf|Döven Wolf]]; a captured Doven Wolf was then used as a testbed for the Quasi-Psycomu system and remodeled later into the [[Silver Bullet (mobile suit)|]].

Designed by [[Akitaka Mika]] and debuted in the photo-novel [[Gundam Sentinel]].

title: buchi_holes
body:
A pattern of five (sometimes more) vent-like holes found as a trademark design element on [[mecha]] designs by [[Izubuchi Yutaka]].

Usually arranged in a trapezoidal pattern of three above and two below. Often found in pairs along the sides of mecha head units, or on the shoulder pauldrons. The [[AV-98 Ingram]] features them on both its head (3+2, rotated) and shoulder (3+4) units.

h4. Examples

* !post #4121137

h4. Notable characters

* [[AV-98 Ingram]] ([[Kidou Keisatsu Patlabor]])
* [[Hygogg|MSM-03C Hygogg]] ([[gundam_0080|Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket]])
* [[Z'Gok-E|MSM-07E Z'Gok-E]] ([[gundam_0080|Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket]])
* [[Guncannon MP Type|RX-77D Guncannon Mass Production Type]]  ([[gundam_0080|Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket]]) 
* [[G-Spring Goddess (Ishiyumi)|]] ("The Goddess of the G-Spring":[/pools/17110])

title: automata_topaz
body: [[Emil Chronicle Online]] character

title: sazabi
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It appears in the 1988 anime movie [[Char's Counterattack]].

The [b]MSN-04 Sazabi[/b] is the personal [[Neo Zeon]] [[mobile suit]] of [[Char Aznable]] and one of the most advanced mobile suits of its time in U.C. 0093, together with [[Amuro Ray]]'s RX-93 [[Nu Gundam]]. Both mobile suits are equipped with the revolutionary [[Psycho Frame]] technology. 

Sazabi's body is all red with a single green eye, yellow thrusters, yellow hoses, and yellow insignias and emblems adorning its body. It is equipped with a [[beam rifle]], two [[energy sword|beam sabers]], a beam tomahawk, a [[shield]] containing missiles, a beam particle gun on the torso and six [[funnels (gundam)|]]. Its head resembles Char's helmet from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]].

It was designed by [[Izubuchi Yutaka]].

h4. See also

* [[Prototype Sazabi]]
* [[Nu Gundam]]
* [[Sinanju]]
* [[Nightingale (gundam)|]]
* [[Varguil]]

title: vf-0d
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] universe. 

In the [[Macross Zero]] OVA series, the [b]VF-0D[/b] is a two pilot variant of the [[VF-0]] Phoenix variable fighter equipped with delta wings, [[canards]], a single head-mounted [[laser]], a [[gunpod]] and several [[missile]]s.

This mecha is used for training purposes mostly, but is also combat capable. 

It is the mecha of choice for [[U.N. Spacy]] combat [[pilot]] [[Kudou Shin]] and his RIO [[Edgar Lasalle]].

It was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]].

title: zuikaku_(girls_und_panzer)
body:
A gigantic [[aircraft carrier]] from [[Girls und Panzer]] owned by the Ooarai school. It is based on the real life [[Zuikaku_(aircraft_carrier)|]], but ten times bigger, stated to be over 2,500 meters long. The vessel served as the location of the school and a mobile stadium for the [i]Sensha-do[/i] tournament.

Ironically, it is shown to be smaller than the Girls und Panzer [[ark royal (girls und panzer)|Ark Royal]], despite the real-world [[zuikaku_(aircraft_carrier)|Zuikaku]] being larger than the real-world Ark Royal.

title: white_gundam
body:
[b]RX-78-02 "White" Gundam[/b] is the original [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[Mobile Suit]] as it appears in the alternate Universal Century Timeline of [[Gundam Gquuuuuux]]. 

It was captured by [[Char Aznable]] along with the [[White Base]] and upgraded by the Principality of [[Zeon]] into the [[Red Gundam]]. Char pilots it throughout the One Year War to great effect, securing victory for Zeon.

It was designed by [[Yamashita Ikuto]] based in the original design by [[Ookawara Kunio]] and [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]].

h4. See also

* [[RX-78-01 Gundam]]

title: angel_(evangelion)
body:
A set of seventeen (possibly eighteen) varied, generally antagonistic, very powerful and very bizarre looking [[alien]] [[monster]]s in [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]].

They serve as monsters of the week for the original series. Most of their designs are based on [[biblically accurate angel|the original scary and very bizarre depictions]] of [[Angel]]s in the [[christianity|Christian]] [[The Bible|Bible]].

h4. List of Angels

* 1st - [[Adam (evangelion)|]]
* 2nd - [[Lilith (evangelion)|]]
* 3rd - [[Sachiel (evangelion)|]]
* 4th - [[Shamshel (evangelion)|]]
* 5th - [[Ramiel (evangelion)|]]
* 6th - [[Gaghiel (evangelion)|]]
* 7th - [[Israfel (evangelion)|]]
* 8th - [[Sandalphon (evangelion)|]]

* 11th - [[Iruel]]
* 12th - [[Leliel (evangelion)|]]
* 13th - [[Bardiel (evangelion)|]]
* 14th - [[Zeruel (evangelion)|]]
* 15th - [[Arael]]
* 16th - [[Armisael (evangelion)|]]
* 17th - Tabris
* 18th - Lilin

h6. Other

* [[Seventh Angel (Evangelion 2.0)|Seventh Angel]] ([[Evangelion: 2.0 You can (not) Advance|Rebuild of Evangelion: 2.0 You can (not) Advance]])
* [[Arael-XX]] ([[Angel Chromosome XX]])
* [[Diemay Angel]]
* [[Leliel-XX]] ([[Angel Chromosome XX]])
* [[Sahaquiel-XX]] ([[Angel Chromosome XX]])
* [[Tabris-XX]] ([[Angel Chromosome XX]])

h4. See also

* [[Lance of Longinus (Evangelion)]]

title: arael
body: The fifteenth [[Angel (evangelion)|]] from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], it has the form of a massive, [[glowing]] winged creature. The Angel's core is held outside of its body by the appendages on its underbelly.

title: bardiel_(evangelion)
body: The thirteenth [[Angel (evangelion)|]] from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]. It apparently possesses all the properties and strengths of [[EVA 03]], and it can also stretch the Eva's arms to a distance roughly equal to the Eva's height.

title: iruel
body: The eleventh [[Angel (evangelion)|]] from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]. It is a nano-scale entity, similar to a virus. Rather than "moving" in the conventional sense, the Angel seems to simply spread by rapidly reproducing at the cellular level.

title: matariel
body: The ninth [[Angel (evangelion)]] from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]. It has the appearance of a massive [[arachnid]]-like creature with numerous eyes.

title: sachiel_(evangelion)
body:
[[Alien]] [[monster]] character from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]].

[b]Sachiel[/b] is the third [[Angel_(evangelion)|]] and the first Angel to attack [[Tokyo-3 (city)|]]. It is a massive, vaguely humanoid creature with large bony structures on its shoulders and torso, gill-like structures on its legs, tridactyl hands, and a distinctive beaked face.

Designed by [[Asari Yoshitoo]].

title: lilith_(evangelion)
body:
The second [[Angel_(evangelion)|]] from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]] who initially appears as a white, legless giant, whose face is covered with a mask displaying the logo of [[Seele (evangelion)|]]. Numerous human-like legs protrude from its legless stumps, it was at first thought to be [[Adam (evangelion)|]] and is usually seen stuck to a [[crucifix]] and bleeding [[LCL]]. 

Not to be confused with [[Lilith (Ayanami Rei)]], which refers to the all-white giant [[Ayanami Rei|Rei]] version which appears in [[The End of Evangelion]]. 

[spoilers]Later in the series it is revealed that all human beings are the spawn of Lilith, and that humanity as a whole is actually the 18th angel, [b]Lilin[/b].[/spoilers]

h4. See also

* [[Black Moon Lilith]]

title: adam_(evangelion)
body:
The first [[Angel (evangelion)|]] from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]. It appeared just before Second Impact as a "giant of light" that resembles an [[eva_01|Eva]], and was also shown to have four wings.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #20973941: Adam appearing as a "Giant of Light"
* !asset #20973927: Adam as an embryo following the Second Impact.
other_names: アダム(エヴァンゲリオン)

title: 12_billion_yen_incident
body:
A real life incident in which the race horse [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|Gold Ship]] lost a race due to erratic behavior, causing betting losses of approximately twelve billion yen.

The incident happened at the 2015 [[Takarazuka Kinen]], where Gold Ship was the guaranteed favorite to win. Just as the race began, Gold Ship randomly reared up (possibly angered by a horse in an adjacent stall) and held that pose for some time, turning some twelve billion yen worth of bets into smoke.

The [[Umamusume]] [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] is sometimes drawn [[parody]]ing this incident. The anime version of Umamusume also made a reference to the incident in the first OVA episode, complete with [[Hosoe Junko]] (commentator) screaming as she did in the broadcast of the real life version.

h4. See also

* [[Gold Ship (racehorse)]] 
* [[Gold Ship (Umamusume)]] 

h4. External links

* "Youtube: 2015 Takarazuka Kinen":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lv0Mbd1ZPCk]
* "Youtube: Comparison of the 12 billion yen incident as depicted in the Umamusume Anime and in real-life":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=011A2xkdL4k]

title: sasaki_kazuhiro
body:
Sasaki "Daimajin" Kazuhiro is a [[real life]] retired baseball pitcher for the [[Yokohama Dena Baystars]] (NPB) and later [[Seattle Mariners]] (MLB).

He is also the owner of several accomplished race horses, all of which are offsprings or grandchildren of "Halwa Sweet":[https://www.jbis.jp/horse/0000727544/]: Namely [[Verxina (racehorse)|]], [[Cheval Grand (racehorse)|]], and [[Vivlos (racehorse)|]] (of whose [[Umamusume]] counterparts make up the [[V Sisters]] grouping). This was due to him seeing how Halwa Sweet was an accomplished racehorse in spite of the handicap of being born without a tail.

title: gquuuuuux
body:
Namesake [[mecha]] of [[gundam_gquuuuuux|Mobile Suit Gundam GQuuuuuuX]].  Pronounced "gee-KWUCKS", after the computer science metasyntactic variable [i]quux[/i]. 

The [b]gMS-Ω Gundam QuuuuuuX[/b] is the latest [[mobile suit]] of the Principality of [[Zeon]], utilizing Omega-Psycommu technology developed from the [[Red Gundam]].

It is also notable for being the first lead Gundam to be equipped with an [[axe]], which is usually a signature weapon of antagonist mass production type mobile suits, such as the [[Zaku II]]'s [[heat hawk]].

It was designed by [[Yamashita Ikuto]] (famous for designing all the robots from [[neon genesis evangelion|Evangelion]]).

h4. See also

* [[GFreD]]
other_names: エンディミオン・ユニット

title: gogg
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

The [b]MSM-03 Gogg[/b] is the first truly amphibious [[mobile suit]] developed by [[Zeon]], intended to replace the poorly suited (and never mass produced) experimental [[Zaku Mariner]]. Unfortunately, it relied too much on the water to cool its massive reactors, and was extremely impractical in combat. 

Its basic design was a breakthrough, however, and it went on to inspire not only a successor unit, the [[Hygogg]], but also other great amphibious MSs such as the [[Acguy]] family and the successful [[Z'Gok]].

The basic design of the Gogg was inspired by the [[Boss Borot]] from the [[Mazinger Z]] [[super robot]] series.

h4. See also

* [[Jurick_(mobile_suit)|]]

title: fbz-99g
body:
The [b]FBz-99G Zaubergeran[/b] are enemy [[variable fighter]] [[mecha]] from the [[Macross 7]] TV series.

They were created by the [[Protodeviln]] aliens for their new [[Varauta]] Army using [[VA-3]] variable mecha from the Megaroad-13 colony fleet.

Designed in real life by [[Kawamori Shouji]] and [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

title: az-130a
body:
The [b]Az-130A Panzersoln[/b] or [b]Panzerzorene[/b] are an enemy variable fighter [[mecha]] from the [[Macross 7]] TV series.

They are a more powerful variant of the [[Varauta]] [[Fz-109A]].

Designed in real life by [[Kawamori Shouji]] and [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

body:
The [b]VF-14 Vampire[/b] is a variable fighter [[mecha]] that appeared in the [[Macross M3]] [[video game]]. 

It also appeared (in a heavily modified form) as the [[Fz-109a]] [[Elgerzorene]] in the [[Macross 7]] anime series.

Designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] for the game and the series.

title: fz-109a
body:
The [b]Fz-109A Elgerzorene[/b] or [b]Elegerzoln[/b] are the main enemy variable fighter [[mecha]] from the [[Macross 7]] TV series.

They were created by the [[Protodeviln]] aliens for their new [[Varauta]] Army using the [[VF-14]] variable fighters from the Megaroad-13 colony fleet after they captured it.

title: fz-109f
body:
An antagonist [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] series. It first appeared in the [[Macross 7]] TV series from 1994.

The [b]Fz-109F Pantherzoln[/b] or [b]Pantherzorene[/b] is a commander version of the [[Varauta]] [[Fz-109A]] [[variable fighter]]. One unit was used by [[Protodeviln]] commander [[Gigile]].

title: castor_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character first appearing in the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt as one of [[Kirschtaria Wodime]]'s servants. He is [[Pollux (fate)|]]'s [[twins|twin]] brother, the two together making up the Saber-class servant [b]Disocuri[/b]. Based off of the Greek mythological character of the same name. Unlike his sister, he is not a child of [[Zeus (fate)|]] and is a mortal human. [spoiler]Because of his anger on having his divinity removed in later legends (resulting in him being remembered as a human), he qualifies for the Avenger-class, and only appears as a Saber because he's summoned alongside his sister.[/spoiler] The two were immortalized in the [[Gemini (constellation)|]] constellation.

The two voice actors for the Dioscuri, [[Uchida Maaya]] and [[Uchida Yuuma]], are [[brother and sister]] in real life.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Taiki (luster)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Uchida Maaya]]

title: war_of_the_worlds
body:
[b]The War of the Worlds[/b] is a classic [[science fiction]] novel published by English writer H. G. Wells in 1898. 

It is the first person narrative of an unnamed protagonist's odyssey in Surrey and London as [[Earth (planet)|]] is invaded and devastated by [[alien]]s from [[Mars (planet)|]]. Written in 1895–1897, the book is one of the earliest realistic stories that details a conflict between mankind and a more advanced and hostile extraterrestrial race. 

At the time of publication it was classified as a scientific romance. The War of the Worlds has been both popular (having never gone out of print) and influential, spawning half a dozen feature films, radio dramas, a record album, various comic book adaptations, a television series, and sequels or parallel stories by other authors. It is one of the first works of fiction known to depict alien [[mecha]].

h4. See also

* [[War of the Worlds (2025)]] 
* [[Tripod (mecha)]]

title: gundam_team
body:
A team of young [[Mobile Suit]] [[mecha]] and [[starfighter]] [[pilot]]s from the [[Gundam]] series. They first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

The team was created by [[Bright Noa]]. Its members are stationed onboard the [[AEUG]] [[space]] battleship [[Argama]] and later the [[Nahel Argama]].

The trope of a group of young pilots operating different Gundams would be used years later in other Gundam series like [[Gundam Wing]] and [[Gundam 00]].

title: bar-gm
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Under The Gundam: Double Fake]] (1988) and also appears in [b][[Gundam F90]]: Fastest Formula[/b] (2019).

The [b]MSA-008/RGM-87 BR-GM (BAR-GM)[/b], also called the [b]Bar-Jim[/b], it is an [[Earth Federation]] redesign of the cheap -but extremely capable - [[Barzam]] mass produced multi-role combat [[mobile suit]] once used by the defeated [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]].

In real life it was designed by [[Ookawara Kunio]] (designer of the [[gm_(mobile_suit)|GM]]) and [[Moriki Yasuhiro]].

title: gfred
body:
A [[mecha]] from [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]]. Its name is pronounced "gee-FRED", after the computer science metasyntactic variable [i]fred[/i].

[b]gMS-κ Gundam FreD[/b] is the second Newtype use [[mobile suit]] of the Gundam [[GQuuuuuuX]] line developed by [[Zeon]] from technology tested in the [[Red Gundam]] and the GQuuuuuuX. It can be remotely operated by the Newtype pilot and is equipped with powerful beam weapons and [[funnels (gundam)|]]. 

It has purple and green colors like those of the [[EVA 01]] from [[neon genesis evangelion|Evangelion]] (which was also designed by [[Yamashita Ikuto]]).

It is piloted by [[Nyaan (gundam gquuuuuux)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #9397918

title: eva_01
body:
A [[mecha]] in [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], piloted by [[Ikari Shinji]]. 

Arguably the most famous [[evangelion_(mecha)|Evangelion unit]], [b]EVA-01[/b] has a predominantly purple body with neon green highlights, yellowish eyes and a characteristic [[single horn]] that distinguishes it from the other EVAs. 

It has the hidden ability to go berserk, in which case its eyes glow red and a large mouth opens itself from the Evangelion's faceplate. In [[Evangelion: 2.0 You Can (Not) Advance]], the unit undergoes a process called "Pseudo-Evolution" after devouring [[Zeruel (evangelion)|]], where its green highlights become red and a shining [[halo]] materializes around the horn. In this form, the unit's left arm may or may not be a glowing construct.

In the original series it is revealed that [[Ikari Yui]]'s essence fused with the mecha during a pilot test, turning it into [[Ikari Shinji|Shinji]]'s actual mother.

Character designed by [[Yamashita Ikuto]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #469819

h4. See also

* [[GFred]] - A similar looking mecha from the [[Gundam Gquuuuuux]] anime series
other_names: エヴァンゲリオン初号機

title: gundam_0080
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket[/b] ([i]Kidō Senshi Gandamu 0080 Poketto no Naka no Sensō[/i]) is a six episode 1989 Japanese [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] original video animation series. 

It is the first OVA series in the [[Gundam]] franchise and also the first main Gundam anime to feature a female Gundam pilot main protagonist. It was directed by Takayama Fumihiko, written by Yamaga Hiroyuki with character designs by [[Mikimoto Haruhiko]].

As suggested by its subtitle, [I]War in the Pocket[/I], it is a small personal "coming of age" series; a serious side story focusing on the experiences of an idealistic and naive eleven-year-old civilian boy during the last part of The One Year War in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] and his learning of the meaning of friendship, love, war and death. 

A crude, realistic and significant departure for the Gundam franchise at the time, Gundam 0080 has received wide acclaim from critics over time.

The realism in the series and its focus in side story regular soldier and civilian characters paved the way for other more serious Gundam works like [[Gundam 0083]] and [[Gundam 08th MS Team]].

title: zaku_ii
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. Notable because it has the distinction of being the first robot featured during the beginning of the entire franchise.

The [b]MS-06 Zaku II[/b] is the main combat [[mobile suit]] of the Principality of [[Zeon]] during the One Year War. Originating from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] as the [[Zaku II F/J]], there have been several variations of this mobile suit. Characterized by its domed head, [[shoulder_spikes|spiked shoulder]], [[one-eyed|one eye]]/head-mounted camera, and (typical) dark green color. 

In universe, the deployment of this MS was the direct cause for the development of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] by the [[Earth Federation]].

In real life, the Zaku II was designed by [[Ookawara Kunio]] in the late 70s.

This tag refers to specific group of mecha found in the gundam universe's One Year War setting and should not be used as a character tag.

title: zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)
body:
The [b]MSZ-006 Zeta Gundam[/b] is the first transformable lead Gundam-type [[mobile suit]] [[mecha]] in the entire [[Gundam]] franchise, and the titular mobile suit of [[zeta_gundam|Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam]]. It also appears in the [[Gundam ZZ]] sequel series.

The Ζeta's design was revolutionary in many ways (both in and out of the anime), and in the UC timeline looked very different from previous models of the Gundam type of Mobile Suit. One example of the physical difference is that the Zeta has a ventless mouthpiece and a white, sharp chin. This head design is also present in some mobile suits of the Project Zeta such as the [[S Gundam]]. The transformation ability and the suit's great speed is its signature quality, as its transformation is fluid and integrated into its combat style often giving it grace unrivaled by most MS. 

The Zeta Gundam transforms into a fighter-like form called the [[Wave Rider]] Mode. This grants the Zeta not only enhanced speed and mobility, but also the ability to make an atmospheric re-entry from [[space]] on its own without the aid of ballute packs or other external re-entry systems. With the Zeta Gundam's powerful Biosensor activated, the Waverider Mode can be used as a deadly weapon called the [[Waverider Crash]].

This mobile suit has many pilots for the record, but is famously known to be designed and piloted by [[Kamille Bidan]] during The Gryps War in [[Zeta Gundam]]. During The First Neo Zeon War in [[Gundam ZZ]] it was piloted by [[Gundam Team]] member [[Roux Louka]].

In real life, it was designed by [[Fujita Kazumi]] and its transformation was planned by [[Ookawara Kunio]].

h4. See also

* [[Prototype Zeta Gundam X1]]
* [[Z II Gundam]]

title: psycho_gundam_(gquuuuuux)
body:
A [[mecha]] in [[Gundam]]. It is an alternate version of the [[Psycho Gundam]] mecha as it appears in the anime [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]].

The [b]MRX-010 Psycho Gundam[/b] is a transforming [[mobile armor]] piloted by [[Deux Murasame]]. It has a [[reactive armor]] that can be ejected and used as a defensive field and attacking weapon by the Newtype pilot, as well as several powerful [[beam cannon]]s.

Curiously, this version of the Psycho Gundam shares its model number (and purple colors) with the the original Psycho Gundam's [[psycho gundam mk ii|Mk II]] in this continuity.

h4. See also

* [[Deux Murasame]]

title: barbara_(genshin_impact)
body: A playable Hydro character in [[Genshin Impact]]; her full name is Barbara Pegg, voiced by [[Kitou Akari]] (JP) and [[Laura Stahl]] (EN). [quote]"The Deaconess of the Favonius Church and a shining starlet adored by all. Although the concept of a starlet is rather novel in a city of bards, the people of Mondstadt love Barbara nonetheless."[/quote] Barbara has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], styled into [[twin drills]]. She wears a [[white dress]] with a [[detached collar]], as well as [[detached sleeves|detached]], [[puffy long sleeves|puffy sleeves]]. For legwear, she wears [[white pantyhose]] and [[fold-over boots]]. Her older sister is [[Jean (genshin impact)|]], the Acting Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius. h4. title: elmeth
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

The [b]MAN-08 Elmeth[/b] is a massive Newtype using [[mobile armor]] developed by the Principality of [[Zeon]] in cooperation with the Flanagan Newtype Research Institute. It carried an oversized, early experimental Psycommu system, allowing its pilot to control the lethal "[[bit (gundam)|]]" remote weapons, as well as two 90° forward mounted [[beam cannon|mega-particle guns]]. It was piloted by [[Lalah Sune]].

It appears in episode 9 of [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]] where it is called The Rose of Sharon. In the GQuuuuuux universe it was never produced and its Psycommu system and bits went on to be used in the [[Red Gundam]]. However, an Elmeth from an [[alternate universe]] was last seen underwater and was being resurfaced by Zeon.

In Japan, it was notorious for its name in katakana being exactly the same as [[Hermes (brand)]], requiring merchandises to have a workaround to it, such as ララァ専用モビルアーマー (Lalah's Mobile Armor).

h4. See also

* [[Psycho Gundam]]: a later mecha developed using the same giant Psycommu system
* [[Is this the Rose of Sharon? (meme)]]
other_names: ララァ専用モビルアーマー

title: gm_cannon_ii
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in the [[Gundam 0083]] OVA from 1991.

The [b]RGC-83 GM Cannon II[/b] is a vastly improved version of the original [[GM Cannon]] [[mobile suit]], featuring a much more higher output reactor capable of powering twin beam cannons as opposed to a single shell-firing artillery gun and a beam saber, as well as a modified version of the [[Gundam Alex]]'s Chobham [[Reactive Armor]] package for great durability - however, the type paid for it dearly, being severely hindered in its mobility.

title: reactive_armor
body:
External modular armor packages used in [[tank]]s and other real life modern [[military vehicle]]s. Reactive armor actively reduces the damage a vehicle equipped with it receives, instead of passively resisting it like traditional armor.  

The most common type of reactive armor currently is [b]Explosive Reactive Armor[/b] ([b]ERA[/b]), which will detonate when penetrated and impair or deflect the incoming projectile.  This type of armor appears as tiles or plates fitted on top of the normal armor of the vehicle equipped with it. Once their protective surface is spent they can be removed to save weight.

This system is also featured in several [[mecha]] from realistic sci-fi anime and manga.

h4. Examples

* !post #8227366: The square bricks covering the tank

h4. See also

title: dead_by_daylight
body:
An asymmetrical multiplayer (4vs1) [[horror (theme)|]] game where one player takes on the role of the savage Killer, and the other four players play as Survivors, trying to escape the Killer and avoid being caught, tortured and killed.

Survivors play in third-person and have the advantage of better situational awareness. The Killer plays in first-person and is more focused on their prey.

A dating sim spinoff titled [[Hooked on You]] was later released on August 2022.

title: ghostface
body:
Ghostface is the killer of the [[Scream (movie)|]] series of horror movies. Ghostface dresses in a "Father Death" costume with black robes and a distinctive "ghost face" mask.

A version of Ghostface appears in [[Dead by Daylight]], but is not licensed from the Scream film and wears a different costume aside from the mask, likely due to the fact that the iconic mask is in fact a royalty free prop.

title: ikezoe_ken'ichi
body:
[[Real life]] Japanese [[jockey]] nicknamed "the Grand Prix man" as he had won seven Grand Prixs during his career out of his 27 G1 victories. Among horseracing and [[Umamusume]] fans, Ikezoe is more known for his misfortune of being saddled with "difficult" horses for most of his career.

title: kansas_(azur_lane)
body:
Third ship reveal of Priority Research VIII.

[[Azur Lane]]'s and [[World of Warships]] personification of the South Dakota Battleship Dreadnought  (1920). This design was later improved from the South Dakota 1920 Super Dreadnoughts; they were paused due to the [[Battle of Jutland]] and cancelled few years later.

Kansas is the continued what-if scenario if they continued to create more powerful battleships by 1944 alongside the Colorado-class battleships. The South Dakota class dreadnoughts are the successors of the Colorado-class battleships, surpassing them with a speed of 23 knots. Coming with a Vermont style Acceleration system, she carried triple 406mm mounts and a very advanced anti-air suite for her time.

h4. Appearance

* !post #9611536: Profile

h4. External links

* "The South Dakota Class Battleship":[https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/NH_44895_South_Dakota_class_battleship_%28BB_49-54%29.tif/lossy-page1-1200px-NH_44895_South_Dakota_class_battleship_%28BB_49-54%29.tif.jpg]
* "USS Kansas in World of Warships (South Dakota-class 1944 version)":[https://wows-blog-storage.gcdn.co/media/80/phpdEKbfc]
other_names: カンザス(アズールレーン)

title: earth_federation
body:
The [b]Earth Federation[/b] (or [b]EF[/b]) is the planetary governmental body from the Universal Century based [[Gundam]] series. 

They first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] series from 1979 and are enemies of the Principality of [[Zeon]]. 

This organization was heavily inspired by the Allies of [[World War II]], and the [[United Nations]].

h4. [[Mobile Suit]]s

* [[Ball (Gundam)]]
* [[Prototype Gundam]]
* [[RX-78-2 Gundam]]
* [[Ground Gundam]]
* [[Guncannon]]
* [[Guntank]]
* [[GM (Mobile Suit)]]
* [[Ground GM]]

h4.See also

* [[General Revil]] - Supreme Commander of the Earth Federation Military Forces
* [[Earth Federation Space Forces]]
* [[Titans (Gundam)]]
* [[Char's Counterattack]]
* [[U.N. Spacy]] - A similar organization from the [[MACROSS]] franchise.

title: yuuka_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. She serves as the treasurer for Millennium's student council, [[Seminar (blue archive)|]]. Her full name is Hayase Yuuka.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blue_hair|dark blue]]/[[purple hair]] tied into a [[two side up]] decorated with [[triangle hair ornament|triangular]] [[headgear]], [[blue eyes]] with [[red pupils]] and a [[mechanical halo]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black suit|black]] [[skirt suit]] with a [[white jacket]] on top, [[black gloves]] [[half gloves]] and [[black boots|black]] [[ankle boots]]. She carries a pair of [[sig mpx|SIG Sauer MPX-K]] [[submachine gun]]s.

Periodically subjected to [[fat joke]]s in fanart due to her "[[100kg (meme)|]] thighs". In [[World of Warships]], she herself helms the Ancient Ship Utpanishtim.

Voiced by: [[Haruka Ran]]
Original artist: [[hwansang]]

h4. Appearance

body:

Carries a [[True Velocity RM338]]. Her role is to make [[graffiti]] on any of the walls or buildings. Maki also paired with [[Binah (Blue Archive)|]] not too long before her own ship (which is Binah herself) debuted in [[World Of Warships]].

title: wakamo_(blue_archive)
body:
A playable character from [[Blue Archive]]. Her full name is Kosaka Wakamo.

One of the "Seven Prisoners" that escaped from the Corrections Bureau. Formerly from Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy before being suspended. Known as the "Fox of Calamity", she is an arsonist and terrorist who loves to cause chaos and destruction wherever she goes, and even rallies others students to join her. She also has a strong affection (borderline obsession) for [[Sensei_(blue_archive)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a [[multicolored hair|hint]] or [[red hair|red]], [[yellow eyes]], [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]] adorned with a [[tail ribbon]]. She's dressed in a [[black kimono]] with a [[floral print]], a [[flower choker]], [[high heel boots]] with a [[torn_thighhighs|torn]] [[single thighhigh]], and a [[fox mask]] that makes her eyes [[glowing_eyes|glow]] [[red eyes|red]]. She uses an [[Arisaka]]-type [[bolt action]] [[rifle]] with a [[tassel]] decorated [[bayonet]].

Wakamo commands the Zubr-class [[hovercraft]], with several armaments and a deployable radar. She helms the same hovercraft in [[World of Warships]] although in a bigger, badder, battleship scale.

Voiced by: [[Saitou Chiwa]]
Original artist: [[NAMYO]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #5634085: Default
* !post #6339744: [[Wakamo (Swimsuit) (blue archive)|Swimsuit]]

h4. External links

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Wakamo":[https://bluearchive.wiki/wiki/Wakamo]
other_names: ワカモ(ブルーアーカイブ)

title: ia_(vocaloid)
body:
IA is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by 1st Place Co., Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID3 engine. She gained an English vocal in 2018 with the [[CeVIO]] engine.

Developed for the "-ARIA ON THE PLANETES-," project, her voice provider is the famous singer, Lia. She was illustrated by [[Akasaka Aka]].  She has [[very long hair|very long]], light [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[hair ornament]]s. She wears a loose black top- over a [[tank top]], pink [[pleated skirt]], and white [[boots]]. Her legwear is [[uneven legwear|asymmetrical]] and she has a [[thigh strap]].

h4. Official art
* !post #1045204
* !post #7760706: [[IA (rocks) (vocaloid)|IA Rocks]]

h4. See also

title: metroid:_zero_mission
body:
A remake of the original [[metroid_(classic)|Metroid]] game, released on the [[Game Boy Advance]] in 2004.  Zero Mission retells everything including Samus as a child being trained by the Chozodians in Zebes.

Much like the NES Classic, Zero mission introduced some new power ups and items that were not in the original, as well as Super Missiles and Power bombs borrowed from Super Metroid.

It introduced [[samus_aran|Samus's]] titular [[zero_suit|Zero Suit]].
other_names: メトロイドゼロミッション

title: james_doakes
body:
A character from the TV series [[dexter_(tv_series)|Dexter]] played by Erik King.

A former [[United states army|US Army]] Ranger who now works as a Police Detective for the Miami Police, Doakes has a major dislike with the main protagonist [[Dexter Morgan]], who finds his eccentric nature and seeming love of blood creepy and weird. While mostly ignoring Dexter in the beginning, Doakes becomes suspicious of Dexter after several clues and correctly suspects Dexter is the notorious serial killer vigilante, The Bay Harbor Butcher.

Doakes is famous for two [[meme]]s: his catchphrase "[i]Surprise Motherfucker[/i]!" which he says after he catches Dexter trying to open a shipping container during the 1st season finale of the show and in 2025 due to the release of the new [b]Dexter: Resurrection[/b] series, "[b]Suspicious Doakes[/b]", where he is looking at people suspiciously and correctly guess the truth (eg.suspects [[Clark Kent]] is [[Superman]] but has no proof).

title: dexter_(tv_series)
body:
An American television crime drama mystery series that aired on Showtime from October 1, 2006, to September 22, 2013. Set in Miami, the series centers on [[Dexter Morgan]] (Michael C. Hall), a forensic technician specializing in blood spatter pattern analysis for the fictional Miami Metro Police Department, who leads a secret parallel life as a vigilante serial killer, hunting down murderers who have slipped through the cracks of the justice system. The show's first season was derived from the novel Darkly Dreaming Dexter (2004), the first of the Dexter series novels by Jeff Lindsay. It was adapted for television by screenwriter James Manos, Jr., who wrote the first episode. Subsequent seasons evolved independently of Lindsay's works.

The series later had two sequels and a prequel. [b]Dexter: New Blood[/b], which aired from November 7, 2021 to January 9, 2022 on Showtime, is a miniseries that takes place ten years after the events of the original series, [b]Dexter: Original Sin[/b] a prequel taking place fifteen years before the original series, that aired from December 13, 2024 to February 14, 2025 on Paramount+ before being cancelled, and [b]Dexter: Resurrection[/b], a new series and sequel to New Blood which began airing on July 11, 2025 on Paramount+.

h4. See also
* [[but you can't prove it (meme)]]
* [[surprise motherfucker (meme)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Dexter (TV series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dexter_(TV_series)]

title: all_might
body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i]. The #1 superhero and a symbol of strength and the eighth hero of the "One For All" linage. He was mentored by [[Shimura Nana]] and in turn mentors [[Midoriya Izuku]].

His Quirk is "One for All", which allowed him to obtain any Quirks from those who were willing to give it for him, as well as capable of transferring it to the others.

All Might is known to have two forms;
* In his true form, he is [[emaciated|scrawny]] and almost skeletal, constantly [[coughing blood|coughing up blood]] and his hair is [[messy hair|messy]] with [[bangs]] hanging in front of his face, eyes visible.
* In his hero form, he is [[muscular male|muscular]], with the hair becoming [[hair slicked back|slicked-back]] and the two bangs turning into [[antenna hair]] pointing outwards of his head. At that time his eyes become [[covered eyes|covered]] [[shaded face|by the shade]] presumably cast by his eyebrows.

His true name is [[Yagi Toshinori]].

title: paramore
body:
An American rock band formed in Franklin, Tennessee, in 2004.

The band's current lineup, since 2017, consists of lead vocalist Hayley Williams, lead guitarist Taylor York, and drummer Zac Farro. Williams and Farro are founding members, with York, a high school friend, joining in 2007. Hayley Williams has been the only constant member throughout the band's history, which has seen several lineup changes.

The band has released six studio albums, including "All We Know Is Falling" (2005), "Riot!" (2007), "Brand New Eyes" (2009), "Paramore" (2013), "After Laughter" (2017), and "This Is Why" (2023). Their album "Paramore" gave them their first number one album on the US Billboard 200. Notable singles include "Misery Business," "The Only Exception," "Still Into You," and "Ain't It Fun." "Ain't It Fun" earned Williams and York a Grammy Award for Best Rock Song, marking the band's first Grammy win.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Paramore":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paramore]
